loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married and has seven children.  She lives in her own house that is without electricity and piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.  For the past fifteen years, she has operated a poultry selling business.  She sells to her neighbors and passersby.  Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the 10,000 KES loan she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feed.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed.

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru: Мухаббат хранительница очага своего дома и единственная надежда своих детей. Она разведена и сама воспитывает своих 2 детей. После окончания средней школы она не смогла поступить в университет по семейному состоянию. Она научилась у портнихи шитью и кройки женской одежды. Уже более 15 лет она занимается предоставлением услуги швеи. Она имеет свой цех, где она предоставляет услуги швеи. Мухаббат сама справляется с бизнесом, так как ее дети еще не совершеннолетние. Мухаббат уже несколько лет хочет отремонтировать свой дом, но не может сделать сбережения, так как она тратит свои деньги для обеспечения семьи. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 долларов США для покупки строительных материалов, как цемент, древесина и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Muhabbat is a homemaker and her children's only hope.  She is divorced and raises her two children by herself.  She completed secondary school, but was not able to go to a university because of her family situation.  Instead, she learned to cut and sew women's clothes from a seamstress, and she has now been involved in this activity for more than 15 years.  She provides sewing services in her own shop and runs her business by herself, since her children are still young.

Muhabbat has dreamed about renovating her house for a few years now, but she can never save enough money for repairs, as she spends everything to provide for her family.  She is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to buy building materials such as cement and wood.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement and wood to repair her house.

loans.name: Shareen

texts.en:
Shareen is a 39-year-old married man. He is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan.  For the past many years, Shareen has been in the clothing business.  He loves his family and his life ambition is to provide better facilities to his family.  The clothing business is the key to fulfill all of his family's needs.

He is running this business by purchasing variety of clothes from different areas and selling them in his shop. Shareen has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a variety of un-stitched clothes to sell.  Currently he does not have new varieties to offer to his customers so the number of his customers is decreasing day by day.  People prefer to purchase new varieties for new seasons and he do not have new variety to attract customers, so this is reducing his product selling and net income. 

The Kiva loan would help him to replace the old stock of the shop with new variety.  This would be helpful for him to attract a huge number of customers and to increase his net income. He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase new variety of unstitched clothing.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 32-year-old single man who has eighteen years of experience in a car wash. In 2008, he opened his own shop to improve his living and widen his working zone.
Ali is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to pay the price for new tools to develop his working habits and serve his clients in a better way.  His shop is very small, but he hopes to develop his business in a well-managed way so it will service an increased number of cars, grow into a larger shop and eventually start a modern automatic car wash.

loans.use: to pay the price for new tools for his car wash.

loans.name: Clauvis

texts.en:
Clauvis is a young Cameroonian age 33. He is married with six children - the oldest is eleven and in secondary school and the youngest is six and in primary school. 

He has been in his business for the past three years, which makes him very experienced and stable. His business is successful because it is located in an urban area where they bake bread, which makes the demand for firewood very high. 

He is likely to succeed because the demand for firewood is very high where his business is located. This loan will help him increase his revenue from 120,000 XAF to 397,000 XAF and his profit will increase by 25% per month. 

His standard of living will increase as well.

loans.use: to buy wood to split and sell.

loans.name: Godofredo

texts.es:
Don Godofredo de 43 con un nivel académico de 6° grado, agricultor,  casado y padre de 5 cinco de 22, 20, 18, 15 y 8 años de edad. Actualmente dependen solo 4  hijos y un nieto.


Se desempeña en la agricultura desde la edad de 15 años, el trabajo lo aprendió con su papá nunca se ha dedicado a otro trabajo tampoco tiene otras actividades económicas. Trabaja junto a su familia, el lugar en donde tiene sus cultivos esta a 15 minutos de la casa, trabaja  cinco horas diarias.

Con el préstamo solicitado a fundación CAMPO comprara  abono, y pagara quien le ayude a la preparación de la tierra, para sembrar chile, ejotes, tomate y pipianes  tendrá más producción, por lo que en ese momento va poder comprar lo más vital para su vida y estará satisfecho porque cultivara lo que el tiene.

Sus sueños son el preparar en sus estudios a sus hijos y sacarlos adelante  que todos los recursos que lleguen los inviertan en algo productivo y que en el siguiente año siempre tenga el apoyo de alguna institución.
texts.en: Godofredo is 43 with a sixth-grade education. A farmer, he is married with five children, ages 22, 20, 18, 15 and 8. Currently, four children and a grandson are dependents. He has made a living in farming since he was 15 years old. He learned the trade from his father, and he hasn't worked nor made money in any other activity. He works alongside his family on land about 15 minutes from home. He works five hours a day. With the loan, he plans to purchase fertilizer and pay for help to prepare his land to plant chili peppers, green beans, tomatoes and squash and increase his production. At the moment, he needs to buy what he needs most, and he will be satisfied because he will grow what he has. Godofredo's dreams are for his children to get an education and keeping making headway with all the resources they need to be productive, and to always have the support from some institution.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay for help to prepare the land to plant chili peppers, green beans, tomatoes and squash.

loans.name: Al-Salam Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-salam and consists of four ladies who live in Taiz, Yemen. Hamouda is living in a poor area in Taiz. She is a married woman and has children. 

She always suffers from cutting the electricity of her house. she accumulated a small amount to buy an electric generator to use for her house. so, she applied for a loan of 60,000 Yemen Rial (YER) from AMB to buy an electric generator to live comfortably with her family. she hopes to be funded by kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy an electric generator to live comfortably with her family.

loans.name: Sabir

texts.en:
Sabir is 37 years old client. He is married and has two kids. Sabir is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his family in the Bilasuvar IDP settlement. He has been raising livestock for the past seven years. 

He usually buys calves, raises and fattens them, then sells them at a profitable price. Selling meat is a worthwhile business because meat is an essential staple among the local people, who use it in many everyday dishes like dolma and pilov.

Sabir is a very kind and friendly young man. His monthly income is 140 AZN, which represents the sole financial income for the family. He reports that it is very difficult to cover the needs of the family with such a small income. Looking after the animals is also difficult, requiring that he spends most of his time outside. 

The economic climate in the region is one of austerity, but Sabir is a very positive man and his father supports and helps him a great deal.

Sabir has applied for a loan in the amount of 1,500 Azerbaijan New Manat (AZN), with which he will buy two milk cows and three calves. This will be his third loan and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy two milk cows and three calves.

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es: Maximiliana es una mujer de 35 años, vive junto su esposo y sus dos hijos en su casa construida a base de adobe. Maximiliana se dedica a la producción de cacao orgánico y otros productos rentables de su localidad hace más de 15 años. Tiene la suerte de contar con unos terrenos muy productivas en cuanto a calidad de los productos. Poseen un terreno de 3 hectáreas en donde desempeña su labor diariamente. Tras realizar el reemplazo de varios árboles de cacao desfasados viene fertilizando sus terrenos únicamente con abono orgánico ya que es la única manera de desempeñar una agricultura responsable con el medio ambiente según comenta. Una de las necesidades que suele tener es la contrata de trabajadores del lugar para llevar a cabo sus distintas tareas como el retiro de maleza, aplicación de abono y corte de tallos defectuosos. Este es su segundo préstamo con Kiva  se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En está ocasion desea contar con 3,000 nuevo soles para la compra de un terreno de cultivo y expandir sus plantaciones de cacao para mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Maximiliana is a 35 year old woman.  She lives with her husband and their two children in their house.  Their house is constructed from adobe. 

She has worked for 15 years, producing organic cocoa and other profitable products.  She is lucky to have land that is very productive because of the products' quality. Their land is 3 hectares, and they work there daily. 

After replacing various outdated cocoa trees, they came to fertilize their land with compost.  According to comments, it was the only way to be responsible with agriculture and the environment.  Some of the needs that usually contract site workers to carry out, are removing weeds, applying manure, and cutting defective stems. 

This is her second loan with Kiva.  She feels very grateful for the financial help she received to move forward.  She agrees to pay her dues on time.  This time, she requests 3,000 new soles to purchase land for cultivation, and to expand their cocoa plantations to earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural land

loans.name: Unión Hace La Fuerza  (Calceta) Group

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Unión Hace La Fuerza se reúne cada quince días en la hermosa ciudad de Calceta, ciudad conocida con el nombre de “Calceta la sin par”. Por la belleza de sus mujeres y porque para sus habitantes no hay ciudad más hermosa en el mundo.

Este es un grupo de 10 mujeres y 2 hombres que decidieron unirse y formar este Banco Comunal para recibir los créditos con los cuales esperan mejorar sus pequeños negocios con los cuales ellos salen adelante. Se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio, servicios, venta de comidas entre otras actividades.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Flor, tiene 50 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos, dos mayores de edad y el menor de  10 años que estudia en la escuela. El marido es albañil.

Doña Flor se dedica a la venta de ropa, artículos de bazar y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también tiene un pequeño local en su casa en el cual  vende sus productos, pero la mayor parte de sus ventas las realiza puerta a puerta. Trabaja todos los días, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada fin de semana. Lleva 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual le ayuda a su marido a salir adelante ya que él en ocasiones no tiene trabajo, pero gracias a su negocio no les falta el pan en su mesa.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa, cosméticos, artículos de bazar y bisuterías. Este es su primer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la rapidez con que salen los créditos. 

Su sueño es seguir adelante en el banco y su vida familiar.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Unión Hace La Fuerza” (Strength In Numbers) meets every 15 days in the beautiful city of Calceta, which also goes by the name of “Calceta La Sin Par”.  There is no other city in the world that is more beautiful because of the beauty of its women and its residents.  

This group of 10 women and 2 men decided to join together and form this Communal Bank so that they could receive loans in hopes of improving their small businesses, which allows them to get ahead.  They engage in different businesses that involve retail, services, selling food, and other activities.

One of the members of this group is Sra. Flor.   She is 50 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has three children.  Two of them are grown and the youngest is 10 years old and attends school.  Her husband is a bricklayer.  

Doña Flor sells clothing, bazaar items, and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women’s accessories).  She sells by going door to door, but she also has a small shop in her house where she sells her products.  However, most of her sales are conducted by going door to door.  Flor works every day, extending credit to her customers and collecting payments every weekend.  She has been in this business for five years with the help of her husband.  They have been able to forge ahead even though he occasionally is without work.  Thanks to her business, she is able to put food on the table.  

Flor’s loan will be used to buy clothing, cosmetics, bazaar items, and trinkets.  This is her first loan cycle with the Communal Bank and she likes the fact that the loans are issued quickly.  Her dream is to move forward with her Communal Bank and in her family life.

loans.use: to buy clothing, cosmetics, bazaar items, and trinkets.

loans.name: José Gregorio

texts.es: José tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero y padre de un hijo de 4 años. Nació y se crió en una familia humilde del campo, allí aprendió las labores agrícolas de la mano de sus padres, quienes se desempeñaron toda la vida como jornaleros y agricultores. Gracias a esos conocimientos y la tradición familiar, hoy en día cuenta con cultivos de maíz, los que cuida diariamente desde las 5:00 am, sobrepasando diversos obstáculos que en ocasiones afectan directamente su producción, como por ejemplo, las fuertes lluvias que inundan sus cultivos y dañan los sembrados, sin embargo, con su actitud ganadora, con su empeño y dedicación ha logrado salir adelante. Los ingresos que obtiene son el resultado de las ventas de los productos que recolecta y cosecha, lo que le ha permitido llevar el sustento diario a su hogar. Actualmente el cliente solicita el crédito, con el interés de invertirlo en la compra de insumos al por mayor (abonos, fertilizantes, insecticidas), con los que podrá mejorar la preparación de la tierra para la temporada de cosecha que se aproxima, en la cual espera sacar unos productos de excelente calidad que puedan ser vendidos a mejor precio en el mercado. José sueña con ampliar sus cultivos y sembrar otro tipo de productos para incrementar sus ingresos y darle a su familia una estabilidad económica favorable, con la que puedan mejorar el nivel de vida y darle una excelente educación a su pequeño hijo.
texts.en: José is 22 years old, single and has a 4-year-old son. He was born and raised in a humble home in the country. There, he learned how to farm by hand from his parents, who worked their whole lives as farmers and day laborers. Thanks to this knowledge and family tradition, today José has corn crops that he tends to daily from 5 a.m. onward. He has overcame a number of obstacles that at times impact his production, for example the heavy rains that flood his fields and damage the crops. However, with his winning attitude, hard work and dedication he has been able to make headway. The income he earns comes from selling the goods he harvests, which has allowed him to bring home the daily bread. He currently is requesting a loan, which he plans to use to purchase wholesale supplies (fertilizers and insecticides) so he can improve his production for the upcoming harvest. He hopes to have excellent products that he can sell for a higher price at the market. José's dream is to expand his crops and plant another kind of product to increase his income and give his family more economic stability and a higher quality of life, and so he can provide his young son with an excellent education.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale supplies (fertilizers, insecticides).

loans.name: Mabomba Mengi Group

texts.en:
Victoria, who is married with four children, is running a business selling different drinks such as beers, sodas, juices, and spirits for five years now. She is in her early 40s and doing great in her business. She works from 4 p.m. to midnight daily and is able to make a good profit per month. 

This will be Victoria's fifth loan request, which she will use to replenish her stock of beer, wine, water and juice to resell. She used her previous loans to buy a motorcycle, a freezer, and more business chairs.
 
With the business profit earned, she bought house utensils and a fridge, renovated her house, bought new iron sheets, and paid for home expenses. Victoria's dream is to buy a car of her own.

She will share this loan with her loan group, Mabomba Mengi, which consist of nine members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to replenish her stock of beer, wine, water, and juice to resell.

loans.name: Mehriniso

texts.ru: Мехринисо- женщина от которой исходит тепло и на неё хочется смотреть и восхищаться. Она эталон таджички-дехканки. Мехринисо одновременно занимается и земледелием и скотоводством. Она очень любит животных. Вот уже 10 лет как Мехринисо разводит крупнорогатый скот. У нее есть скотный двор. В ней сейчас живет только один бык - Бетто. Мехринисо хотела бы увеличить поголовье скота и просит ей помочь в развитии бизнеса. Она милая, добрая и заботливая женщина, живет с мужем и детьми в районе Пяндж. Ей далеко за 50 лет и в ведении деятельности ей помогает семья.
texts.en:
Mehriniso radiates warmth and people look at her with admiration. She is a typical Tadjik peasant. 

Mehriniso works in both farming and cattle breeding. She really loves animals. For over 10 years, Mehriniso has been breeding cattle. She has a barnyard. In it, she currently has only one bull, named Betto. Mehriniso would like to increase her herd and is asking for help in growing her business. 

She is a sweet, kind and caring woman. She lives with her husband and kids in the region of Pyandj. She is over 50 years old and her family helps out with her business.

loans.use: to buy cattle to increase her herd

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 42-year-old married father of three children who has worked in raising cows and selling fresh milk since a year ago.

Ahmad used to be a soldier, but he retired a year ago. His wife helps him in covering part of their expenses through working as a tailor from her house. Their low incomes combined together aren't enough for covering their children's needs; that's why he is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to  buy a new cow that will increase his business production.

Ahmad hopes to expand his business in the future and own a big, highly developed farm.

loans.use: To buy  a new cow that will increase his production.

loans.name: Sayit

texts.en:
Sayit is a Cameroonian aged 36 and living in an urban area. He is married with five children; the oldest child is 12 in secondary school, and the youngest is 3 in nursery school. He has been in this business for the past 18 years, which makes him very experienced and stable. He is likely to succeed because of his longevity and experience in the business, and also because the business is located near a mosque, where there are always many potential customers. 

This loan will help him increase his turnover from 900,000 XAF (Communaute Fananciere Africaine Francs Beac) to 1,150,000 XAF, and his profit will increase by 13 percent monthly. His standard of living will also increase as well.

loans.use: To buy communications credits.

loans.name: Good Deeds Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 37-year-old Noddie from Mutare. Noddie is a member of the Good Deeds Group. She is widowed with two children, both attending school. Noddie runs a clothing business selling kidswear, handbags and cosmetics. The business has been in operation for nine years. She says the main challenge faced is high import costs at the border posts. 

Noddie has requested a loan of $400 to purchase clothing to sell during the summer season. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her family's welfare. In the future, Noddie plans to have her own boutique shop.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Rza

texts.en:
Rza is a 45-year-old. Rza is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his family in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. After several attempts to find a job, he decided to start his own business. He is a farmer and has raised seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last 10 years. He breeds cattle, too.

He chose this business because it is profitable and fresh crops are in high demand. People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy. Many national dishes are made from vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served on every Azerbaijan family’s table and are also used to make fresh punch.

Rza sells his crops in the Bilasuvar central bazaar. His monthly income is 100 AZN (Azerbaijani new manat). His wife actively helps him to raise the crops.

As his products are in high demand, Rza wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables to cover market demand. For this purpose, he applied for 2,000 AZN. He will buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers. This will be his sixth loan, and he has a positive loan history.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Evershining Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 43-year-old Sekai from Mutare. Sekai is a member of the Evershining Group. She is single with two children, one attending school. She also cares for one dependent. Sekai runs a retail business selling dried fish. The business has been in operation for six years. She says the main challenge faced is debtors failing to repay on time. 

Sekai has requested a loan of $400 to buy dried fish from Mozambique for resale in Mutare. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her family's welfare. In the future, Sekai plans to supply fish to large supermarkets and own a truck for transportation.

loans.use: To purchse dried fish from Mozambique for resale.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en: Mary Jane is a 25-year-old banana dealer in the village of Mabbayad, Echague. She is married to Erick, a rice farmer and they are blessed with two children. Mary Jane and her husband have been planting bananas for almost two years. Their banana vending business also assisted them in providing for  their farming needs. They want to sustain their banana planting and vending so they can have a source of income while waiting for the harvest season for their rice. Mary Jane would like to borrow PHP 7,000 to purchase fertilizers to sustain their banana planting. She believes that this loan will be a great help in her enterprise and also for her to have a sustainable business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to sustain their banana planting

loans.name: Gulustan

texts.en:
Gulustan is 47 years old. She is married and the mother of  five beautiful children.  She is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her husband and children in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. Gulustan and her husband are engaged in their own business in order to have the income to meet their family's needs. She has been engaged in cattle breeding for the past 13 years. During these years, she gained the necessary skills and knowledge for the effective management of her business. 

She usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months, and then resells them for a profitable price in the livestock bazaar. She also makes homemade yogurt and sells it, together with fresh milk, to her neighbors. Her monthly income is about 144 AZN. This business is the only source of financial income in her family. Beef is in very high demand in Azerbaijan, as people use it in everyday dishes like pilau (a rice dish) and dolma (stuffed grape leaves).

Now Gulustan would like to buy more animals. For this purpose, she applied for a loan of 1,500 AZN. She will buy three calves and one milk cow. This will be her third loan with AqroInvest, and she has a positive client history.

loans.use: to buy three calves and one milk cow.

loans.name: Rabih

texts.en:
Rabih is a 34-year-old married father of two children. He has worked as a barber since 1996. Because he is the family's sole breadwinner, he had to find extra businesses to fulfill family's needs. Thus he started supplying Satellite services to homes and offices as an additional income business. For this business he uses a van to transport his tools and requested machines from one place to another. The van isn't registered yet because he cannot afford to pay the registration fees, so he is driving it illegally. That's why he acquired a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua; to register his van to drive it freely to any region.
He hopes that in the future he'll be capable of developing his business with special decorations and maintenance to his shop.

loans.use: To register his van

loans.name: Hopeview Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 39-year-old Florence from Mutare. Florence is a member of Hopeview Group. She is married with one child, who attends school. She also cares for two dependents. Florence runs an agricultural business, breeding chickens and making peanut butter. The business has been in operation for 6 years. She says the main challenges faced are the high mortality rate of the chicks and debtors failing to repay on time. Florence has requested a loan of $400 to buy feed for her poultry business and peanuts for peanut butter making. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her family's welfare. In the future Florence plans to breed more than 200 birds per batch and supply them to a large supermarket in town.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed for her poultry business and peanuts for making peanut butter

loans.name: Tamilla

texts.en:
Tamilla is 52 years old. She is an IDP (internally displaced person). She moved from the city of Fuzuli and now lives in the Bilasuvar region with her family. Tamilla is married and a mother of four children. She is a very successful entrepreneur who sells chickens, which brings her a stable income. She is a very hardworking woman. For the past 10 years, she has been raising chickens and is very active in poultry selling. She usually buys small chickens, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months and then sells them for a more profitable price in the livestock bazaar. Her husband also helps her in this business because it is the only income for their family. From this business, Tamilla's monthly income is 120 AZN.

In Azerbaijan, chicken is in very high demand because people use it in everyday dishes like levengi, chicken soup, tabaca, kabab, etc. She sells eggs too. People eat chicken eggs every day for breakfast. Each day, she sells approximately 50 eggs. She needs a loan of 1800 AZN. With this money, she wants to invest in the business and buy more small chickens in order to generate more revenue. This is her first loan.

loans.use: to buy more small chickens in order to generate more revenue.

loans.name: Alymona Group

texts.en: This group is called Alymona and consists of 4 ladies who live in Taiz, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank. Artfaq, one of the members, is 33 years old and lives in Taiz, Yemen. She complains of a lack of money to build another room in her house which she wants to do as sometimes she feels embarrassed when guests come to her home and she has no place to welcome them. She intends to expand her house. She has applied for a loan of 50,000 YER to buy construction supplies for her house. She hopes to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies for her house.

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is a 58-year-old married father of eight children He puts so much effort into providing them with a good healthy life. Youssef has had a convenience store for five years, and it is the main source of income for his family. He is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to increase his business merchandise with special offers.
This is Youssef's third loan cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower, and his previous loans helped a lot in developing his business by responding to customers' needs. Today he is working hard to keep his shop updated and to diversify his products to attract new customers and please current ones.

loans.use: To increase his business merchandise with special offers

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es: Juan, a sus 61 años de edad, es padre de cinco hijos y vive en unión libre con su pareja. Lleva 30 años dedicándose a la agricultura, actividad que aprendió de sus padres cuando era un niño, gracias a esto hoy en día posee cultivos de ñame y yuca, en los cuales trabaja diariamente desde las 5:00 am y cuyas cosechas recolecta y vende en el mercado del pueblo donde reside. De esa manera obtiene los recursos necesarios para satisfacer las necesidades de su familia. El cliente manifiesta que su mayor desafío es luchar contra las inclemencias del clima que le produce daños a los cultivos, sin embargo, siempre ha buscado opciones que le permitan seguir avanzando. Actualmente solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas al por mayor (abonos, semillas, insecticidas, larvicidas) y con ellos preparar la tierra para csechar productos de excelente calidad para venderlos a mejor precio en el mercado y generar mayores ingresos, además desea aprovechar las hectáreas que tiene disponibles para ampliar sus cultivos y diversificar la producción. Es así como Juan sueña mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia, pues a su edad es todo un reto lograr los objetivos que se propone y desea hacerlos realidad para disfrutar los frutos de su trabajo junto a sus seres queridos.
texts.en: Juan, 61, is a father of 5 children and lives in a common-law union with his partner. He has been working in agriculture for 30 years. He learned this occupation from his parents when he was a child. Thanks to this, today he owns plots of yams and yucca where he works every day starting at 5 in the morning. He collects the harvest and sells it in the market of the town that he lives in. In this way he obtains the necessary resources to meet his family's needs. He states that his greatest challenge is struggling against adverse weather which damages his crops. Nevertheless, he has always looked for options that allow him to keep going. Currently, he is seeking this loan in order to invest it in purchasing agricultural supplies in bulk (fertilizer, seed, insecticide, larvicide) and use them to prepare the land in order to produce a harvest of high quality products. He will be able to sell them at a better price at the market and achieve a higher income. In addition, he wants to take advantage of some hectares that he has available in order to increase his plots and diversify his production. In this way Juan hopes to improve his living conditions and those of his family, since at his age it is a real challenge to meet his objectives and he wants to succeed in order to enjoy the fruits of his labor together with his loved ones.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies in bulk (fertilizer, seed, insecticide, larvicide)

loans.name: Mistubish Group

texts.en:
Leninida is in her mid 30s and is a divorcee. She has been buying and selling garlic in bulk for one year now.  She works from 8.00 am to 5.00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Leninida's 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy sacks of garlic.  She is getting on very well.  She has paid back all her loans successfully.  She used the profit to save in the bank and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to buy more sacks of garlic from up-country.  She dreams of opening a cosmetics shop.

Leninida will share this loan with her loan group "Mistubish" with nine members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of garlic from up-country.

loans.name: Kurbonaly

texts.en:
Kurbonaly is a kind man. He is married but does not have any children.  He is a hardworking man and always tries to improve his living conditions. Three years ago he began his own driving business. Because he provides good service, he has managed to gain many customers. Since he has had his business, his family’s quality of life has been improving. He is asking for a loan to repair his car. 
In this way, his business will have the opportunity to provide better service and he will be able to increase his income which allows him to offer his wife a better quality of life and better financial opportunities for getting ahead.

loans.use: To repair his car

loans.name: Moussa

texts.en:
Moussa is a 55-year-old married man and the father of five children.

He has been the owner of a convenience store since 2008. He started working for himself in 1992 and has 41 years of experience in this domain.

Moussa was only fourteen years old when he started working to pay for his needs and expenses, and to help his parents in covering their needs.

He sells soft drinks, juices, cheese and dairy products. His store is located in a high population area with a good number of customers passing by, including nearby school students and teachers.

Moussa decided to apply for a loan to buy a new van to use it as an additional income business as a school bus which will surely improve his family's socioeconomic situation.

This loan is being requested by Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, and this is Moussa's seventh cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower of very good standing.

Moussa aims to increase his profits and provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: To buy a new van to use as a school bus

loans.name: Arcelio Darío

texts.es: Arcelio toda su vida ha estado en el campo, pues fue allí donde nació y creció, aprendiendo desde niño las funciones que se realizan en la agricultura, pues ha sido una tradición familiar que ha pasado de generación en generación. Gracias a ello, hoy en día posee cultivos en un lote que heredó, los cuales cuida desde muy temprano en la mañana y cuyas cosechas recolecta para luego salir a venderlas en la plaza principal del municipio donde vive. De esa manera el cliente obtiene los recursos suficientes para suplir las necesidades básicas de su hogar. Arcelio se caracteriza por ser un señor pujante, que se empeña en buscar nuevas opciones para salir adelante, es muy juicioso y dedicado a su familia y a su labor. Actualmente solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas (abonos, semillas, fungicidas, larvicidas) con el interés de seguir cuidando sus cultivos para sacar una cosecha más productiva,  que pueda ser vendida con facilidad en el mercado, incrementando así, sus ingresos. Es así como Arcelio desea seguir adelante, progresando para tener los recursos suficientes que le den la oportunidad de mejorar la calidad de vida y disfrutar al lado de su esposa los frutos de su ardua labor.
texts.en:
Arcelio has lived all his life in the countryside. It was there that he was born and grew up, learning from childhood the different roles involved in farming, which has been a family tradition that has passed from generation to generation. Thanks to that, today he has crops on a plot of land that he inherited. He takes care of them from very early in the morning, and harvests his crops in order to sell them in the main square of the town where he lives. In this way he makes enough income to supply the basic needs of his household.

Arcelio is a vigorous man, who works hard to find new ways to get ahead. He is very level-headed, and dedicated to his family and his work. He is currently seeking a loan in order to invest it in buying agricultural inputs (including fertilizers, seed, fungicides, and larvicides). He will continue to take care of his crops and use these inputs to obtain a more productive harvest, which can easily be sold in the market, and so increase his income. This way, Arcelio hopes to move forward, making progress towards having enough resources to give him the opportunity to improve his quality of life and enjoy the fruits of his labors at his wife's side.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs (fertilizers, seed, fungicides and larvicides).

loans.name: Benard

texts.en: Benard lives in the Changamwe area near Mombasa, Kenya. He is 32 years old and married with one child. He operates a money transfer service known as M-pesa locally and the business is doing great. He has some formal employment and so some of his family members run the business. He learned about Milango through a friend and now he seeks a loan to add to his float account. He has been facing financial challenges in the business and with this loan, he will be able to solve them. In the next five years, he wants to be running a successful business and be stable in his income. The extra income that he will raise from the business will help build a residential home for his family.

loans.use: to add to his float account to handle more money transfers.

loans.name: Mubariz

texts.en:
Mubariz is 45 years old, married and the father of one daughter. Mubariz is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his family in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He grows fruits and vegetables. He plants tomatoes, potatoes, eggplant, and other vegetables and fruit. He says even though this business is very hard, he and his wife have been handling it for five years without any difficulty.

Mubariz grows vegetables and fruit and sells them in the bazaar. His income from selling these items is 150 AZN. He has more plans for the future, such as getting more land for cultivation. He is looking forward to increased sales in the coming summer because people purchase a lot more fruit.

Now he needs a loan of 500 AZN. This loan is to buy new fruit trees. He hopes to earn more revenue in the coming summer, which will help him to support his family’s needs. He has a good loan history and this is his third loan.

loans.use: to buy new fruit trees

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline appreciates the previous loan that improved her living standards. Besides the general store, she sells shoes. Jackline is requesting a loan of KSH 20,000 to purchase two sacks of shoes .She thanks Yehu and Kiva for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of shoes

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en: Angelita, 45 years of age, is married. They are blessed with four children. She has owned and operated a retail store in their village for almost five years. In this business, she earns a net income of PHP 800 per day. Due to insufficient capital, she decided to ask for a loan of PHP 18,000 to purchase coffee, sugar, cooking oil, bread, noodles, canned goods, and beverages. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more progressive.

loans.use: To purchase coffee, sugar, cooking oil, bread, noodles, canned goods, and beverages

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is 54 years old, married and has one kid. Ali is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his family in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He is a hard-working person who takes care of his family by doing business in animal husbandry. Ali raises cattle to sell the meat.  He has been in this business for 10 years. His wife supports him in the business. The business takes a lot of effort, but together they run it successfully.  He sells the meat in the central bazaar where the demand for meat is high. People in Azerbaijan consume plenty of meat because it is used in most dishes. Some traditional meals like kebabs, dolma and others require beef in their preparation. His profit is 130 AZN monthly. Ali is applying for his first loan of 1,000 AZN in order to expand the business by buying new calves. He plans to raise these calves, fatten them, and sell more meat for the coming traditional holidays, when the demand for beef will increase. He awaits your support

loans.use: to expand the business by buying new calves.

loans.name: Innovative Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 40-year-old Blessings from Mutare. Blessings is a member of the Innovative Group. She is widowed with one child who attends school. She also cares for two dependents. Blessings runs a catering business selling rice and chicken, sadza, stew and pies. The business has been in operation for six years. She says the main challenge she faces is stiff competition. Blessings has requested a loan of $800 to purchase utensils like spoons, pots and plates for the catering business. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her family's welfare. In the future, Blessings plans to provide catering services throughout Mutare.

loans.use: To buy equipment for her catering business

loans.name: Johna

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Johna works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling school supplies in the Philippines and earns additional income from tricycle transport. Johna is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase more school supplies to sell.

Johna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ngoni Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 32-year-old Voronica from Mutare. Voronica is a member of Ngoni Group. She is married with four children, three of whom are attending school. Voronica runs a retail business selling clothes and hardware. The business has been in operation for seven years. She says the main challenge she faces is stiff competition. Voronica has requested a loan of $400 to purchase ladies suits and hardware for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her family's welfare. In the future, Voronica plans to operate a hardware shop in town.

loans.use: To buy clothing and hardware for resale

loans.name: Sabougnouma I Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe   SABOUGNOUMA I sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des familles polygames à KOROBARRAGE, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs avec Mme AFOU debout en deuxième  position de la   gauche vers la droite  sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter le labour, la semence et les engrais  pour entretenir 0,5. La production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 150.000  francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of Sabougnouma I Group are women averaging 40 years of age and six children. They all live in polygamous families in Korobarrage, one of the villages in Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali.

They work with Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, in order to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are seeking their third loan from the MFI, and the previous loans were repaid without problems.

Mrs. Afou (second woman from the left in the standing row) grows corn. She intends to use her loan to buy seeds and fertilizers, and to pay for plowing to maintain 0.5 hectare.

After the harvest, the production is sold in the village, in Sikasso, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

She intends to turn a profit of XOF 150'000 (ca US$ 300) per planting, which will enable her to repay the loan and help her husband cover daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm inputs, and to pay for plowing

loans.name: Omar Ascario

texts.es: Omar viene de una familia humilde y muy trabajadora, siempre ha vivido en el campo, donde aprendió las diferentes funciones agrícolas, el manejo de las tierras y el cuidado de los animales pero, por dificultades económicas y falta de capital, nunca ha podido tener cultivos, ni animales. Sin embargo, esto no ha sido motivo para dejar de luchar, pues hoy en día se dedica a vender helados y paletas, aprovechando la ventaja de que la región donde reside es bastante calurosa y tiene mucha demanda de los productos que ofrece. De esta forma ha logrado generar los recursos económicos que requiere para suplir las necesidades básicas de su familia. Omar es un señor humilde, sencillo y trabajador, tiene un espíritu emprendedor, que lo motiva a seguir avanzando. Actualmente solicita el crédito con la intención de comprar surtido al por mayor (helados y paletas), lo que le permitirá ofrecer más variedad y satisfacer los gustos de sus clientes, esto se verá reflejado en el incremento de sus ingresos. Omar sueña con tener la oportunidad de ampliar su negocio, montar una heladería en un local comercial y así poder obtener más ganancias para brindar a su familia un mejor nivel de vida y una estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Omar comes from a humble and very hard working family. He has always lived in the countryside where he learned different farming jobs, managing land and taking care of animals but, due to economic difficulties and lack of money he has never been able to have crops or animals. Nevertheless, this has not been a reason to stop fighting. Today he is dedicated to selling ice creams and popsicles, taking advantage of the fact that the region in which he lives is quite hot and has a lot of demand for the products he offers. In this way, he has managed to generate the economic resources that he requires to supply the basic necessities for his family. Omar is a humble, simple and hard working man. He has an entrepreneurial spirit that motivates him to keep advancing. Currently, he is requesting the loan with the intention of buying stock at wholesale (ice creams and popsicles) which will permit him to offer more variety and satisfy the tastes of his customers. This will be reflected in the increase of his income. Omar dreams to have the opportunity to expand his business, start an ice cream shop and be able to obtain more earnings to provide his family with a better quality of life and economic stability.

loans.use: to buy stock at wholesale (ice creams and popsicles.

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.es: Edilberto tiene 26 años, es padre soltero de dos hijos de 5 y 2 años de edad. Hace 15 años realiza se desempeña como agricultor, pues le ayudaba a sus padres en los cultivos que poseían, desde entonces fue adquiriendo conocimientos y experiencia en la labor. Hace 4 años tiene sus propios cultivos de maracuyá y ají, la producción que obtiene de las cosechas, es vendida para obtener los recursos necesarios para darles el sustento a sus hijos. El cliente es un hombre honrado, juicioso, dedicado a su familia y a su labor, pues esto lo motiva para trabajar con más empeño y conseguir lo que se propone. Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito, que invertirá en la compra de abonos, riegos, fertilizantes y fungicidas para continuar con su labor y cuidar sus cultivos, esto le ayudará a cosechar productos de mejor calidad y podrá aumentar los ingresos que genera por cada venta. Es así como Edilberto desea mantener sus cultivos, para que sea un negocio sostenible y perdurable en el tiempo, que le brinde la oportunidad de brindar a sus hijos un mejor bienestar y mejores condiciones de vida, para que tengan un futuro próspero y estable a nivel económico.
texts.en: Edilberto, 26 years old, is a single father of two. His children are five and two years old. He has been a farmer for fifteen years, since he started to help his parents with their farm when he was a child. He is now very experienced and knowledgeable about farming. He has had his own crops for four years, growing passion fruit and bell peppers and selling the harvest in order to buy food for his children. Edilberto is an honest man who takes smart decisions and is devoted to his family and his work. His love for his children pushes him to work ever harder in order to achieve his goals. He asks for a loan in order to buy manure, an irrigation system, fertiliser, and fungicide, so as to keep tending to his crops and obtain higher-quality produce, which will sell much better. Edilberto's aim is to have his farm withstand the test of time and keep improving, as he wants to give his children a better life so that they can benefit from a more financially stable and prosperous future.

loans.use: to buy manure, an irrigation system, fertiliser, and fungicide.

loans.name: Leonardo Antonio

texts.es: Leonardo, durante su vida productiva se ha dedicado a laborar de manera independiente en diversos tipos de actividades, pero siente especial motivación por el área de ensamble y reparación de bicicletas, pues ha sido una actividad que le genera ingresos adicionales. Actualmente y, con la intención de estabilizar su economía, desea iniciar su propio taller de ensamble y reparación de bicicletas, para lo cual tomará en subarriendo un pequeño espacio de un local comercial donde comenzará a prestar el servicio, esta es la razón por la que solicita el apoyo del crédito, pues requiere comprar las herramientas, repuestos y partes para ensamble de las bicicletas, así podrá poner en marcha su idea de negocio, con la cual espera generar los ingresos suficientes para llevar el sustento a su hogar. Leonardo sueña con fortalecer su negocio, acreditarlo para que le permita incrementar sus ventas, además desea generar empleos directos. Esto le dará la capacidad de disfrutar una estabilidad económica favorable y podrá mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Leonardo, during his productive life, has been dedicated to working independently in diverse types of activities, but he feels special motivation for the area of assembling and repairing bicycles. This has been an activity that has generated additional income. Currently and with the intention of stabilizing his finances, he wishes to start his own shop for assembly and repair of bicycles for which he will sublease a small space in a commercial shop where he will begin to lend his service. This is the reason for which he is requesting loan support. He needs to buy the tools and parts to assemble the bicycles so he will be able to start his business idea with which he hopes to generate sufficient income to support his family. Leonardo dreams of establishing his business which he believes will allow him to increase his sales as well as generate direct jobs. This will give him the ability to enjoy favorable economic stability and he will be able to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy the tools and parts to put together bicycles.

loans.name: Edwige

texts.fr: Âgée de 37ans, Madame Edwige est mariée à un magasinier. Ils ont ensemble 04 enfants. Elle est revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale. Cette activité qu’elle mène dans une boutique lui permet de se prendre en charge et d’aider son mari dans les charges du ménage. Avec ce second prêt qu’elle sollicite dans notre institution, elle va acheter des marchandises pour bien répondre aux désirs des clients. Avec les profits, elle veut épargner pour achever son chantier, devenir grossiste et fonder une famille financièrement stable.
texts.en:
Mrs. Edwige, age 37, is married to a shopkeeper and they have four children together.

She resells food staples in a store, a business which enables her to provide for herself and help her husband cover the household's expenses. 

She's seeking her second loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, and she will use it to buy some merchandise to respond well to customers' wishes.

She wants to use her profits to put money away in order to finish rebuilding, become a wholesaler, and start a financially stable family.

loans.use: to buy grocery items

loans.name: Idis Isabel

texts.es:
Idis es una mujer que se dedica a la agricultura y es ama de casa con 33 años de edad es madre de 7 hijos pero solo viven 6 ya que el primero murió. El mayor tiene 16 años y culmino ciclo común pero este año por la situación económica que ellos atraviesan no pudo continuar, el segundo no estudia pero curso hasta tercer grado, ambos hijos ya que actualmente no están en el colegio se dedican a apoyar a su padre en las labores de la tierra, los dos hermanos que le siguen a los mayores están en la escuela en diferentes grados de educación, y el ultimo que es un bebe recién nacido. Ella no tiene ningún grado de educación ya que la situación económica de sus padres no era la mejor. Ella aprendió a trabajar la tierra por parte de sus padres especialmente al cultivo de café realizando las diferentes actividades que se desarrollan en el campo como limpieza, abono, corte, etc. para el desarrollo y cuido del grano. Ellos al igual que otros caficultores del lugar venden el café a una persona de la comunidad que se dedica a comprar y a su vez esta persona revende el producto a bodegas que se dedican exclusivamente a la compra-venta en la zona.

Idis anhela que como ella y su esposo no pudieron prepararse académica mente sus hijos si puedan lograrlo y  así tengan otras opciones para defenderse en la vida y alcanzar un estatus de vida mejor que el que ellos les puedan brindar ya que la única herencia que ellos a parte del trabajo y el respeto a los demás les pueden enseñar los estudios son una prioridad. 

Por lo tanto ella ha solicitado a la cooperativa COMIXMUL un financiamiento con el cual comprara 3 QQ de urea, 3 QQ de fórmula 12-24-12, 3 sacos de fertilizantes, 3 litros de fungicidas y plaguicida para poder dar una buena asistencia a sus cultivos de café y esperar una excelente cosecha.
texts.en:
Idis is a woman who is dedicated to farming and she is a housewife who is 33 years old. She is mother to seven children but only six are alive since the first died. The eldest is 16 years old and finished the first half of high school, but this year, due to the economic situation they faced, he could not continue. The second is not studying but was in school up to the third grade. Both children, since they are no longer in school, are dedicated to supporting their father in his farming work. The two brothers who follow the eldest are in school in different grades of education and the last is a recently born baby. Idis has no education since her parents' economic situation was not the best. She learned to work the land from her parents, especially cultivating coffee, performing the different activities that one develops in the countryside like cleaning, fertilizing, pruning etc. for the development and care of the grain. Like other farmers in the area, they sell the coffee to a person in the community who is dedicated to buying and reselling the product to stores that are dedicated exclusively to the buying-selling in the area.

Since she and her husband could not prepare themselves academically, Idis dreams that her children are able to do so and thereby have other options to defend themselves in life and reach a better status in life than that which they were able to provide since the only legacy they can teach, besides hard work and respect, is that school is a priority.

As a result, she has requested from the COMIXMUL cooperative a loan with which she will buy 3 QQ of urea, 3 QQ of formula 12-24-12, 3 bags of fertilizer, 3 liters of fungicide and pesticide to be able to give good support to her crops of coffee and hope for an excellent harvest.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Yessenia Marisela

texts.es:
Yessenia de 27 años de edad, logro cursar hasta sexto grado. Esta acompañada y su compañero de vida es jornalero en actividades agrícolas, él se encarga de llevar ingresos al hogar para comprar los alimentos; además de los que ella obtiene con su negocio. Tiene solo una hija de 13 años y está estudiando sexto grado. Su vivienda es de bahareque, es lo que han podido construir para vivir. 
Su negocio es la venta de tortillas en el cantón, dice que siempre se ha dedicado a este negocio, con el cual ha podido ir pasando. Decidió hacer esta actividad  por la demanda que hay en  el lugar. Ella aprendió hacer tortillas desde que vivía con su madre. Los clientes llegan a comprar las tortillas a su casa, casi siempre le ayuda su hija y en algunas ocasiones su cuñada. Dice que no hay muchas personas que se dediquen a esta actividad (venta de tortillas) en la zona, ella es bien conocida por su negocio.
Con el crédito solicitado comprar abonos, pesticidas, herbicidas y pago de mano de obra, para cultivar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, ya que anteriormente ha tenido que comprarlo para la elaboración de las tortillas y no le queda mucha utilidad si lo hace así.  Por ese motivo, ha decidido cultivar  para reducir costos y tener mejores ingresos.
Su dese es diversificar su negocio, vender otros productos además de tortillas, por ejemplo: tamales, pasteles, entre otros; que le generen mayores ingresos y así poder cumplir sus sueños de construir una casa de bloque y ayudarle también a su hija que pueda seguir sus estudios  que le permitan valerse por sí misma en el futuro.
texts.en:
Yessenia is 27 years old. She finished sixth grade. She is accompanied and her life partner is an agricultural laborer. He is in charge of bringing home income to buy food in addition to that which she earns with her business. She has only one daughter who is 13 years old and she is in sixth grade. Her house is made of "bahareque" (reeds or cane), which is what they were able to build to live.

Her business is selling tortillas in the area. She says that she has always been dedicated to this business with which she has been able to get by. She decided to do this activity due to the demand that exists in the area. She learned to make tortillas when she lived with her mother. The customers come to buy tortillas at her house. Almost always her daughter helps her and, on some occasions, her sister-in-law. She says that there are not many people who are dedicated to this activity (selling tortillas) in the area. She is well known for her business.

With the loan requested, she will buy fertilizer, pesticides, herbicides and pay laborers to cultivate 7,000 square meters of maize since previously she has had to buy it for her tortillas and it is not very useful if she does it like that. For this reason, she has decided to grow to reduce costs and to have better income.

Her wish is to diversify her business, sell other products besides tortillas, for example tamales, pastries, among other things which generate greater income and to be able to achieve her dreams of building a house made of blocks and to also help her daughter continue her education which will allow her to stand on her own in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides, herbicides and to pay laborers to cultivate 7,000 square meters of maize.

loans.name: Sabougnouma Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe   SABOUGNOUMA II sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des familles polygames à KOROBARRAGE, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs avec Mme  AWA  debout au milieu  sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter le labour, la semence et les engrais  pour entretenir 0,5. La production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 145.000  francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of Sabougnouma II are married women with an average age of 40 years, 6 children each, and all live in polygamous families in Korobarrage, one of the villages of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. They partner with the microfinance organization Soro Yirwaso in order to keep their farming businesses running during the rainy season.

The women are on their third loan with the organization, the previous loans having been fully repaid. Corn is the main crop for Awa, standing in the middle of the photo. With this loan, she plans to purchase labor, seeds, and fertilizer to support her half a hectare.

The harvest is sold at the village level, at Sikasso, after harvest time to a customer base made up of both men and women. Awa hopes to earn a profit of 145,000 francs CFA per field. This profit will allow her to pay back her loan and also to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: purchase labor, supplies, and seeds for farming

loans.name: Melva

texts.en:
Melva is 51 years old and married with 2 children.

Melva works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29,500 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Melva has been in this business for 19 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Melva aspires to save money to build a piggery (pig) business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah is a family man who is married and aged 49 years old.  He supports a family of 7 members and his six children are aged between 20 and 8 years old.  He sells livestock meat in his Kipkata location and has been in operation for over a period of 20 years earning an income of 10,000 KES.

He is now servicing his 2nd loan of 30,000 KES from KADET LTD and intends to use the amount to purchase livestock for slaughter to sell the meat to his customers.  The anticipated profits from his business will be used to expand his current business.

His dream is to see his current business expand.

loans.use: to purchase livestock for slaughter to sell the meat

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
Armine lives in the city of Kapan with her husband and two daughters. Her husband works at the Kapan poultry farm as a chief accountant. Armine has studied at the Yerevan University of Acharyan in the department of Applied Mathematics.   Her education is a great asset to running her trading business in a smart and profitable way. 

She has been in the clothes trading business for eight years. She sells men's and women's clothes and shoes. She works in a rented stall in a big clothes wholesale market which is located in a very crowded and central part of the city of Kapan. 

Armine decided to enlarge her trading and to increase her potential profit because her family expenses have increased and her husband’s salary is not enough for these expenses. This is the third deal with Kiva for Armine and she is very appreciative of the past cooperation. She is very hopeful that Kiva lenders will support her again.

This time Armine is asking for a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian Drams to buy a lot of autumn-winter clothes.  She hopes that the season's sales will be very profitable.

loans.use: to buy a lot of autumn-winter clothes.

loans.name: Mauricio Alexander

texts.es:
Mauricio es un joven de 24 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado. No pudo seguir estudiando porque su familia es de escasos recursos económicos y  se vio en la necesidad de dedicarse a la agricultura para ayudar a su padre a llevar el sustento a su familia. Esta acompañado y su pareja realiza los quehaceres del hogar. Él  manifiesta que hoy que tiene su hijo de dos años de edad, desea que él si tenga la oportunidad de estudiar y no se le presenten tantos obstáculos,  como los que ha tenido que vivir él.
Su trabajo es  la siembra de maíz y frijol. Aparte de esto, es ayudante de albañil, cuando hay algún trabajo en el cantón. Tiene también crianza de cerdos, los cuales los lleva a venderlos cuando ya están lucidos a la plaza del pueblo. Su padre le ayuda en ocasiones en las labores agrícolas y viceversa. Trabaja todos los días en su milpa y cuando regresa en la tarde se dedica a  alimentar los cerdos.
El crédito lo necesita para comprar madera y lamina para reparar el techo de su casa, ya que se encuentra en mal estado y tiene que estar pendiente cada vez que llueve con bastante viento, porque azota. Tendrá los recursos económicos oportunamente, para adquirir los materiales necesarios para la mejora de su casa, ya que si no lo hace se  deteriorara, porque es de adobe.  Si repara su vivienda estará segura su familia
En un futuro desea tener una vivienda digna, pero por el momento solo puede hacerle mejoras para ir apaciguando la situación; pero con trabajo duro y ahorrando un poco, espera cumplir su sueño. Otro sueño que tiene,  es el que su hijo pueda tener las condiciones para prepararse estudiando y tenga un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Mauricio, 24, is a young man who studied up to the fourth grade. He could not continue studying because his family lacked economic resources and he had to work in agriculture in order to help his father bring food to the table. He is in a relationship; his partner takes care of the household chores. He says that he has a two-year-old son. He wants him to have the opportunity to study without all the obstacles that he faced.

Mauricio works growing corn and beans. He also works as an assistant to a mason, whenever there is an opportunity to work. He also raises pigs and sells them when they have reached the right weight in the town’s marketplace. His father helps him sometimes, and he helps him in return. He works every day in his plantation and in the afternoon, he feeds the pigs.

He is requesting a loan to buy wood and metal sheets to fix his roof, which is in bad shape. Every time it rains, he has to be alert since the wind can blow it away. With the loan, he will have the resources on time in order to buy the materials he needs to improve his house and avoid its deterioration, since it is made of wattle and daub. His family will have a safer place to live in.

In the future, he hopes to have a decent house. For the moment, he will have to settle with some improvements. However, with hard work and some savings, he hopes to make his dream come true. Another dream he has is that his son can have the opportunity to study and to have a better future.

loans.use: to buy wood and metal sheets to repair his roof, which is in bad shape.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 40 years old and has six children. Evelyn is married and has three children who are in school.

Evelyn is in theanagricultural business raising livestock in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase vitamins, vaccines and other supplies for her livestock. Evelyn has been in this business for 2 years now and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins, vaccines and other supplies for her livestock

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 27 years old and single, supporting no one else at the moment.  He rears livestock on their farm and later resells them for profit.  He has been in operation for a period of 2 years earning an income of 18,000 KES.

He is servicing his 1st loan of 30,000 KES from KADET LTD, which he intends to use to add livestock for rearing.  The anticipated amounts from the sale of his livestock will be used to venture into other businesses.

His dream is to expand his business for prosperity.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is single, aged 23 years and supports no one else yet. He cooks and sells food in a Eldama/Ravine location and has been in operation for a period of 1 year, earning an income of 10,000 KES monthly.

He joined a self-help group in KADET LTD and is now servicing his first loan of 30,000 KES.  His intention is to purchase stock of food for his business.  The anticipated amounts will be used to repay the loan and he will save the rest for future investments.

His dream is to have a family and expand his current business to the extent of having more food kiosks.

loans.use: to purchase stock of maize, beans, sugar, tea leaves, baking flour, etc.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is 45 years old.  He is married and blessed with 6 children between 20 and 6 years old.  He provides transport services in Kabarnet town and has been in operation for more than 10 years earning an income of 40,000 KES.

This is Wilson's third loan.  He intends to use the 100,000 KES from KADET to purchase spare parts and do some repairs and general service for his passenger service vehicle.  The resulting profits will be used to pay school fees for his children.

His dream is to to expand his current business and purchase a a new vehicle.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and do general service for his vehicle.

loans.name: Lydiah

texts.en:
Lydiah is a 53-year-old woman.  She is married to Peter and the mother of three children. She buys and sells poultry at Kasarani in the outskirts of Kiambu. She has been in this business for 15 years and earns a monthly income of 26,000 KES.

This will be Lydiah's first loan with KADET. She plans to use the entire loan to buy young chicks.  She wants to be a better business person in the future.

loans.use: to purchase day-old chicks.

loans.name: Hugo Jeremías

texts.es:
Hugo de 19 años de edad, estudio hasta Bachillerato, actualmente esta acompañado. Su compañera de vida se dedica solo a los oficios domésticos la pareja no tienen hijos por el momento. 

El joven cultiva 14,000 metros cuadrados de ajonjolí,  trabajo que realiza desde hace tres años. El cultivo lo realiza porqué el abuelito le enseño, siempre sean dedicado a cultivar granos básicos; su trabajo esta cerca de su casa solo tiene que caminar un kilómetro para llegar, trabaja seis horas al día y unas dos horas más cuidando unas dos terneras pastoreándolas para engordarlas.

Con el préstamo que esta solicitado a fundación CAMPO, alquilara la tierra, pagara la preparación de la misma, ya que en es te tiempo lo realizan con máquina.  Lo que busca es tener una producción excelente de ajonjolí y así tener  una mejor disponibilidad de dinero para el año próximo, estará satisfaciendo la necesidad de ver florecer su cultivo y su vida.

Sus sueños es ser una familia feliz, que exista comprensión y cultivar para cosechar, para cuando nazcan sus hijos que desean tener dos, tengan un lugar propio en donde vivir, ya que actualmente viven en casa de sus padres.
texts.en:
Hugo is 19 years old. He went to school through high school, and is married. His life's companion takes care of the home. They do not have children yet.  

This young man  grow 14,000 square meters of sesame. He farms because his grandfather taught him to. They have always grown basic grains. His work is close to the house and he only has to walk a kilometer to get there. He works six hours a day and about two more hours talking care of two young cows, grazing them so they can fatten up.

With the loan that he is asking the CAMPO foundation for, he will rent the land and prepare the soil, since this is done with equipment. What he seeks is to have a good yield of sesame and thus have more money available for next year. He will be satisfying the need to see his crop and his life flourish.  

His dream are to be a happy family where there is understanding and to grow and harvest so that when the two children they want are born, they will have a place of their own where they can live. RIght now they are living in his parents' house.

loans.use: to rent land, and to pay for preparing the soil, since it is done with equipment.

loans.name: Jepkemboi

texts.en:
Jepkemboi is 45 years old.  She is single and the mother of 2 children who are 21 and 12 years old.  She runs a retail shop in Eldama Ravine and has been in operation for 10 years.  She earns an income of 30,000 KES.

This is her third loan.  With the 80,000 KES loan from KADET she intends to purchase tea leaves, washing detergents, corn flour, wheat flour, cooking fat and oil, and other stock for resale. The profits she gets will be used to repay the loan and educate her children.

Her dream is to prosper in her business and provide her children with the best education.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her retail shop.

loans.name: Leopoldo Antonio

texts.es:
Leopoldo es un hombre de 35 años de edad, estudio hasta 9º grado, esta acompañado; su  pareja se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar.  Su hija vive con ellos ,también un hermano de él.


Don Leopoldo, trabaja en la agricultura y en la crianza de ganado, ya tiene aproximadamente 8 años de desempeñar esta actividad; la cual aprendió de su padre, quien ha sido agricultor toda su vida. Él viaja 1 km en bicicleta, desde su casa hasta el lugar en donde cultiva su milpa, su horario de trabajo es o de 7 a 11 de la mañana y por la tardes se dedica a cuidar su ganado y otros quehaceres .

El préstamo, sera de gran ayuda para comprar abono, pesticidas, herbicidas, pago para la preparación de la tierra y cultivar 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, también sembrara 7,000 metros cuadrados de sacate para pasto. Así, espera asegurar el alimento para el próximo año de su ganado, y obtener una buena  producción que le permita vender una parte para cancelar el crédito y seguir teniendo abiertas las puertas a futuros créditos.

El sueño que tiene Don Leopoldo, es mejorar la infraestructura de su casa, también con las ganancias obtenidas de la producción, tiene pensado mejorar su pequeño ganado. Para todo esto, sabe que podrá lograrlo, solamente si continua trabajando fuertemente, como hasta hoy lo ha hecho.
texts.en:
Leopoldo is 35 years old. He has a grade 9 education. He has a spouse who tends to the housework. His daughter lives with them, as does one of his brothers. 

Leopoldo has worked in agriculture and livestock breeding for approximately 8 years now. He learned these skills from his father, who has been a farmer all his life. He travels 1 km by bicycle from his home to the plot of land he cultivates. He works from 7 am to 11 am and in the afternoons he takes care of his cattle and does other chores. 

The loan will help him to buy manure, pesticides and herbicides, and to pay for the land to be tilled to cultivate 14,000 square metres of corn. He will also sow 7,000 square metres of grass for pasture. 

Thus, he hopes to ensure that his cattle have food for the next year. He hopes to have a good harvest, of which he will sell a portion to repay the loan and, thereby, continue to keep the door open to future loans. He dreams of improving the infrastructure of his home. Also, with the profit he makes he plans to increase his small herd. 

All of these plans, he understands, can only be achieved if he continues to work hard, as he has done thus far.

loans.use: to buy manure, pesticides and herbicides, and to pay for the land to be tilled to cultivate 14,000 square metres of corn. He will also sow 7,000 square metres of grass for pasture.

loans.name: José Ricardo

texts.es:
José de 56 años de edad, con un nivel académico de 3° año,  de profesión agricultor, esta casado y han procreado 4 hijos de 24, 21, 19 y 16 años de edad. 

Él desempeña la agricultura desde la edad de 12 años de edad, el trabajo lo aprendió con su papá nunca se a dedicado a otro trabajo, tampoco tiene otras actividades económicas. El trabajo lo desempeñan con su familia se involucra su esposa y sus hijos, en donde cultiva esta a medio kilómetro de la casa trabajan cuatro horas diarias.

Con el préstamo solicitado a fundación CAMPO comprara 12 sacos de abono, y pagara quien le ayude a la preparación de la tierra.  Al tener la posibilidad de cultivar 21,000 metros cuadrados de maicillera, tendrá más producción; por lo que, en ese momento va a poder comprar lo mas vital para la vida de su familia.

Sus sueños para el futuro es tener una familia ejemplar, con una visión amplia, dispuesta a salir adelante, que todos los recursos que lleguen los inviertan en algo productivo y que en el siguiente año siempre tenga el apoyo de alguna institución.
texts.en:
José is 56 years old with a 3rd level education. He is a farmer by trade. married and has 4 children aged 24, 21, 19 and 16. 

He has been working as a farmer since he was 12 years ol. He learned the work from his father and has never done any other type of work and has no other economic activity. He does the work with his family, involving is wife and children. He grows half a kilometer away from his house and works four hours a day.

With the loan he has asked for from Fundación CAMPO he will buy 12 sacks of fertilizer and pay for help to prepare the soil. With the possibility of planting 21,000 square meters of corn, he will have a bigger yield. That is why, at this time, he is going to buy what is most important for his family's life. 

His dreams for the future are to have an exemplary family with a broad vision and willing to get ahead, and for all the resources they can earn to be invested in something productive, and for next year to always have the support of an institution.

loans.use: to buy 12 sacks of fertilizer and to pay for help to prepare the soil.

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es: Liliana, a sus 24 años de edad, es casada y madre de una hija. Luego de culminar sus estudios secundarios, se dedicó a desempeñarse como vendedora de productos sobre pedido, con lo que ha podido generar ingresos para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar.
