Con el fin de mejorar sus ingresos y estabilizar su economía, desea iniciar un almacén de ropa y accesorios, para lo cual adecuará un espacio en la casa donde reside, además desea aprovechar que ya tiene buena clientela que le solicita los productos; esta es la razón por la que se motiva a solicitar el crédito, lo invertirá en la compra de mercancía al por mayor (jeans, blusas, camisetas, shorts, collares, aretas, anillos, entre otros), realizar adecuaciones del espacio y comprar activos fijos (vitrina, maniquí, estantes y ganchos para colgar la ropa), de esta manera podrá dar inicio a su proyecto, con el cual espera generar oportunidades de empleo y buenos ingresos para continuar velando por el bienestar de su familia. Liliana sueña con acreditar y fortalecer su negocio, logrando que sea rentable y sostenible en el tiempo, para que le brinde la posibilidad de progresar, brindar a su hija una excelente educación y mejorar el nivel de vida de su núcleo familiar.
texts.en: Liliana is 24 years old. She is married and the mother of a daughter. After finishing high school, she decided to work as a merchant selling things via catalog. She has been able to generate income to support her husband with the household expenses. In order to improve her income and stabilize their finances, she want to open a clothing and accessories store. She will outfit a space in her house where she lives. She wants to take advantage of the fact that she has good customers who ask for her products. That is what is motivating her to ask for this loan. She will invest it in buying merchandise wholesale (jeans, blouses, t-shirts, shorts, necklaces, earrings, rings and more), in making improvements on the space and in buying fixed assets (a display case, a mannequin, shelves and hooks to hang the clothes). This way, she will be able to start her project, with which she hopes to generate employment opportunities and good income to keep looking out for her family's well being. Liliana dreams of accrediting and fortifying her business, making it profitable and sustainable over time, so that it will offer her the possibility of progressing and offering her daughter an excellent education, improving her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise wholesale (jeans, blouses, t-shirts, shorts, necklaces, earrings, rings, and more), do some improvements on the space and to buy  fixed assets (a display case, a mannequin, shelves, and hooks to hang the clothes).

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en: Arlene is 38 years old, widowed, and has a child. To earn an income, she sells grocery items in their village. She has been in this business for less than a year and hopes to continue selling more. Due to insufficient funds, she is applying for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods and soft drinks to sell in her store. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow so that she can able to generate more income and earn more profits.

loans.use: to buy canned goods and soft drinks to sell in her store.

loans.name: Elba Marina

texts.es: Elba tiene 36 años de edad, esta casada, tiene 4 hijos y vive con su familia en el municipio de Yoro. Doña Elba tiene más de 4 años de dedicarse a su propia actividad de negocio. En su casa tiene una pulpería donde vende productos alimenticios como granos básicos, azúcar, pan, manteca, pastas, refrescos, churros, jabón etc. y también vende mercadería como ropa de niño de manera ambulante. Esta solicitando un segundo préstamo el cual es por 7,000 Lempiras para poder comprar productos alimenticios como granos básicos, refrescos, churros, manteca, harina de maíz etc. para surtir la pulpería y comprar ropa de niño para revender. Su plan es hacer crecer el negocio y que llegue a ser auto sostenible.
texts.en:
Elba is 36 years old, married, and has four children.  She lives with her family in the town of Yoro.  Elba has worked for more than four years at her store.  She has a grocery store in her home where she sells food products such as basic grains, sugar, bread, butter, pasta, sodas, churros, soap, and other items.  She also sells merchandise like children's clothing as a street vendor.  

Elba is requesting a second loan for 7,000 lempiras to purchase food products such as basic grains, sodas, churros, butter, corn flour, and other items to stock her store and to purchase children's clothing to resell.  Her plan is to grow her business so that it can become self-sustaining.

loans.use: to purchase more food products such as sodas, churros, butter, and corn flour, and to purchase children's clothing to sell.

loans.name: Yeny Lizzett

texts.es: Yeny, tiene 41 años de edad, es casada, tiene 3 hijos y vive en el municipio de San Pedro Sula con su familia. ella siempre se ha dedicado al comercio, inicio vendiendo mercadería como ropa. Hace tres años decidió elaborar y vender baleadas (tortilla de harina rellena con frijoles, huevo, queso etc.), pastelitos de harina de maíz rellenos con carne y pupusas de chicharrón o quesillo. Este negocio lo tiene establecido en un local que alquila en el mercado local. Para suplir de materia prima ha decidido solicitar otro préstamo a ODEF el cual es por 12,500 Lempiras, y comprara harina, carnes, condimentos, manteca, frijoles y otros. Su sueño es llegar a tener otro negocio para darle un buen futuro a su familia.
texts.en: Yeny is 41 years old. She is married, has 3 children, and lives in the town of San Pedro Sula with her family. She has always worked as a merchant. She started selling merchandise such as clothing. Three years ago, she decided to make and sell baleadas (flour tortillas filled with beans, egg, cheese, etc.), little corn meal pastries filled with meta, chicharrón or cheese pupusas. She has set up this business in a locale that she rents in the local market. To stock up on raw materials, she has decided to ask ODEF for a loan of 12,500 lempiras to buy flour, meat, seasonings, lard, beans and more. Her dream is to have another business to give her family a good future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as flour, meat, seasonings, lard, beans and more to make and sell food.

loans.name: Haytham

texts.en: Haytham is a 26-year-old Palestinian man, married, who has worked and lived in a Palestinian Camp since he was born, in Lebanon, with limited access to fields to work in. Haytham has been manufacturing and selling plastic products for nine months, but his business isn't large enough to cover his family's needs, which is why he is working hard to introduce his customers to new products, to be sold in parallel to the products he already has available. Through a youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, Haytham will diversify his business products by starting to sell detergents, tissue paper, and other paper products. He hopes to expand his business and start selling his products all over Lebanon and then worldwide, soon.

loans.use: to diversify his business products by starting to sell detergents, tissue paper, and other paper products.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 53 years old, from Olkalou. He is married to Martha, who produces additional income for the family. They have five children, ages 16, 14, 10, 8 and 5. He is in the business of quarrying, which has been in operation for the past three years, and his monthly income at present is KES 12,000. He has applied for his third loan from Kadet Ltd, of KES 20,000, and his plan is to use it to  hire more laborers to work in his quarry. John intends to use the anticipated profits to expand his quarrying business, and his hope and dream is to buy a plot of land and build rental houses in the future.

loans.use: to hire more laborers to work in his quarry.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 55 and married. Her children are now grown up, and now she takes care of her husband and a grandson. 

She manages a quarrying mining business and sells building materials in Narok and the surrounding towns.

Jane has run the business for six years, making a monthly income of KES 35,000. 

She has now acquired her sixth loan of KES 70,000, which will be used to facilitate  transporting the building materials to the market. She will use the proceeds to extend her rental houses in her plot.

Her dream is to own a construction company.

loans.use: to transport building materials.

loans.name: Grace

texts.es: Doña Grace es madre de familia, ella siempre ha sacado adelante a sus hijas. ahora quiere tener su negocio propio, por lo que necesita de un préstamo de un millón de colones (1.000.000) para comprar mercadería como ropa y zapatos para vender en la comunidad. con esto pretende tener su negocio propio y así darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Grace is a female head of household.  She has always supported her daughters and now she wants to have her own business.  She needs a loan of 1,000,000 colones to purchase merchandise like clothing and shoes to sell in the community.  With this, she will be able to have her own business and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en: Felicidad works hard to support her family. Felicidad is married and has a bread-vending business in the Philippines. Felicidad applied for a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more bread to sell. Felicidad has been in this business for 10 years. Felicidad would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more bread to sell.

loans.name: Mamusu

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Mamusu. She is married, and has one child, age 6 years. She has no additional dependents.

In 2008, Mamusu established her cosmetics business. She began her business to get additional income for providing a livelihood for her family because her husband's salary is too small to keep up the home. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 900,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. Mamusu requires a loan in order to buy more cosmetics of different kinds for resale. In the future, Mamusu plans to improve her business in such a way that she is able to generate enough profit to support her children’s education to university level. She is a very hardworking woman. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics of different kinds for resale.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 31 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Irene has been farming rice for five years and also earns additional income from raising pigs and ducks.

Irene is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Rubenia Del Rosario

texts.es:
Rubenia de 39 años de edad, esta casada y tiene 2 hijos. Debido a la pobreza en que sus padres vivian, estudio hasta el séptimo grado; cuando se caso no tenían un empleo formal, fue así como encontraron en la cría de cerdos su fuente de ingresos, para la subsistencia de su familia. Hace 3 años comenzaron a construir chiqueros con techo y piso de cemento, para que sus cerdos tengan mejores condiciones, todos los días por la mañana, lava los pisos de cada chiquero, les proporciona agua limpia y les da de comer a sus cerdos, por la tarde hace el mismo procedimiento, sus cerdas son de raza y cuando estas paren, vende las crías de un mes de edad.          

Ella adquiere,  sus cerdos a otras granjas que tienen cerdos de razas mejoradas, para ello debe contratar un pick-up, para que realice el viaje, el cual puede variar en precio, según la distancia a donde vaya a comprar.

Solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar 6 cerdas de raza, las cuales serán utilizadas como raseras o pie de cría. Con esto ayudara también a otras personas que le compran uno o dos cerditos, para engorde y obtener algunos ingresos, para sus familias.

Al tener mayor cantidad de cerdas, podrá incrementar sus ventas y sus ingresos, para dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Esta planificando ahorrar, para mejorar su vivienda y construir un muro perimetral de ladrillo.
texts.en:
Rubenia is 39 and is married with two children. Due to the poverty her parents lived in, she only went to school until the 7th grade. When she married she didn't have formal employment, and so she found the money to feed her family by breeding pigs. Three years ago she began to build pigsties with cement roofs and floors to provide better conditions for the pigs. Every morning she washes the floor of each pigsty and gives the pigs clean water and food. In the afternoon she does the same. Her pigs are purebred and she sells their piglets when they are one month old.

Rubenia buys her pigs from other farms with better breeds. She has to hire a pick-up to make the journey, which varies in price depending on the distance  she has to go to make the purchase. She is asking for a loan from Fundación Campo to buy six purebred pigs, which she will use as breeding stock. She will also be able to help other people to buy one or two piglets which they can raise to provide a source of income for their families.

Once Rubenia has a greater number of pigs, she will be able to increase her sales and earnings and give her family a better quality of life. She is planning to save money to improve their house and build a perimeter wall.

loans.use: to buy six purebred pigs to be used as breeding stock.

loans.name: Tsungirirai Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 53-year-old Trace from Mutare. Trace is a member of Tsungirirai Group. She is married and has five children, one of whom attends school. She also cares for four dependents. Trace runs an agricultural business, breeding chickens. The business has been in operation for six years. She says the main challenge she faces is debtors' failing to pay on time. Trace has applied for a loan of $600 to buy day-old chicks and feed for her poultry business. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her family’s general welfare. In the future, Trace plans to increase the number of chicks she can breed and supply to the supermarket in town.

loans.use: to buy chicks and feed for her poultry business.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en: Letecia is 40 years old, married, and has four children. She earns a living from a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Letecia is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs. Letecia has been in this business for 10 years, and she earns additional income from buying and selling bananas. She works tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rabiaa

texts.en: Rabiaa is a 57-year-old widow, the mother of two children. She is responsible for their lives, since her husband passed away. She started twelve years ago, working as a salesperson to improve her family's living conditions. Rabiaa is taking out a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to start her own new business, selling clothes, which will surely improve her family's socioeconomic situation. Rabiaa will start doing business from her house and will market her clothes to neighbors and friends. She might also use the door-to-door technique to widen her working zone. She hopes that, one day, she'll be financially capable of handling the expenses of opening a clothes shop of her own and settling in her own business.

loans.use: to  start her own new business, selling clothes.

loans.name: Kabayan Group

texts.en:
Larida is the featured borrower of Kabayan Group. She got along with the other group members to apply for a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, because they are friends and consider themselves as one family, since they left the Philippines and came to Lebanon for the same reason, which is providing their families back there a good standard of living.

Larida is the third one from the right wearing purple. She is a 53-year-old divorced mother of six children who works as a housekeeper to provide them with a good standard of living and the best education.

At the same time, she is a physiotherapist, and she does this as an additional income-making business. Her acquired loan will be sent to her children to pay for their university fees and needs. She is still hoping that one day, she will open a special physiotherapy center and improve her family's social and financial living.

As for the other group members, Daisy is the one with the yellow shirt, Juanita is the one with the green shirt, Gemma is wearing an orange shirt, Nelly wearing a black shirt and Leticia is wearing a white shirt.

loans.use: To pay for her children's university fees and needs.

loans.name: Husein

texts.en: Husein is a 28-year-old married father of one child. He has been working in auto repair for seven years. Husein is a hard worker, with a very good reputation in his domain and area. He is specialized in fixing and selling car exhaust systems and in changing oil. His business is going on just fine, because of his special talents. Today he is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy car oils and exhaust pipes that are necessary to develop his business. He hopes that, in the future, he might start offering car accessories that are more attractive to customers, which would provide him with additional business and more income.

loans.use: To buy necessary car oils and exhaust pipes to develop his business

loans.name: Arleen

texts.en:
Arleen, 40, is a married woman with five children. For of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Arleen has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 13 years.

Arleen requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like vegetables, spices, rice, meat, etc. for her food production business. Arleen would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like vegetables, spices, rice, meat, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna works hard to support her family. Myrna is married and has a business raising livestock in the Philippines. Myrna applied for a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed, vaccines and other supplies for her livestock. Myrna has been in this business for five years. Myrna would like to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vaccines and other supplies for her livestock

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Magdalena works hard to support her family.

She prepares and sells dried fish in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising livestock.  

Magdalena is borrowing PHP 37,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish for making dried fish to sell to her customers.

Magdalena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish for making dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Nare

texts.en: This nice young lady lives in the city of Kapan. She is married and has two daughters. Nare graduated from Goris State University in the history department. She lives in a large family, where everyone works very hard to be able to provide their family with good living conditions. Nare lives with her husband, two daughters, father and mother-in-law, and her husband’s two sisters. For three years, Nare has been engaged in the business of selling clothes. She has rented a shop, where she mainly sells jeans for children and teenagers. She mentioned that young people visit her shop very often. Jeans are very convenient, as they can be worn every day with pleasure. People do not get tired of them, and the more worn-out they get, the more fashionable they become. Nare is applying for a loan 1,100,000 AMD (Armenian drams) to acquire a new collection of jeans for the fall-winter season.

loans.use: to buy new collection of jeans for the fall-winter season.

loans.name: Cloudimit

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Cloudimit works hard to support her family. She has a business of raising pigs in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Cloudimit is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Cloudimit has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rosa Angélica

texts.es:
Rosa de 34 años de edad,  estudio 3ª grado de educación,es casada y su esposo trabaja en la agricultura y jornaleando, han procreado 4 hijos de 7, 10, 15 y 18 años; sus 2 hijos mayores también trabajan y 2 estudian.
. 
Ella  se dedica ala agricultura desde hace 17 años, lo  aprendió de sus padres y se tarda 5 minutas para llegar donde tiene sembrado 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, también cuida una vaca que le esta dando leche y 3 terneros pequeños los cuales lleva a pastar a unos 300 metros de su casa.

Necesita el crédito para la compra  de 1 bolsa de semilla de maíz , 5 saco de abono  y pesticidas.  

Su deseo es,  mejorar su propia vivienda ,ademas espera sacar adelante académicamente sus dos hijos que estudian , gracias al préstamo podrá tener una buena producción en su cultivo, el cual le generara mejores ingresos a su familia y con las ganancias  espera hacerle mejoras a su vivienda; también sueña con comprar mas ganado.
texts.en:
Rosa is 34 years old and she studied through third grade in school.  She is married and her husband works as a farmer and a day laborer.  They have four children who are 7, 10, 15, and 18 years old.  Her two oldest children work and the other two attend school.  

She has worked as a farmer for 17 years and she learned the work from her parents.  It takes her five minutes to get to her fields where she has 7,000 square meters of corn planted. She also cares for a cow that gives milk and its three small calves, which are all pastured about 300 meters from her house. 

She is requesting this loan to purchase one sacks of corn seeds, five sacks of fertilizer, and pesticides.  Her dream is to improve her home and she also hopes that her two children who are in school will succeed academically.  Thanks to the loan, she will have a good production of her crop, which will generate more income for her family.  She hopes to make improvements to her home with the profits and also dreams of purchasing more livestock.

loans.use: to purchase a bag of corn seeds, five sacks of fertilizer, and pesticides.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 51 years old from Olkalou. He is married to Macherina, who is a farmer, and they have 3 children aged 27, 24 and 21 years old.

He is in the business of quarrying which he has been running for the past 15 years, and he has applied for a fifth loan of Kshs 100,000 from Kadet Ltd which he plans to use for buying a machine for making fibre in the Jua Kali industry (manufacturing sector).

Julius' income at present is about Kshs 30,000 and his hopes and dreams for the future are to buy a shamba (piece of land) and to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy a machine for making fibre in the Jua Kali industry.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is 39 years old from Nyahururu. She is married and her spouse produces some additional income to the family. They have two children, age 16 and 10 years old.

She is a farmer and has been in this occupation for the past one year. Her monthly income at present is KES 5,000.

She has applied for a loan of KES 20,000 from KADET Ltd., which she plans to use for buying chicken and chicken feeds. 

Annah's dreams for the future are to raise a happy family and to be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy chicken and chicken feeds.

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es: Jose Antonio es un joven luchador, el esta ayudando a su familia con los ingresos y darle el sustento. en la zona es muy difícil conseguir trabajo por lo que él ha tenido que viajar largas distancias para conseguir trabajo, por lo que necesita comprar una motocicleta para poder viajar a su trabajo todos los días y poder continuar aportando a los ingresos de su familia. el solicita un préstamo de un millón de colones (1.000.000) para la compra de esta motocicleta que le va ayudar mucho.
texts.en: Jose Antonio is a determined young man who uses his income to help his family and provide support for them.  In the area where he lives work is very difficult to come by and so he has had to travel long distances to find work.  For this reason he needs to buy motorbike so he can travel to work each day and continue providing income for his family.  He is seeking a million (1,000,000) colon loan to buy the motorbike which will be very useful to him.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for his work

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is 31 years old, married and a mother of four children between 13 and 3 years of age. 

She has run a retail shop in the Eure Ekule area of Narok county for the last 10 years. Jackline earns a monthly income of KES 20,000. 

With a third loan loan of KES 50,000 from KADET, she plans to restock her shop with a variety of consumable products.

The anticipated profits will be ploughed back to business for expansion. Her dream is to be successful in life.

loans.use: to add more stock for her retail shop.

loans.name: Leonardo De La Concepcion

texts.es: El señor Leonardo se dedica a su negocio de venta de productos de ferretería  y productos varios según la temporada desde hace 40 años  en el mercado, su negocio empezó con capital propio, con poco inventario es casado de el solo depende su esposa,  labora de lunes a domingo desde las siete de la mañana hasta las  cuatro y media de la tarde. solicita el financiamiento  para surtir su negocio de mercadería varias y ofrecerle a sus  clientes. para aprovechar las ventas.
texts.en:
Leonardo has worked at his business selling hardware products and seasonal products at the market for forty years.  He started the business with his own capital and little inventory.  He is married and the only person he supports is his wife.  He works from Monday to Sunday from 7:00am until 4:30pm.  

He is requesting this loan to stock his store with a variety of merchandise to offer to his customers to make the most of his sales.

loans.use: to purchase hardware items such as extension cords, power outlets, locks, hammers, and hoses.

loans.name: Chernor

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Chernor. He is married and has two children, aged 13 and 3 years. 

In 2008, Chernor established his drinks business. He began his business to help him provide a livelihood for his family. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,000,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. Chernor requires a loan in order to buy more drinks, pure water, etc. for resale. 

In the future, Chernor plans to establish a bigger shop, build his own house and educate his children. He is very hardworking. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more drinks for resale.

loans.name: Jorge Alfredo

texts.es: Don José Alfredo es un señor que toda su vida ha trabajado de la agricultura. el necesita seguir sembrando sus productos para darle el alimento a su familia. el necesita comprar abono y semillas para mantener su siembra, por lo que solicita un préstamo de un millón de colones (1.000.000). con esto va a poder seguir cosechando y vendiendo sus productos y seguir manteniendo a su familia como lo ha hecho hasta ahora.
texts.en: José Alfredo has worked in agriculture his whole life. He needs to carry on cultivating his produce in order to feed his family. He needs to buy seeds and fertiliser for the upkeep of his crops, so he is asking for a loan of one million colones. With the money he will be able to continue harvesting and selling his produce and providing for his family as he has always done.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertiliser.

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es:
Don Miguel cuenta con 63 ,no tiene ningún grado educativo, su esposa se dedica al quehacer del hogar ,y sus 3 hijos quienes viven aparte, pero le ayudan en las actividades agrícolas; por lo tanto solo viven con él su esposa y dos nietos. 

Toda su vida sea dedicado a la agricultura, activated que la aprendio de sus padres. También se dedica al traslado de personas en una canoa de un extremo al otro  del río grande, desde hace 18 años realiza esta labor,  dicho trabajo esta 300 metros de su casa el cual lo hace de 4:00 a.m. A 7:00 p.m.

Necesita el crédito para la compra de 8 sacos  de abono y también rentara un terreno para cultivarlo de regadillo. Gracias al préstamo podrá tener una mejor producción en sus cultivos y podrá tener mejores ingresos a su familia
. 
Don Miguel, desea tener un pequeño ato de ganado, equipado con una picador de sacate;el cual le genere ingreso que sus hijos y nietos puedan tener una fuente de trabajo también piensa mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Miguel is 63 years old and never attended school.  His wife takes care of their home and their three children live independently, but help with the farming.  His wife and two grandchildren live with him.

He has worked as a farmer all of his life and learned the work from his parents.  He has also worked for 18 years transporting people in a canoe from one side of the river to the other.  This work is 300 meters from his house and he works from 4:00am until 7:00pm.

He is requesting this loan to purchase eight sacks of fertilizer and also to rent a field to cultivate irrigated crops.  Thanks to this loan, he will be able to have a better production of his crops and be able to earn more income for his family.  Miguel also wants to have a small number of livestock along with someone to care for them.  This will generate income and his children and grandchildren can have a source of work.  He would also like to make improvements to his home.

loans.use: to purchase 8 sacks of fertilizer and rent a field to plant irrigated crops.

loans.name: Madonna

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Madonna works hard to support her family.

She sells dried fish in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fishing. 

Madonna is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF in order to purchase more dried fish to sell to her customers.

Madonna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell .

loans.name: Johnny

texts.es: Johnny es un joven muy luchador, el actualmente ha hecho grandes esfuerzos por sembrar piña. el necesita comprar mas abono y pagar el proceso de recolección de la piña, por lo que necesita un préstamo de un millón de colones (1.000.000) para comprar lo necesario. con esto va a poder vender el producto y así ayudar a su familia con los ingresos que tanto necesitan.
texts.en: Johnny is a hardworking young person.  He has currently made an effort to plant pineapple.  He needs to purchase more fertilizer and to pay for the process of collecting the pineapples.  He is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 colones to purchase the necessary items.  With this, he will be able to sell his products and therefore help his family with the income that they need.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for his pineapple crop.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 42 years old and married with two children.

Janet works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like canned goods, noodles, candies, biscuits, etc. to sell in her general store.

Janet has borrowed and paid back three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns additional income from buying and selling scrap materials and raising pigs.

Janet aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like canned goods, noodles, candies and biscuits to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Maria Elva

texts.es: Doña María, tiene 64 años de edad, esta soltera, tiene 3 hijos y vive en el municipio de Gracias, Lempira junto a dos hijas. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la agricultura pero hace aproximadamente 20 años decidió administrar una cafetería en uno de los colegios de la zona. Allí ofrece baleadas (tortilla rellena con huevos frijoles queso etc. pastelitos, tajadas, golosinas como churros, dulces, refrescos, jugos, galletas, frutas y otros. Decidió solicitar un sexto ciclo de préstamo en ODEF que es por 12,000 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar los insumos para elaborar comida como ser carnes, harina, manteca, condimentos, y también churros, refrescos, dulces, galletas, tajadas, frutas y otras golosinas para ofrecer variedad de productos. Su plan es seguir ayudando a sus hijas y a sus nietos y también que su negocio este mejor.
texts.en: María, 64, is single, has three children and lives in the town of Gracias, Lempira, with her two daughters. She used to work in agriculture but about 20 years ago decided to start running a cafeteria in one of the town's schools. She serves baleadas (tortillas filled with eggs, beans, cheese etc.), cakes, tajadas (deep-fried banana slices), churros, sweets, juice, biscuits, fruit and other items. María decided to request a sixth loan from ODEF for 12,000 lempiras, with which she will buy the ingredients for making food, including meat, flour, butter and condiments. She will also buy churros, soft drinks, desserts, biscuits, tajadas, fruit and other sweets so she can offer a variety of products. Her plan is to carry on helping her daughters and grandchildren and to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her business, including soft drinks, churros, tajadas, biscuits, fruit, sweets etc.

loans.name: Cynthia's Group

texts.en:
This group, which was created in February 2012, is composed of women who are very engaged and eager to achieve success in their business. They have a team spirit and are ready to help each other. They all live in the same neighborhood and work mainly as traders. They are involved in the sale of vegetables, second-hand clothing, underwear, plastic products, tinned tomatoes and cooking oil.

Cynthia (the one standing third from right in the photograph) is the star borrower of the group. She is married and the mother of two: one boy and one girl. She has a wooden stand where she sells vegetables (garden eggs, onions, tomatoes, peppers) to customers to use at home or in their businesses (food joints and chop bars). She buys her produce at the wholesale market in order to sell it as retail. 

With her new loan amount of GHS 600 she will buy one box of tomatoes, one mini bag of garden eggs and one mini bag of onions to sell to customers. Her earnings will allow her to bolster her savings and help her husband with the school costs for their children.

Together, she and her colleagues need a total amount of GHS 3,600 to increase their stock.

loans.use: To buy one box of tomatoes, one mini bag of garden eggs and one mini bag of onions to sell to customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more drinks of different kind for resale.

loans.name: Jose Jesus

texts.es: Don Jose, tiene 50 años de edad, es casado, tiene 3 hijos con su esposa y vive en el Municipio de Gracias junto a su esposa y dos de sus hijos. Toda la vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura de granos básicos. Lleva varios años de dedicarse a cultivar café esta producción la vende en grano seco en las bodegas de la zona, siendo esta actividad su fuente de ingresos. Ha solicitado un préstamo por 15,000 Lempiras para comprar abonos y fertilizantes para su finca de café y poder sacar mejor producción. El tiene como meta seguir trabajando para ayudar a sus hijos a  que estudien.
texts.en:
José, 50, is married and has three children with his wife.  He lives in the town of Gracias with his wife and two of the children.

José has worked in agriculture growing basic grains his whole life.  He has grown coffee for several years.  He sells the beans from his harvest in the area warehouses.  This is his source of income.

José has requested a loan for 15,000 lempiras [HNL] to buy soil amendments and fertilizer for his coffee farm to be able to get a better crop.

His goal is to keep on working to help his children to go to school.

loans.use: to buy soil amendments and fertilizer

loans.name: Roxene

texts.en:
Roxene is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to purchase more fruits to sell on her fruit stall . 

Roxene has been in this business for 11 years. Roxene earns additional income from food-vending.

Roxene has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits to sell on her fruit stall.

loans.name: María Marta Haydee

texts.es:
María de 56 años de edad, esta acompañada  y tiene 3 hijos, por situaciones de la pobreza en que sus padres la criaron, solo estudio primer grado. Por esta razón nunca encontró un empleo formal, y tuvo que buscar actividades familiares que le permitieran obtener algunos ingresos, para alimentar a su familia; fue así que comenzó a trabajar en la cría de ganado de repasto y en la agricultura.

Todo el grupo familiar se involucra en estas labores, también tiene un estanque donde cría camarón y pescado, para venderle a los vecinos de su comunidad.     

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 2 vacas paridas. Al comprar sus vacas,  tendrá alimento e ingresos adicionales para su familia, también le venderá leche a sus vecinos. Con lo que podrá suplir otras necesidades de su grupo familiar. 

Ella esta pensando que en un futuro, comprara varias vacas lecheras, ya que es una forma de obtener ingresos diarios, para mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
María, 56, is married and has three children.  She only went to first grade because of the poverty in which her parents raised her.  This is why she never found a formal job and had to look for family jobs to earn some income to feed her family.  This is how María started working in agriculture and raising grazing livestock.

The whole family is involved in this work.  María also has a pond where she raises shrimp and fish to sell to the neighbors in her community.

The loan María's requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy two calved cows.  With them she'll have food and an additional income for her family.  She'll also sell milk to her neighbors and be able to supply other needs for her family.

María's thinking that in the future she'll buy several dairy cows so she can earn a daily income to improve her house.

loans.use: to buy two calved cows

loans.name: Zena

texts.en:
Zena is 42 years old, married and has six children, one of whom is in school.  

Zena is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Zena requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Zena has been raising pigs for eight years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Zena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Upendo-Oysterbay Group

texts.en:
Hassani, who is in his late 20s, is married with two kids - a boy and a girl who are in school. For six months now, Hassani has been running a shop selling rice, cooking oil, maize and baking flour, soaps, kerosene, water, soda, juices and other consumable and durable items. He works from 6am to 10pm daily and is able to make a fair return per month. 

This will be his first loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania, which he will use to buy more food items, sacks of rice, cooking oil, maize flour, and sodas. Hassani dreams that one day he will be able to open a wholesale shop. Hassani will share this loan with his loan group "Upendo-Oysterbay" which has 12 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more food items: sacks of rice, cooking oil, maize flour, sodas.

loans.name: Zarifa

texts.ru: Зарифа трудолюбивая женщина. Ей 43 года. Она вдова и воспитывает 2 детей. Ее дети совершеннолетние. Зарифа единственная кормилица своих детей. Она более 13 лет занимается купле продажей запчастей велосипедов. Она справляется с бизнесом сама и развевает свой бизнес, так как она уже имеет большой опыт. Зарифа торгует на местном рынке и имеет свою точку продажи. Зарифа хочет развевать свой бизнес и получать больше дохода, так как ее дети растут и требуют больше благ. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки запчастей от велосипедов для пополнения оборотного капитала. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Zarifa is a hardworking woman. She is 43 years old, a widow, and has two children. Her children are grown. She is their sole provider. She has been buying and selling bicycle parts for over 13 years. She runs the business herself, and wants to further develop it since she already has a lot of experience. Zarifa sells at a local market where she has her own stall. She would like to expand the business and earn a better profit, since her children are growing and needing more. She is asking for a 3000 somoni loan to buy bicycle parts to expand her working capital. She hopes for your generosity.

loans.use: To buy bicycle parts to increase working capital

loans.name: Ayda

texts.en:
Ayda is a 23-year-old Lebanese engaged woman. Her fiancé works as an employee at a local food company. As for her, she is a makeup artist working at this occupation since 2009. She serves her customers at her house. In addition, Ayda has been working at a local company since 2006 in order to earn a higher income and be able to save (in cooperation with her fiancé) the needed money to be able to afford their wedding expenses. 

Today, Ayda is applying for a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. She notes that she will purchase new tools and beauty products and she is ready to provide her customers with a better quality of services. That’s how she will be able to gain higher income, expand her business, and enhance the way of living she is seeking. 

In the future, she wants to open her own beauty center where she will start hairdressing services as well.

loans.use: purchase new tools and beauty products

loans.name: Marlen

texts.es:
Marlen tiene 30 años de edad es agricultora y ama de casa madre de 4 hijos de los cuales sus 3 primeros hijos fueron procreados en un matrimonio del cual el esposo la abandono emigrando para EE.UU y aunque en ocasiones le ayudaba económicamente solo podía solventar ciertos gastos desde entonces ella trabaja la agricultura. Después de un tiempo ella decidió rehacer su vida formando un nuevo hogar del cual nació su 4 hijo siendo su actual esposo con quien ella desempeña la agricultura. El hijo mayor tiene 14 años y estudia el primer curso de ciclo común el cual durante la semana vive con sus abuelos paternos pero los fines de semana ayuda a su madre en la agricultura, el segundo y tercer hijo están en la escuela de 12 y 10 años respectivamente y por último la cuarta hija la cual tiene 13 meses. Su especialidad es la siembra de café ya que ella aprendió a trabajar la tierra con sus padres desde que tenía 6 años, sin embargo últimamente apoya más a su esposo en el tiempo de la corta ya que desde su ultimo embarazo ella tiene que estar al cuido de sus hijos y sobretodo de la menor. La tierra que cultivan es propia y la casa donde viven está ubicada en la misma propiedad por esta razón a ellos se les facilita más su mantenimiento y cuidado. Ellos venden el café a una persona de la comunidad que se dedica a comprar y a su vez esta persona revende el producto a bodegas que se dedican exclusivamente a la compra-venta de café ubicadas en las diferentes comunidades de la zona.

Marlen sueña y desea que sus hijos cumplan con sus sueños de prepararse académicamente ya que ella y la mayoría de las personas de la comunidad solo hicieron la escuela. También sueña con dejarles las tierras para que su hija menor tenga un mejor nivel de vida, ya que sus otros hijos tienen a su papa en estados unidos quien les apoya.

Ella actualmente ha solicitado un apoyo financiero para la compra de 3 QQ de urea, 3 QQ de fórmula 12-24-12, 2 sacos de fertilizantes, 2 litros de fungicida, 3 litros de plaguicida y 3 litros de foliares para dar mantenimiento y asistencia a sus cultivos de café.
texts.en:
Marlen is 30 years old and works as a farmer and housewife.  She is the mother of four children.  Her three first children were born in a marriage where her husband abandoned her to immigrate to the United States.  Although he sometimes helps financially, she is only able to meet certain expenses, so she also works as a farmer.  After a time, she decided to restart her life and formed a new household.  Her fourth child was born with her new husband, with whom she works in agriculture.  Her oldest son is 14 years old and is studying in the first common cycle.  During the week he lives with his paternal grandparents and on the weekends helps his mother with farming.  Her second and third children are 12 and 10 years old and attend school.  Her youngest daughter is 13 months old.  

She specializes in planting coffee since she learned to work the land with her parents since she was six years old.  Lately her husband has been supporting them more since she has been caring for the children, and especially the youngest, since her last pregnancy.  They own the land they cultivate and the house where they live is located on the same property since it makes it easier to maintain and care for the crops.  They sell the coffee to a person in the community who works purchasing coffee and later resells it to stores that exclusively buy and sell coffee located in different communities in the area.

Marlen dreams and hopes that her children achieve their dreams of academic success since she and the majority of people in her community only attended primary school.  She also dreams of leaving the fields so that her youngest daughter can have a better quality of life, since the other children have a father in the United States who supports them.

She is requesting a loan to purchase three quintals of urea, three quintals of formula 12-24-12, two sacks of fertilizer, two liters of fungicide, three liters of plaguicide, and three liters of foliar fertilizer to maintain and help her coffee crops.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Abdulgany

texts.ru: Абдулгани 32 года. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Дети еще маленькие, а жена домохозяйка и поэтому Абдулгани является единственным кормильцем семьи. Он с 2002 года работает в государственном учреждении по землеустройству. Он имеет высшее образование и успешно ведет своё дело. Он трудолюбивый и порядочный человек и поэтому его коллеги уважают его. Абдулгани хочет купить мебель для своего дома, но не имеет денег. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 долларов США для покупки мебели для дома. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Abdulgany is 32 years old. He is married and has three children. The children are still young and his wife is a homemaker, so Abdulgany is the sole provider for the family. He has worked for a government agency as a land use planner since 2002. He has a university education and is successful in his work. He is respected by his colleagues for being a hardworking and organized person. Abdulgany wants to buy furniture for his house, but does not have the money to do so. He is asking for a 1000 USD loan to buy the furniture. He hopes for and awaits your generosity.

loans.use: To buy furniture for his household

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara is a 36-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and four children. She cooperates financially with her husband who works as a baker to be able to pay the heavy costs of living.  Tamara and her husband work in the same field, producing bread and pastries.  She has been involved in this type of business since 2006 and her business is located at her house. 

With her requested loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, she will renew her oven and purchase raw materials such as flour, salt, sugar and butter, which she needs to continue production and expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she seeks to expand her business. She hopes that her business will grow to be able to ensure a good future to her children through all her hard work on her business.

loans.use: to renew her oven and purchase raw materials such as flour, salt, sugar and butter

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 50 years old and married with nine children, four of whom are in school.

Elena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock like soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, etc.

Elena has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 14 years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Elena aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is 51 years old, married, and has two children. 

Marcelina is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feed for her pigs.

Marcelina has been raising pigs for 18 years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Marcelina would like to save enough money for the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feed for her pigs

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara is 54 years old and she lives in the village Astghaberd in Syunik region. She has no higher education, but she is a very clever and bright woman and now she works at the municipality as a chief accountant. Tamara is a widow; she has a daughter and a son. Her daughter is married and she lives separately. Her son is still school-aged, and he greatly helps his mother in their farm and agricultural activities. They have a small and very nice farm, where they are raising two bulls, a cow, two calves and twenty chickens. They also have a plot of land on which Tamara cultivates potatoes, cabbages, beetroot, sunflowers and she also raises beautiful and colorful flowers all over her vegetable garden. 

Tamara says that she is very happy in her small house and farm, since she is surrounded by the beauties of nature; by flowers that she has raised herself, farm animals that she takes care of with kindness and love, and her children whose love helps Tamara to work cheerfully and enjoy their life.

Tamara is asking for a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams to buy a lot of animal fodder and potato seedlings. She is sure that this support will make her small, but happy family happier and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a lot of animal fodder and potato seedlings

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex was born in 1976 at Kagarama Village, Kyatoko – Rukungiri District. Alex studied up to senior four level and, due to lack of school fees, he ventured into doing his own business to earn a living. He is married with one child. He started his business in 2000 with a retail shop and a bar which he operated for several years. Then, later, he started doing cattle trade to increase his income.

To boost his cattle and retail business, Alex decided to join UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) for financial assistance for him to expand these businesses. With this loan, he is going to buy more cows for trade. This will enable him to increase his earnings, hence improving his livelihood.

loans.use: To buy more cows

loans.name: Artak

texts.en:
Artak is from Gyumri town where he lives with his wife. Artak is a producer and actor. 

He has been working as a producer for 7 years already and is very skilled. His last work was the film "Neutral Zone" where he was also an actor. In Gyumri there was very positive feedback about the film. For presenting the film abroad Artak has applied for this loan. Artak has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

With this loan's help Artak will be able to cover the costs of taking the film abroad and introducing it to foreigners.

loans.use: to pay for presenting the film abroad

loans.name: Isroilkhon

texts.ru: Исроилхон добрый и целеустремленный человек. Ему 24 года. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 1 ребенка, которому полтора года. Исроилхон более 6 лет занимается купле продажей мобильных телефонов, а также он ремонтирует мобильные телефоны. Исроилхон имеет точку продажи на местном рынке. Он с бизнесом справляется один. Исроилхон живет вместе женой, ребенком, мамой и братом. Его мать и брат занимаются бизнесом. Исроилхон хочет развевать бизнес. Для этого он должен увеличить оборотный капитал. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 2500 долларов США для покупки мобильных телефонов. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Isroilkhon is a kind and motivated person. He is 24 years old, married, and has a six month old baby. Isroilkhon has been selling and repairing mobile phones for over six years. He has a stall at a local market. He runs the business himself. Isroilkhon lives with his wife, child, mother, and brother. His mother and brother are in business too. Isroilkhon wants to further develop his business. To do that he needs to expand his working capital. He is asking for a 2500 USD loan to buy mobile phones. He awaits and hopes for your kindness and generosity.

loans.use: To buy mobile phones to increase working capital

loans.name: Alhaji Mustapha's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT to apply for a loan of SLL 21,100,000.00 for the entire group. With the help of this loan, they are being empowered to meet their most immediate and most pressing financial challenges. And at the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf.

Alhaji Mustapha is the featured leader of this group. Alhaji Mustapha is 41 year old. A native of Old Sefadu, he is married to a school teacher.  He has been a school teacher for 21 years now. He has requested this loan in order to pay school fees for his children and for himself to pursue further studies in college.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children and for himself pursue further studies in college

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en: Irshad is a 42-year-old married woman. She is a vigorous lady and, for the past three years, has been running a business of clothes sales.  She buys clothes of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. She is requesting a loan of Rs. 25,000 from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of clothes in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory.  She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and she plans to spend the part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of clothes in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a 25-year-old young, hardworking, single lady. She has one child aged 2 years. She earns a living from her tailoring shop. She has been in the business for the last 3 years making a monthly income of KES 10,000.

She learned about Kadet from a group of women in her neighbourhood who are already funded by Kadet Ltd. She is requesting her first loan of KES 30,000 which will enable her purchase a sewing machine to replace her very old one. This will mean more efficiency, thus increased sales and income.

She will use the proceeds to repay her loan as well as take care of her child. Her dream is to own a residencial plot.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Allen

texts.en: Allen was born in 1973 at Katojo-Kambuga, which is located in the Kanungu District. She is married and lives with her husband and their five children. She is a businesswoman who earns a living by providing catering services in Kambuga. She started the business in 1994 and it is her main source of income. She also has a retail shop which generates additional income. Allen is taking this loan to expand her catering business and provide her services to more people. She plans to buy more chairs and a tent to rent out as recreational facilities in her community. She wants to thank UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) and Kiva for the financial support which has allowed her to maintain her business and send her children to school. She encourages both organizations to continue supporting people like her because it allows them improve their standards of living. In this photograph we see Allen and the loan officer.

loans.use: to buy chairs and a tent for her business.

loans.name: Andreina

texts.es: Andreina es una joven emprendedora, ella tiene un pequeño negocio de cosméticos en la zona, sin embargo tiene muy poca variedad y los ingresos no son los suficientes para aportar a su familia. ella necesita de un préstamo de un millón de colones (1.000.000) para compara mas mercadería y productos de belleza, con lo que tendrá mejores ingresos y poder aportar a su familia.
texts.en: Andreina is a young entrepreneur. She has a small cosmetic business in her area. But she doesn't have much variety and the revenue is not sufficient to provide for her family. Andreina needs a loan of 1,000,000 CRC to buy more merchandise and beauty products so she can generate more income and support her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her cosmetic shop.

loans.name: Suraya

texts.en: Suraya is a 50-year-old widow who has run business selling milk with her husband for the past six years. She has three buffaloes which she uses for milk to sell to the people of her locality. She also sells butter and cheese to generate an extra amount of profit. Suraya has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her sixth loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 35,000. This will allow her to purchase one more buffalo. Suraya is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her and will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Zareena

texts.en: Zareena is 45 years old married woman and a mother of five children. For many years, she has been running a business of milk sales. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family when her husband was the only bread earner at that point in time. With the passage of time her sales increased and also her income. Now she has three buffaloes and one cow. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. While talking to the Kashf officer, she shared the feeling of achievement she got by sending her son to college for further studies. She is in her 4th loan cycle with Kashf Foundation. She has some savings and has applied for a loan of Rs. 30,000 to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Sameena

texts.en:
Sameena is a 39-year-old married woman who has been doing business milk selling for the past 17 years. She has two buffaloes which she uses for milk selling to the people of her locality. She also sells butter and cheese to generate an extra amount of profit. Sameena has become famous for providing good quality milk, and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. 

Sameena has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her fifth loan cycle, and has applied for a loan of PKR 25,000. This will allow her to purchase one more buffalo. 

She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her and will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida is a 46-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales 10 years ago. Over time, she has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, Khalida has gradually improved her business. She requested a loan of Rs. 30,000 to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Maqsood

texts.en:
Maqsood is 29 years old and is married. She has been running a business purchasing and selling animals for many years. 

Maqsood buys animals (baby goats and baby cows) at low prices, raises them, then her husband sells them in the market at higher prices. She is also involved in milk sales to generate extra income. 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. She requested a loan of Rs. 25,000 to purchase two more goats. She is in her 3rd loan cycle with a good repayment history. Maqsood hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Muhamadjon

texts.ru: Начинающему бизнесмену из города Курган-Тюбе, Мухамаджону всего 25 лет. Он уже добился многого, как быть верным мужем и счастливым отцом. У него красивая жена и трое замечательных детей, для которых он старается, ведь они для него стимул. Мухамаджон твердо поставил себе цель открыть собственное дело и накопить капитал на образование своих детей, которые еще не пошли в школу. Он хочет заняться купле-продажей сухофруктов, так как этот вид бизнеса имеет постоянный спрос. Мухамаджон уже приобрел торговую точку на рынке города. Он просит кредит, чтобы выкупить партию сухофруктов и начать свое дело. В дальнейшем за счет прибыли он хочет приобрести машину для превозки товара на рынок. Надеемся, у него все получится.
texts.en: Muhamadjon is a novice businessman from Qurgan-Tube. He is 25 years old. He has already achieved a lot, like how to be a dedicated husband and happy father. He has a beautiful wife and three wonderful children, who are the incentive for all he does. Muhamdjon has set a firm goal of opening his own business and saving money for children's education.  They are now all in grade school. He wants to sell dried fruits, since there is continuous demand for them. He already has a stall at the city market. He is asking for a loan in order to buy a load of dried fruit and start his work. In the future he wants to use his profits to buy a vehicle to transport the goods to market. He hopes that his goals will be achieved.

loans.use: To buy dried fruit and open his own business

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 65-year-old married man with seven children with only one attending school. James also has two dependents; orphans whom he takes care of. They are the children of his deceased relatives. 

James is an honest and hardworking person. He is an agriculturalist and grows millet as his major source of income. He is also involved in coffee trading; he buys and sells coffee from other coffee out growers in his community. 

He is now constructing a rental house at his home, which he hopes will help him earn more income for his family. He has found it difficult to finish this house using his own income. He therefore decided to join UGAFODE Micro Finance Limited (MDI) for financial assistance to help him finish the construction  of his rentals.

In the photograph is James and the loan officer. James is holding a walking stick.

loans.use: to complete rental houses.

loans.name: Gulnaz

texts.en:
Gulnaz is a 36-year-old married woman with four children. She and her husband have been running a business selling milk for 5 years. She has three buffaloes and two cows. 

Gulnaz sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter and cheese that she makes from the milk.  She looks after the buffaloes and performs the task of collecting milk on daily basis.  She needs to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, clothing, and health. 

Gulnaz is in her fifth loan cycle with a good repayment history. To increase her sales, she requested a loan of Rs 25000/- to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers. She hopes to get increase the production capacity of milk, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo.

loans.name: Solange Tatiana

texts.es: La cliente es de la ciudad de Machala.  Comenzó su trabajo en la tienda a través de un crédito que solicitó por medio del bono y luego que estableció su tienda con ésto, pudo implementar un pequeño comedor en el lugar y que funciona el fin de semana.  Trabaja todos los días con su hermana.  Es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos que estudian en la escuela fiscal del sector.  Desea poder terminar su casa de cemento y poder construir su propio local para montar un restaurante, y también que sus hijos puedan convertirse en profesionales.  Necesita el crédito para la compra de abarrotes para su tienda.
texts.en:
This borrower is from the city of Machala.  She opened her store with a loan that she was awarded upon submitting her request.  She also added a small diner in the same place, which she operates on the weekends.  The borrower works every day with her sister.  She is a single mother and has two children who are attending a state school in the area.  She wants to finish building her cement house and also build her own shop for establishing a restaurant.  In addition, she wants her children to become professionals.  

The borrower needs a loan so that she can buy groceries for her store.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to achieve appropriate space, and purchase fixed assets (chairs, tables, display counters, an ice maker, a freezer, kitchen utensils, and a selection of inputs at wholesale (meat, grains, vegetables, oil, rice, pasta, and fruit, among others).

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Azra is a 41-year-old, married woman and a mother of four children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of caring for animals and selling milk. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous in her area, for providing good-quality milk.

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. Currently she requests a loan of Rs. 20,000, which she will use to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales, which ultimately will help in generating more income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo for her dairy business

loans.name: Muhammadamin

texts.ru: Мухаммадамин добрый и целеустремленный молодой человек. Ему 21 года. Он не женат и живет с родителями, братьями и сестрами. Он старший ребенок в семье. Мухаммадамин имеет высшее образование. Он окончил экономический факультет Технологического Университета Таджикистана. Мухаммадамин данное время успешно работает в Налоговом комитете ведущим специалистом отдела по налоговому отчету. Он уже давно мечтает иметь мобильный телефон, но его зарплата не хватает для этого. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 600 долларов США для покупки мобильного телефона марки Galaxy C 4. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Muhammadamin is a kind and goal oriented young man. He is 21 years old. He is unmarried and lives with his parents, brothers, and sisters. He is the oldest child in the family. Muhammadamin has a college education. He graduated from the economics department at the Technological University of Tajikistan. He is currently successfully employed at the tax agency as a specialist in the tax accounting department. He has long dreamed of having a cell phone, but he can't afford to buy one with his salary. He is asking for a 600 USD loan to buy a Galaxy X4 phone. He hopes for your kindness and generosity.

loans.use: To buy a mobile phone

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Marites works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Marites is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to purchase fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Marites has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is a married lady, aged 36. She is a mother of three, children who are 14, 5, and 2 years old. She operates a tailoring shop in the Enabelbel area of Narok County, Kenya. Anne has been running the business for three years, earning a monthly income of KES 15,000.

She has borrowed a second loan, in the amount of KES 40,000, from KADET. She intends to purchase more fabric for dressmaking, with the loan funds. The anticipated profit will be used to pay school fees for her school-going children. Anne's dreams are to improve her living standard and to own her residential plot of land.

loans.use: to buy fabric for dressmaking.

loans.name: Daniel F.

texts.en:
This is 48-year-old Daniel from Liberia. He lives in St. Paul, a suburb located outside Monrovia, past the Freeport.  It has one of the oldest markets in the country and is known for its fresh fish as it is located by the ocean.  However, it is also one of the poorer areas and housing quality is often very low. 

Daniel is married with four children.  His first child is aged 19 and last child aged 12. His spouse works with an N.G.O.  All four children live at home and go to school.
 
Daniel has a provisions business where he sells beer, soft drinks, milk, mayonnaise, oil, rice, flour, etc in his shop.  He has been in business for 12 years and works 14 hours at his shop.  With this loan, he will buy more inventory such as beer, soft drinks, milk, mayonnaise, oil, rice, flour, etc.  One of the greatest challenges that he faces is that the price of a bag of flour is high and he has not enough income since he wants to open another shop in the next local market.  He transports his goods by bus. 

Daniel started his business with 300 USD.  He is proud of his business because that's where he gets money for his expenses. His plan is to build a house and open another shop.  He would like to thank the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy more inventory such as beer, soft drinks, milk, mayonnaise, oil, rice, flour, etc.

loans.name: Betty Gabriela

texts.es: La cliente vive en la zona de Orquídeas en Guayaquil.  Inició con esta actividad debido a que se quedó sin trabajo y desde antes venía laborando con la venta de mercadería.  Dado que era de su agrado, decidió emprender más en este negocio y hasta ahora le ha resultado muy productivo.  Trabaja sola, todos los días y en diferentes horarios.  Es casada y su esposo labora como ayudante en un restaurante de comida china.  Le gustaría en un futuro, poder comprar su propia casa, incrementar mucho más sus ventas y ayudar a sus padres.  Por ahora, necesita el crédito para comprar varios artículos de bazar y también ropa para su comercialización.
texts.en:
The client lives in the Orquídeas area of Guayaquil.  She started with this business activity because she was left without work.  Before that she was working selling merchandise.  Given that this was to her liking, she decided to undertake more in this business.  So far it has been very productive for her.  She works alone every day on different schedules.

She is married, and her husband works as a helper at a restaurant that serves Chinese food.  In the future she would like to be able to buy her own house, to increase her sales a lot, and to help her parents.

For now, she needs the loan to buy various household items and to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy various household items and to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: José Lorenzo

texts.es:
José tiene 52 años de edad, no tubo la oportunidad de estudiar, ya que su familia era pobre y su padre decía que el estudio no era importante, que era mejor aprender a trabajar,  debido a eso no estudio. Él esta acompañado, y su compañera trabaja en casa, realizando los oficios domésticos, vive solamente con su pareja ya que sus 3 hijos están acompañados.
toda su vida se ha dedicado a la siembra de maíz, maicillo y frijol, además, siempre le a gustado la ganadería específicamente bueyes, ya que los utiliza para trabajar sus cultivos y trabajar ganando con ellos, de esa forma, ha sostenido su hogar desde que se acompaño.
Para llegar donde realiza sus cultivos,  tiene que caminar a pie unos 40 minutos, y para aprovechar el día se levanta a las 4: 00 AM, mientras espera su desayuno enyuga sus bueyes y prepara todo su equipo de trabajo. Luego, a las 5:00 AM inicia su viaje donde trabaja 6 horas y luego regresa a su casa, esa es su vida desde que aprendió a trabajar 
El préstamo será utilizado en la compra de 6 sacos de abono, un galón de herbicida y lo demás para pagar los que le ayudan. Con el préstamo, lograra beneficiar sus cultivos a tiempo y tendrá mejores ganancias.
Su sueño, es comprar unas dos vacas lecheras, 7,000 metros cuadrados de terreno; para  darles a sus hijos un lugar en donde puedan construir su casa.
texts.en:
52-year old José did not go to school as his family was poor and his father said that education wasn't important, that it was better to get a job. So José has no formal education. He is married and his wife works at home looking after the household. As their children are now married, they live alone.

José has spent his whole life growing corn, millet, and beans. He has also always enjoyed raising animals especially oxen as he can use them to work in the fields and earn money from them. In these ways he supports his family ever since he got married.

To reach his land he has to walk 40 minutes so in order to make good use of daylight hours, he gets up at 4am. While he waits for breakfast to be ready, he yokes the oxen and prepares his tools. Then, at 5am, he begins his journey. He works for six hours and then returns home. This has been his life ever since he started work.

The loan money will be used to buy six bags of manure, a gallon of herbicide, and the rest on wages for those who help him. His fields will be well cared for and he will earn more money.

José's dream is to buy some milk cows and 7,000 m2 of land to give his children a place where they can build their houses.

loans.use: Buy six bags of manure, a gallon of herbicide, and wages

loans.name: Karam

texts.en:
Karam is 47 years old, an energetic married woman. She has had an animal sale and purchase business since last year; she has two goats. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market, and her business is good enough for her to lead a decent life. 

For the further improvement of her business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 15,000.  It will help her to purchase one more goat. 

It’s her second year with Kashf Foundation, and she has shown good repayment behavior.  With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase one more goat.

loans.name: Mussarat

texts.en:
Mussarat is a 44-year-old married woman and the mother of four children. She is motivated to provide all facilities of life to her family. 

She has been running a small general store in her community for many years with her husband, who is also shown in the photo. Over time, they have become popular in their community for providing good quality products and make enough to meet the expenses of their household. 

Currently, she has requested a loan of Rs. 20,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits, and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings, and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits, and beverages.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is a 43-year-old man who is married and has 6 children. Edward's children are ages 2, 7, 10, 12,14 and 16, and only the 2 year old does not yet go to school. Edward is a farmer who deals in cattle trading. He also grows food crops. He began farming as a way to support and develop his household. 

He has asked for this loan to buy some more cows. His clients are villagers that have contact with the cattle traders. He hopes to develop his plot in the Kabasanda trading center. His major challenge has been paying school fees for his many children, but he hopes to overcome that soon with the help of a loan boost from Ugafode. The photograph shows (right to left) Edward with the Ugafode credit officer, who is tapping the cow.

loans.use: To buy more cows.

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen, age 31, deals in the business of caring for animals and selling milk. She has been running her business successfully for many years. By this time, she has become famous in her area, for good-quality milk. She has three buffaloes and one cow in milk. She makes a good amount of income to contribute to her family's income. She is a mother of four, and is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with a good education, food and clothing.  She has improved her business to meet day-to-day expenses of life.

This is her third year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business with the Foundation's support. Now she requests a loan of Rs 30,000.
