She will use it to purchase one more cow, and feed for its calves. Shaheen hopes that this loan will be a productive one for her and will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow and feed for its calves.

loans.name: Shehzadan

texts.en:
Shehzadan, age 46, deals in the business of animal sales. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family's income. She is a dedicated mother of three. She needs to improve her business, to meet the needs of her children.

For capital with which to improve her business, she contacted Kashf Foundation. She applied for a loan of Rs. 20,000; she will use it to purchase another calf. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase another calf.

loans.name: Sumera

texts.en: Sumera is a 45-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last four years. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. Her husband is working as a laborer and earns insufficient income to support his family alone. She is a mother of six children and is motivated to provide for her family. As she wants to grow her business, she has requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to buy a stock of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. She would then be able to meet the increasing demand. She wishes to utilize part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy a stock of rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a lady of thirty one years, married to Samuel and the mother of one child.  She sells clothes, and also operates a music store in Kikuyu town. She has been in this business for two years, and gets a monthly income of 40,000 shillings.

This will be Mary's first loan with KADET LTD; she plans to use the entire loan to buy speakers, CDs etc. In future, she wants to be a successful business woman.

loans.use: To buy electronic accessories like speakers, chargers, CDs, etc...

loans.name: María Idalia

texts.es:
María de 35 años de edad, solamente estudio cuarto grado, comenta  que su padre murió en la guerra y quedo solamente con su mamá, debido a eso ya no pudo estudiar y le toco que aprender a trabajar la agricultura para ayudar a su madre al sustento del hogar. Ella esta acompañada y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura, de sus tres hijos uno ya no vive con ella viajo a los estados unidos, otro de ellos ya no quiso estudiar y trabaja en la agricultura con su padre, el ultimo de ellos es el que esta estudiando. 
Desde que tenía doce años, comenzó a trabajar en la agricultura con su mamá; pues su padre murió cuando ella tenía 10 años. Aprendió a trabajar con unos vecinos, fueron ellos los que le daban trabajo a su mamá y a sus hermanos, fue con ellos que aprendieron a trabajar.
Además, de trabajar en la agricultura, siempre le a gustado la ganadería, hoy cuenta con seis cabezas de ganado y su sueño es tener más. Ella se levanta a las 4:.30 AM para preparar el desayuno, y luego conducir su ganado al potrero. Posteriormente, se queda trabajando en la milpa, para llegar donde ellos trabajan tienen que caminar unos 30 minutos, trabaja 6 horas y luego regresa a casa.
El crédito será utilizado en la compra de 4 toretes para repasto, ya que quiere aprovechar que el pasto esta bueno, además es una forma de ganar unos dólares
Su sueño, es comprar unas 5 vacas lecheras, que su último hijo se gradúe en la universidad, ya que ella no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, y sus otros hijos no quisieron seguir estudiando. Con la ganancia si Dios le permite quiere comprar una novilla.
texts.en:
María is 35 years old and lives with her life partner who works in agriculture. She has three children. One does not live with her, he has gone to the United States. Another does not want to study and he works with his father. The youngest one is a student. She only studied until Grade Four. She had to quit studying after her father was killed in the war. She was left alone with her mother and she had to learn to do agricultural work in order to help her mother support their household. She learned this work from some neighbors who gave work to her mother and her siblings. Her father died when she was 10 and she started to work in the fields when she was 12 years old. 

Besides working in the fields María has always liked raising livestock. Today she has 6 head of cattle and her dream is to have more. She gets up at 4:30 in the morning to prepare breakfast. Then she takes the cattle to their field. This done she is off to work in the cornfields, which is a 30 minute walk away. She works 6 hours and returns home. 

María will use the loan to buy 4 young bulls to fatten, taking advantage of the grass being good right now. It is a way to make a few dollars. Her dream is to buy 5 milk cows. She also wants her youngest son to graduate from University as she didn't have the opportunity to study and her other sons didn't want to continue their studies. She would like to buy a heifer with the profits, God willing.

loans.use: to buy 4 young bulls to fatten.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina, age 37, deals in the business of animal sales. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family's income.  She is a dedicated mother of four and needs to improve her business to provide them with the basic necessities of life.

For the improvement of her business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 35,000. She will use the loan to purchase two more calves. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Wilber

texts.en: Wilber is a hard working 25-year-old married man with 3 children.  He works in cattle trade and agricultural produce. Wilber will use his requested loan to buy more cattle that he will breed and later trade at a profit. He does this business to sustain his family and has a dream to build his own family home. His challenge is theft and price fluctuations.  Wilber is in the photo with an UGAFODE staff member (right to left).

loans.use: To buy more cattle

loans.name: Santos De Jesús

texts.es:
Santos es una mujer de 36 años de edad, no cuenta con un nivel educativo a sus padres no le interesaba que estudiaran las mujeres, decía que solo a buscar novios iban; debido a eso no la mandaron a la escuela, solo a sus hermanos varones. La señora Santos, esta acompañada, y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura, sus 3 hijos están estudiando.
Ella se dedica al comercio de camarón y pescado desde hace un año. Comenta, que un día que no tenia nada para sus hijos, se encontró con una prima y le contó su situación, fue su prima quien la incentivo para que iniciara con l negocio, para generar ingresos al hogar. su producto lo compra a unos 5 km de donde vive, para llegar donde compra toma un pick up, que la conduce al lugar, compra y luego regresa a casa; para venderlo lo hace de casa en casa, en los caseríos vecinos. Su compañero de vida y uno de sus hijos le ayudan a preparar el camarón, su jornada comienza a las 5:00 AM preparando el desayuno y despachando a sus hijos para la escuela, y luego irse a vender, donde se tarda vendiendo unas 6 0 8 horas. Además, trabaja en la agricultura 
El crédito, será invertido en la compra de camarón, pescado,  2 sacos de abono y semilla para sembrar ocho tareas de maíz.
Su sueño es comprar un terreno,  para construir su propia casa, donde hoy vive es terreno de su suegra, que sus hijos se preparen en una profesión, pues ella no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar y no quiere que ellos les suceda lo mismo; de la ganancia espera ahorrar, y cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Santos is a 36 year old woman.  She does not have an education because her parents were not interested in women going to school.  They said that she only needed to look for a boyfriend.  That is why they did not send her to school; they only sent her brothers.

Santos is in a relationship, and her life partner works in agriculture.  Her three children go to school.  She has been selling shrimp and fish for one year.  She says that one day she had nothing for her children.  She found her cousin and told her the situation.  It was her cousin who motivated her to start with the business in order to generate income for the household.  She buys her product about five kilometers from where she lives.  To get there she takes a pick up that drives her to the place.  She buys and then returns home in order to sell it.  She sells by going door to door in the neighboring settlements.  

Her life partner and one of her children help her to prepare the shrimp.  Her work day starts at 5:00 a.m preparing breakfast and sending her children off to school.  She then goes out to sell for some six to eight hours.  She also works in agriculture.

The loan will be used to buy shrimp, fish, two sacks of fertilizer and seeds to plant eight plots of corn.

Her dream is to buy a piece of land in order to build her own house.  She now lives on her mother-in-law’s land.  She also dreams of her children learning a profession.  She did not have the opportunity to study, and she does not want the same thing to happen to them.  She hopes to save her earnings and fulfill her dreams.

loans.use: to buy shrimp, fish, two sacks of fertilizer and seeds to plant eight plots of corn.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en: Bushra is a 23-year-old married woman. She is a very talented lady and excels in stitching. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community. She has accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of their household and the educational needs of their children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. She has now requested a loan of 20,000 PKR to purchase more reels of thread, packs of buttons, zippers and lace in various colors. With this purchase she will be able to consistently meet the increasing demand. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living for her family members through all of her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons, zippers and lace in various colors.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.es:
Doña Luciana es una mujer de 33 años de edad luchadora con un grado de escolaridad de primaria completo y junto a su esposo y sus 6 hijos se han podido superar gracias a la dedicación en la actividad del cultivo de hortalizas (papa, brócoli y coliflor). Ella tiene mucha experiencia en esta actividad ya que aprendió hace más de 10 años esta actividad dirigida e inculcada por sus padres la cual hasta hoy en día siguen ejerciendo. Este es el único medio de ingreso para su familia en la actualidad por medio de la cual se han superado y han podido salir adelante. La propiedad que ellos trabajan es propia gracias al esfuerzo y dedicación impuesto por ella y su esposo durante muchos años de trabajo y dedicación la cual está ubicada a a pocos metros de su casa de habitación. Hoy en día Doña Luciana junto a su esposo trabajan duro para que sus hijos no dejen de estudiar y tengan un mejor futuro, un mejor estilo de vida y tengan mejores oportunidades en la vida. Su producto es comercializado a través de intermediarios que llegan a la zona, vecinos y ellos mismos que viajan hasta la zona de comercio para su venta.

Actualmente Doña Luciana solicita ayuda para poder invertir en la siembra y dar mantenimiento a sus cultivos como: 9 sobres de coliflor, 5 QQ de 12-24-12, 1 Kilo de manzate, 1 Kilo de conter, 2 kilos de curion, 1 bote de muralla, 2 kilos de mancoceb, 2 QQ de gallinasa. 

Su sueño es ser una productora de hortalizas en cantidades mayores y ser la mejor de la zona en su producción; pero la prioridad de ella es ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales teniendo una mejor educación y a sí mismo un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Sra. Luciana is 33 years old, hardworking, and has completed primary school. She, her husband, and their six children have been able to get ahead because of the farm where they grow vegetables (potatoes, broccoli, and cauliflower). Luciana has a lot of experience farming which she learned from her parents more than ten years ago. They still farm today. Luciana and her husband own their land thanks to the effort and dedication they put in over the years. It is located just a short distance from their house.

Luciana and her husband still work hard so that their children can continue studying and have a better future. The produce is sold to buyers who come to the area, as well as to neighbours. They themselves also travel to markets to sell the vegetables.

Luciana is seeking a loan to buy items for the farm such as 9 packets of cauliflower seed, 5 QQ of 12-24-12 fertilizer, and various other agricultural supplies.

Her dream is produce greater quantities of vegetables and become the biggest producer in the region. However, her priority is to see her children well-educated, with good jobs, so they have a better future.

loans.use: Buy supplies for her vegetable farm

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro  es un hombre soltero de 68 años de edad. El tiene 5 hijos de ellos 1 hombre y 4 mujeres quienes viven en el Barrió San Antonio, Sololá, Sololá.
El se dedica a la agricultura cultivando zanahoria, en parcelas que tiene  a pocos metros de su vivienda, esto lo aprendió de su padre ya que tuvo la oportunidad de trabajar con él desde pequeño y es por ello que decidió seguir con esta labor en donde ha obtiene ingresos y ganancias buenas que han contribuido con el sustento  de su familia.
El ahora cuenta con 50 años de realizar su propio cultivo es por ello que está solicitando un préstamo de Q 4,000.00 para poder comprar semillas de zanahoria y abono orgánico para luego cultivarlo y cosecharlo.
Su sueño es ampliar su cultivo para generar más ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
68-year old Pedro is single and has five children, a son and four daughters. They live in the San Antonio neighbourhood in Solalá.

He grows carrots on his land located a short distance from his home. He learned farming from his father at an early age so decided to continue this work when he grew up. It provides enough income to support his family. 

Pedro has had his own land for 50 years. He is now seeking a loan of Q 4,000.00 to buy carrot seeds and organic manure for his fields and crops.

His dream is to extend his farm so he can earn more money and improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: Buy carrot seeds and organic manure

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is 39 years old; he has one child. His main source of income is a barber shop, and he began the business because it required low capital. 

His challenge is load shedding (rolling blackouts), which affects his income because during those days he cannot serve his clients and he can not afford a generator at the moment.  He is hard working.  

He wants to buy cement and stones using the loan to be able to complete his houses. 

In the picture is Henry with the Ugafode credit officer at the house he is building (left to right)>

loans.use: To buy cement and stones

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 34 years old and comes from Nakuru. She is married to Dennis, who produces some additional income for his family. They have three children, aged 12, 8, and 5 years.

She runs a business of selling clothes, which has been in operation for the past four years. She has applied for her third loan, in the amount of KES 80,000, from KADET. She intends to use the loan for buying more clothes, for selling in her shop.

Her monthly income at present is KES 30,000. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to own a big business, and to have a better life for her family.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell in her clothing business

loans.name: Hermenegildo

texts.es:
Hermenegildo  es un hombre soltero de 36 años de edad, vive junto a sus 6 hijos los cuales son 4 hombres y 2 mujeres en el Caserío Xibalbay, Aldea Chaquijyá, Sololá, Sololá. 
El se dedica al cultivo de zanahoria a unos metros de su vivienda. Comenta que gracias a la ayuda de su padre el ahora cuenta con un trabajo en el cual ha obtenido varios beneficios entre ellos están los ingresos y  ganancias que obtiene en esta actividad que realiza día a día.
Actualmente lleva 20 años en esta labor que le ha ayudado a sacar adelante a su familia en cuanto a su sustento. El ha observado que necesita invertir más para tener mejores ganancias por lo que está solicitando un préstamo de Q 4,000.00 para la compra de semillas de zanahoria y abono orgánico que servirá para su cultivo.
Su sueño es remodelar su vivienda y sacar adelante a sus hijos en sus estudios para que en un futuro tengan mejores oportunidades en la vida.
texts.en:
Hermenegildo’s a 36-year-old single man living with his six children, four boys and two girls, in Caserío Xibalbay, Chagujyá Village, Sololá, Sololá.

He works growing carrots on some meters near his house.  He comments that thanks to his father’s help he now can rely on an occupation from which he’s gotten many benefits among which are income and profits from the activity he carries out daily.

To date, he’s been in this occupation for 20 years and it’s help him to raise his family and to support them.  He’s noticed that he needs to invest more in order to earn higher profits which is why he’s requesting a 4,000 Quetzal loan to buy carrot seeds and organic manure for his crop.

His dream is to remodel his house and to see that his children complete their schooling so that they will have better life opportunities in future.

loans.use: to buy carrot seeds and organic manure.

loans.name: Cleophas

texts.en:
Cleophas is a 32-year-old married man with four children. He describes himself as creative. 

Cleophas operates a bags and clothing store where he sells bags and dresses. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a highly populated area, and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of capital. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a stock of bags and clothes to sell. 

His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that in the future he will have an improved standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a stock of bags and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Nune

texts.en:
Nune is from Kapan town, where she lives with her husband. Nune's husband works at a gas station, and the income which he earns is hardly enough for covering the family's costs. So, for tracking financial hardships, Nune started to purchase clothing from a city market and sell it in villages. Because there are no clothing shops in the neighboring villages around Kapan, the service that Nune provides is highly demanded.

Now, she needs some financing, to be able to purchase a new stock of clothing. Nune has been approved for a loan, within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions, to informal businesses that do not have access to other credit products. This loan is very important, for Nune to be able to meet her customers' demand and support her family.

loans.use: to purchase clothing in the city, for selling to customers in villages

loans.name: James Arley

texts.es: James tiene 27 años de edad y actualmente se dedica a laborar como empleado de oficios varios en una empresa. Nació en una familia humilde del campo y allí aprendió desde muy joven las labores agropecuarias mientras veía trabajar a su padre, quien toda la vida se dedicó a la producción agropecuaria. Con el fin de mejorar sus ingresos personales, desea iniciar su propio negocio independiente, dedicándose a la cría, engorde y comercialización de pollos, para lo cual ya posee los galpones en la terraza de su casa. Es por esta razón que solicita el apoyo del crédito, pues desea invertirlo en la ampliación de los galpones, comprar polluelos y concentrado para poner en marcha su idea de negocio, la cual alternará con su actual empleo. James espera que su proyecto le permita mejorar las condiciones de vida para él y su familia y, sueña con independizarse totalmente, siendo consciente que para lograrlo debe trabajar con empeño y mucha dedicación para que su negocio comience a dar los resultados que desea y, de esa manera tendrá la capacidad para comenzar una producción escalonada que le garantice los ingresos necesarios para mejorar su estabilidad económica y sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
James is 27 years old and currently works as an employee doing various jobs at a company. He was born into a humble farming family. There he learned how to work on a farm at a young age while he watched his father work, who has worked in livestock production all his life. In order to improve his personal income, he wants to start his own independent business raising, fattening, and selling chickens for which he already owns the chicken coops on the terrace of his house. It is for this reason that he is requesting a loan. He wishes to invest in expanding the chicken coops and to buy chicks and chicken feed to launch his business idea, which he will alternate with his current job.  

James hopes that his project will allow him to improve his and his family’s living conditions. He dreams of becoming fully independent, realizing that to achieve this, he should work with a lot of determination and dedication so that his business starts to give the results he desires. That way, he will have the ability to start a staggered production that guarantees the income needed to improve his economic stability and living conditions.

loans.use: to expand his chicken coops and buy chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Angella Milagros

texts.es: Ángela es una joven de 19 años de edad que posee un salón de belleza y estética en un municipio muy cercano a Barranquilla. Ella tiene 3 años de experiencia  e inició su negocio en el año 2009 , negocio que es tradicional en su familia especialmente en las mujeres de su hogar, su abuela y su madre.  Ángela toda la vida ha observado que el negocio de belleza y estética  genera ganancias importantes, por  eso decidió emprender su propia aventura de trabajo autónomo., teniendo en cuenta que por su aptitud, fue muy fácil de aprender y practicar.  Su oferta de productos está relacionada con cortes de cabello, tratamientos capilares manicure, pedicura, entre otros. Ella recibe el pago de sus servicios una vez los presta y por eso trabaja de lunes a domingos desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche. Sus compras las hace de contado a grandes mayoristas que le ofrecen precios especiales y con quienes establece una buena alianza que trae consigo oportunidades de obtener productos en las diversas promociones que estos ofrecen. Sus principales clientes son los vecinos del sector con quienes ha obtenido un reconocimiento. Su meta es lograr reconocimiento en la ciudad y más adelante terminar sus estudios. Su mayor desafío es el insuficiente capital e trabajo para trabajar con mayor flexibilidad en su negocio. En la actualidad Angela está aplicando aun credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual hará adecuaciones locativas y compra de insumos para abrir un nuevo salón de belleza y extender la oferta de servicios de mejoramiento de la imagen personal y profesional a otros sectores.
texts.en:
Ángela, 19, is a young owner of a beauty shop in a town very near Barranquilla.  She has three years’ experience; she started the business in 2009 which is a tradition in her family especially among the women in her home like her grandmother and her mother.  

Ángela has noted her entire life that the beauty salon business generates significant profits which is why she decided to go into her own autonomous business venture keeping in mind that because  of her aptitude it was easy for her to learn and practice it.  

The types of services she provides are related to haircuts, hair treatments, manicure and pedicure, among others.  She’s paid for her services at the time she provides them which is why she works Monday to Sunday from 8 in the morning until 10 at night.

She makes her purchases at wholesale from large wholesalers that offer special prices and with whom she’s established a good alliance that carries with it the opportunity to obtain products on special offer from them.

Her main customers are local neighbors that have gotten to know her.  Her goal to reach is to become well-known in the city and later on to finish her schooling.  Her greatest challenge is insufficient working capital to be able to work with more flexibility in her business.  

Ángela is currently requesting a Kiva loan, her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, by means of which she will make some physical improvements to her shop and will buy some supplies to open a new beauty salon to extend her personal and professional image beauty improvement services to other sectors.

loans.use: to buy supplies and to do location improvements.

loans.name: Benedict

texts.en: Benedict is a 30-year-old married man with two children aged 4 and 6 years old. He describes himself as being committed. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle and he has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in an urban area and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insecurity. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy a new motorbike. His business goal is to buy a rickshaw within 5 years and he hopes that in the future, he will be prosperous. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy a new motorbike.

loans.name: Juana Del Carmen

texts.es: Juana del Carmen mayor de edad casada con dos hijos mayores de edad, es propietaria de una pulpería ubicada  en su casa de habitación en el departamento de Chinandega del  occidente del país,  donde vende productos de consumo básico como: arroz, frijoles, salsas de tomates, azúcar, aceite, productos congelados, gaseosas, jugos, galletas, golosinas entre otros y mercadería en general como: ropa interior, prensapelos, colas, shampoo, talcos, variedades de ropa, cuadernos entre otros, ella es una persona trabajadora, honesta, con deseos de superación y sobre todo responsable, ella solicita crédito para invertir en su negocio ya que su demanda ha incrementado más aun en estas fechas, en la compra de granos básicos, productos congelados, gaseosas, mercadería en general y asi poder ofrecerle un mejor servicios a sus clientes, uno de sus es poder tener bien surtida su pulpería y poder tener mejores ingresos económicos
texts.en:
Juana del Carmen is a married adult with two adult children. She owns a home-based grocery store located in Chinandega Department in the west of the country where she sells basic staples like rice, beans, tomato sauce, sugar, oil, frozen goods, soft-drinks, juice, cookies and snacks, among others and general merchandise like underwear, paper clips, glue, shampoo, talc, assorted clothing and notebooks among others.

She’s a hardworking, honest person who wants to get ahead and who above all responsible.  She’s asking for a loan to invest in her business because demand has risen these days.  She will buy basic grains, frozen products, soft-drinks and general merchandise to offer better customer service this way.  One of the goals is to be able to keep the store well-stocked in order to earn higher income.

loans.use: To buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Sipora

texts.en:
Sipora is 39 years old and married. She supports two children, aged 13 and 2 years. She sells second-hand shoes, in the Euro Ekure area of Narok. Sipora has been running the business for eight years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000.

She has borrowed a first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET. She intends to purchase more shoes for resale, with the loan funds. The anticipated profit will be used to pay school fees for her school-going child. Her dreams are to improve her living standard and to own her residential plot of land.

loans.use: to purchase more second-hand shoes, for resale

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 23 years old and has one school-going child. He works five days in the transport business because the business is suitable in the area.

He wants to buy baby heifers (cows) with the loan that he will breed and later sell after a few months at a profit. His clients are his usual village mates, who buy for rearing. 

He hopes to have a big farm such that he can sell cows to the city traders who buy at a good price. His challenge is climatic changes. He is honest and hard working.

He thanks Kiva lenders through Ugafode for giving them an opportunity to grow financially.

loans.use: To buy baby cows

loans.name: Yolonim

texts.en: Yolonim is 60 years old, the father of nine children and cares for one additional child whose parents died. He earns a living by raising poultry and cattle. He started the business to sustain his family, and is requesting this loan to buy poultry feed. His dream is to buy a car to help him with his business. The main challenge is he faces is weather and other natural calamities. He is a very hardworking person.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials.

loans.name: Ezekiel

texts.en: Ezekiel is a Kiva borrower who describes himself as very responsible, dedicated and faithful. For the last four years, he has operated a tailoring shop where he makes clothes. His business is located in an urban area and his primary customers are women. He says his biggest business challenge is an occasional delay in making clothes because he has too much work to do. He will use this KES 20,000 loan to buy thread, cloth, a new sewing machine and other tailoring materials. This is his first loan from SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy thread, cloth and a new sewing machine

loans.name: Sabbas

texts.en: Sabbas is a 41-year-old married man who has five children and describes himself as focused and very determined. He operates a hotel where he cooks food to sell. He has been involved in this business for four years and has a good location where he serves all types of customers. Sabbas will use this KES 60,000 loan to buy cooking oil, wheat flour and other materials for preparing food. This is his second loan from SMEP DTM. He has successfully repaid his first loan.

loans.use: buy cooking oil, wheat flour and other materials for preparing food

loans.name: Iveth

texts.es: Iveth es una joven emprendedora, ella tiene una pequeña pollería con la cual ayuda a su familia. actualmente necesita de mas producción para darle mas apoyo economico a su familia. es por ello que ella solicita un préstamo de un millón de colones (1.000.000) para comprar mas gallinas y concentrado para alimentarlas, y así poder producir mas huevos y poderlos venderlos a las comunidades y tener mas ganancias que puedan ayudar a su familia.
texts.en: Iveth’s a young entrepreneur.  She owns a small poultry shop that she helps her family with.  She currently needs to increase production to provide more economic help for her family which is why she’s asking for a 1,000,000 Colon (one-million) loan to buy more chicks and concentrate to feed them in order to produce more eggs to sell to the communities and earn more profits that will be able to help her family.

loans.use: to buy chicks and feed.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred, 50 years old, is a widower who lost his wife in 2012. He comes from rural Kasozi Eastern Division - Rukungiri District.

Fred has been with UGAFODE Microfinance Limited ('Ugafode') for the past five years. He had been running a retail shop in Rukungiri central market, but he changed to a timber sales business after losing his wife, to get more time to attend to the orphans. Now he is taking this loan to add into his timber business.

He thanks Ugafode for always being at his side, to give him the financial support to meet his financial obligations.

loans.use: To buy timber to sell

loans.name: Eliud

texts.en: Eliud is a 30-year-old single man who describes himself as self motivated and honest. For the last two years, he has earned a living by selling clothes on the streets. His business is located in an area which is good for business and his primary customers are ordinary people. He describes his biggest business challenge as a lack of adequate funds. He will use this KES 20,000 loan to buy clothing to resell and build a clothes store. His business goal is to have a successful boutique with other branches within the next five years. He hopes that in the future, he will diversify and sell men's shoes. This is his first loan from SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell and build a clothing store.

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es:
Domitila con 29 años de edad, estudio hasta octavo grado, debido que se acompaño, ya no siguió los estudios, es madre soltera de 3 hijos, 2 están estudiando y el mas pequeño asiste al kinder; su pareja la abandono hace 6 meses. Además de sus hijos, vive una hermana con ellos.
Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa ambulante, desde hace unos tres meses. Manifiesta, que fue la necesidad que la llevo a buscar, una forma de ganar dinero, para el sustento de su familia y fue su madre quien la indujo al negocio. Antes solo era ama de casa, pero al quedar sola se vio en la obligación de luchar para sacar adelante a sus hijos. Su producto lo compra,  en la capital del país, camina unos 20 minutos a pie para tomar el bus que la conduce a la ciudad, compra y luego regresa a casa, y sale a vender de casa en casa en los caseríos vecinos. 
El crédito, será utilizado para comprar 4 docenas de brasier, 3 docenas de tangas,1 de blusas, 1 de faldas, 2 de calcetines, blomeres y trajes para niños. Con el préstamo podrá comprar por mayor y mas barato, viajara menos y tendrá mejores ganancias.
Su sueño, es comprar un terreno para construir una casa, hoy donde vive es de su cuñado. Además , sueña con ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales, con las ganancias espera pagar el crédito, para tener las puertas abiertas en la fundación y ahorrar, para en un futuro cumplir su sueño de tener su propia casa.
texts.en: Domitila, 29, studied until the eighth grade. Because she got married, she did not continue with school. She is a single mother of three children. Two are in school and the youngest goes to kindergarten. Her partner left her six months ago. In addition to her children, a sister lives with her. For three months, she has sold clothing as a street vendor. She says that it was necessity that led to her look for a way to earn money in order to support her family, and that it was her mother who encouraged her in the business. Before, she only cared for the home, but being alone, she saw the need to fight to move her children forward. She buys her products in the country's capital. She goes 20 minutes on foot to take the bus that goes to the city. She makes her purchase and then returns home, and goes out to sell from house to house in the nearby groups of houses. The loan will be used to buy four dozen bras, three dozen pairs of underwear, one dozen blouses, one dozen skirts, two dozen socks, bloomers, and suits for children. With the loan, she will be able to buy wholesale and more cheaply. She will travel less and have a better income. Her dream is to buy land to build a house. The place where she lives now belongs to her brother-in-law. She also dreams of seeing her children become professionals. With her earnings, she hopes to pay off the loan, to have door open to the foundation and save, in order to achieve her dream of having her own home in the future.

loans.use: to buy four dozen bras, three dozen pairs of underwear, one dozen blouses, one dozen skirts, two dozen socks, bloomers, and suits for children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials.

loans.name: Mercy's Group

texts.en:
Mercy's Group comprises three members, who reside in the city of Accra-Teshie. The group's representative, Mercy (standing far right in the photo), is 56 years old and married. She has three independent children. Mercy sells footwear and water in poly-tanks. She buys footwear from the market, and water from the water tanker-suppliers, in Accra-Ghana.

 With the goal of boosting their businesses, in order to cope with the demands of their customers, this group is requesting financial support from ID-Ghana for a sixth time. Mercy, along with the other members of this group, request a total loan amount of GHS 3100 from ID-Ghana. The previous loans were indeed repaid, without trouble.

loans.use: To buy footwear from the market, and water from the water tanker-suppliers, which she will offer for sale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 64-year-old single woman. She has five children ages from 23 to 39 years old. She describes herself to be trustworthy and self driven. She operates a dairy farm where she keeps dairy cows that produce milk to sell. 

She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in an area conducive for business and easily accessible. Her primary customers are common citizens. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of adequate funds. 

She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more dairy cows. Her business goal is to be a successful dairy farmer within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will diversify and generate great profits. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans of KES 80,000 were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more dairy cows.

loans.name: Milagros Massiel

texts.es: Milagros de 27 años de edad, es estudiante de la carrera de óptica y optometría, profesión que le gusta mucho,  trabaja como despachadora en una farmacia de sus ingresos se apoya para pagos de gastos universitarios. Ella requiere el crédito para la culminación de su monografía, siendo su mayor sueño terminar su carrera y poder brindar beneficios en el país para mejorar los programas de salud visual.
texts.en: Milagros, 27, is studying a degree in optics and optometry, a profession that she likes a lot. She works as a dispatcher at a pharmacy. From her earnings she helps pay for university expenses. She needs the loan to finish her thesis. Her greatest dream is to finish her degree and be able to provide benefits in the country to improve visual health programs.

loans.use: to pay for degree coursework.

loans.name: Moiwa Bockarie Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are teachers of a primary school located in Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of SLL 9,300,000 for the entire group. The loan will help them to meet their most immediate and most pressing financial needs. And at the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf.

Moiwa is the featured leader of this group of teachers. The 42-year-old is a native of Panguma, in eastern Sierra Leone. He is married to another teacher, and the couple has two children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Moiwa is a school teacher and has been in the teaching profession for 23 years, now. He has requested this loan in order to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Hamlet

texts.en:
Hamlet lives in Vanadzor town with his mother, his wife and his 17-year-old son. Together with his son, Hamlet has been involved in furniture manufacturing for two years. They make beautiful furniture and sell it to local people. As the only breadwinner of the family, Hamlet works hard to sustain his family's living and teach his son to make furniture.

Now, Hamlet has applied for this loan, which he will use to purchase supplies for making furniture. He has been approved for a loan, within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions, to informal businesses that do not have access to other credit products. With the help of the loan, Hamlet and his son will be able to continue making furniture and gathering income for their family.

loans.use: to pay for supplies for making furniture

loans.name: Shahrom

texts.ru: Шахром умный и начитанный молодой человек. Ему 18 лет. Он не женат и живет с родителями. Он в этом году успешно окончил среднюю школу и поступил в Худжандский Государственный Университет. Он поступил на факультет Иностранных языков. Он с детства всегда старался изучать языки. В школе он отлично учил все предметы. Шахром в будущем мечтает стать переводчиком. Он должен оплатить за учебный договор, но его родители не в состоянии оплатить за учебный договор. Его мать занимается земледелием, а отец находится в Российской Федерации. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Shahrom is an intelligent and well-read young man of 18. He is unmarried and lives with his parents. This year he successfully graduated from high school and applied to the Faculty of Foreign Languages at Hudjan State University. Since childhood he has always tried to study languages. In school he got good grades in every subject. In the future Shahrom dreams of becoming a translator. He needs to pay his tuition fees but his parents don't have the means to pay for it. His mother works in agriculture and his father is currently in Russia. Shahrom is requesting a loan to pay his tuition. He awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition

loans.name: Fares

texts.en: Fares is 29 years old and a married man. He has one child, and the family lives in Ibb, Yemen. He is always happy and friendly, and he works hard to provide for his lovely family. He has a small amount of savings to buy a trailer, but he doesn`t have enough money. So, he applied for a youth loan of 160,000 YER from AMB. He will use the loan to buy a trailer for transportation. He hopes to improve his living standard, by owning a house.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle trailer for transportation.

loans.name: Ashot

texts.en:
Ashot earns his living by providing taxi services to locals. It has been two years already, that Ashot has been taking people to different places. He has gained many loyal customers.

Unfortunately the car that Ashot owns needs to be renovated so Ashot will be able to continue his business. Ashot has applied for this loan and has now been approved for a loan, within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions, to informal businesses that do not have access to other credit products. The loan is very important for Ashot, to meet consumer demand and to support his family's living.  Ashot lives in Vanadzor with his parents and sister.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the car he uses as a taxi

loans.name: Maria Martha

texts.es:
Doña Martha es una mujer de 42 años de edad luchadora con un grado de escolaridad de primaria no completada cursada hasta el 2 grado junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos se han podido superar gracias a la dedicación en la actividad del cultivo de hortalizas (papa, brócoli y coliflor). Ella tiene mucha experiencia en esta actividad ya que aprendió hace más de 7 años dicha experiencia la adquirió desde su juventud inculcada por sus padres y en la actualidad con su esposo. La propiedad que ellos trabajan es propia gracias al esfuerzo y algunas restricciones para poder tener lo propio la cual está ubicada a 5 minutos de su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan a pie. Toda siembra y cultivo no deja de tener riesgo siendo estos las plagas y la variación de precios en el mercado. 

Actualmente maría solicita ayuda para poder invertir en la siembra de papa comprando 7 QQ de abono 12-24-24, 5 QQ de dolocal, 5 Kilos de manzanate, 5 kilos de conter, 5 botes de curion, 5 botes de muralla, 8 kilos de macoceb y 4 QQ de gallinaza para que ayude a mantenerlo sano y limpio de plagas.

Su sueño es poder mejorar su calidad de vida, comprar más tierra para poder trabajar y cultivar más hortaliza; pero la prioridad de ella es ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales teniendo una mejor educación y a sí mismo un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Martha, 42, is a hardworking woman who did not complete primary school; she only completed second grade.  She, her husband and their three children have been able to overcome thanks to their dedication to growing vegetables (potatoes, broccoli and cauliflower).  She has much experience in this activity since she learned it over seven years ago.  She acquired said experience since she was young having been taught by her parents and now with her husband.

The land they work is theirs thanks to their effort and some restrictions in order to have their own; it’s located a five-minute walk from home.  All agricultural work has its risks among which are pests and price fluctuations.

María is asking for a loan at present to invest in her potato crop.  She will buy 7 quintals of 12-24-24 fertilizer, 5 quintals of Dolocal, 5 kilos of Manzanate [fungidide], 5 kilos of Conter, 5 cans of Curion [pesticide], 5 cans of Muralla, 8 kilos of Macozeb [fungicide] and 4 quintals of fowl guano to maintain her crop healthy and free of pests.

Her dream is to improve her quality of life, to buy more land to work and grow more vegetables.  But her priority is to see her children become better educated professionals with better futures.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her crops.

loans.name: Ma Teresa

texts.es:
Doña Ma Teresa con 53 años de edad es casada, madre de 2 hijos de los cuales los 2 tiene sus estudios culminados  y viven con ella y su padre aportando ayuda en las diferentes actividades del campo. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria completo el cual pudo cursar gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres en su juventud. EL trabajo de la agricultura lo aprendió a través de sus padres los cuales practican la agricultura de generación en generación hasta hoy en día siendo este rubro su único medio de ingreso pero también cultivan maíz y frijol y en ocasiones para su consumo. La tierra que ella trabaja es propia gracias a una herencia por parte de sus padres la cual está cerca de su casa de habitación trasladándose a pie involucrándose sus hijos ella y su esposo. Su producto es vendido a una empresa de la zona que se encarga de comprar a los agricultores su producto para después re-venderlo a otras zonas del país.  

Su sueño es ser la mejor y mayor productora de café de la zona, poder expandir su tierra por medio de la compra y sembrar una mejor variedad la cual pueda ser más competitiva en el mercado como el caturra, Borbone, que son atractivos para sus clientes de esa forma podrá percibir mayores ingresos y apoyar a su hija en los estudios. Es por ello que el día de hoy ha solicitado a COMIXMUL un financiamiento con el cual planea comprar insumos agrícolas con los cuales podrá dar un mejor y mayor mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café como: 10 QQ de 12-24-12, 11 QQ de 18-46-00, 4 QQ de Forticafe, 7 Kilos de Manzate y 5 litros de nutrí café.
texts.en:
María Teresa, 53, is married and mother of two children who have completed their schooling and live with her and their father helping with various field chores.  She completed primary school which she was able to do thanks to her parents’ efforts when she was young.

She learned agricultural work from her parents who have worked in agriculture from generation to generation up to today; this is their only source of income.  They grow corn and beans and occasionally for their own consumption.  The land she works is her own thanks to an inheritance from her parents; it’s quite close to home so she, her husband and her children can get to in on foot.  She sells her production to a local firm that buys production form farmers to then resell it in other parts of the country.

Her dream is to become the best and largest coffee producer in her zone, to be able to expand her land by means of purchase and to plant better varieties like Caturra and Borbone that are more attractive to customers so that she can become more competitive in the marketplace and earn higher income to support her daughter’s schooling.

This is why she’s asking Comixmul for a loan today she plans to use to buy some agricultural supplies like 10 quintals of 12-24-12, 11 quintals of 18-46-00, 4 quintals of Forticafé, 7 kilos of Manzanate and 5 liters of Nutri-Café to provide better coffee crop maintenance

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en: Evans is a 25-year-old married man who has one 1-year-old child. He describes himself as being focused. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle and he has been involved in this business for one and a half years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge as having inadequate capital. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy spare parts to service his motorbike and open another business. His business goal is to have a prosperous family and business within 5 years. Previously he was using his bicycle to transport customers.

loans.use: buy spare parts to service his motorbike and open another business

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a 27-year-old married man. He has two children aged one year and three years. He describes himself to be self-motivated. Samuel operates a transportation business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for one and a half years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy spare parts to service his motorbike and open another business. His business goal is to have a prosperous family and business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a happy family and a profitable business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to service his motorbike and open another business

loans.name: Duncan

texts.en:
Duncan is a 29-year-old married man. He has three children with ages ranging from one year to five years. He describes himself to be determined. 

Duncan operates a transportation business where he transports customers using his bicycle. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to service his bicycle and buy another bike. His business goal is to be prosperous within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a prosperous family and business.

loans.use: to service his bicycle and buy another bike

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for cooking condiments

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 28-year-old man. He has two children aged one year and six years. He describes himself to be creative. 

George operates a retail shop where he sells cooking oil, sugar, wheat flour, etc. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are general consumers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to add stock of sugar, cooking oil, wheat flour, and other items. His business goal is to be successful within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be prosperous.

loans.use: to add stock of sugar, cooking oil, wheat flour, and other items to his shop

loans.name: Dila

texts.en:
Dila wants to buy a cow and sell the milk and baby calves to the locals. She has never requested any loans until recently when she was contacted by the field staff who work out of her area about the eligibility of a startup loan. She was really thrilled and, immediately with staff’s help, she put the application forward to Kiva. 

Dila is 54 and has three children who are still attending school. Rural northern Albania is the part of the country where they reside. “I pray that lenders will help me financially. I want to save for my kids’ education, as they want to earn higher education. So I see this opportunity as an activity to thrive in the livestock and why not? Others in our region, have already.” She ended her conversation smiling all the time.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow

loans.name: Georgina's Group

texts.en:
This group has been in existence since the inauguration of the microfinance branch in Teshie in 2010. They are on their eighth loan cycle. The group is comprised of women and a man who all live in the same neighborhood. They get along well with one another and are united by good group spirit. They are essentially involved in small retail business. They are into jewelry, water, gari, charcoal, maize, milk and Milo [a brand of malted milk].

Georgina (standing second from right in the photo) is the group's featured borrower. She is 37 years old, single, has no children but two dependents. She is actively involved in the sale of jewelry, water from a reservoir and gari (a local food made from cassava), which she buys in bulk quantity from the wholesale market.

With her new loan amount of 2,800 cedis, Georgina will buy three bags of gari and 1,500 cedis' worth of jewelry. She will use the rest to pay water suppliers. Georgina will use her profits to take care of her two dependent children's educational needs as well as her own needs.

loans.use: To buy and sell jewelry, water from a reservoir and gari (a local food made from cassava), which she buys in bulk quantity from the wholesale market.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 32 years old, and he has two, school-going children. He is a farmer and a teacher. His other source of income is teaching. He began the farming business, because it was favourable. He hopes to grow ginger, which is sought after by many people, and yet the growers are few. His challenge is climatic changes, especially the dry spell which scorches up the ginger when it is still in its early stages. John is hardworking and honest. He thanks Ugafode for providing appropriate services to the active poor. In the photo is the client with the Ugafode credit officer (right to left).

loans.use: To hire labour to clear the land

loans.name: Carmen Natalia

texts.es:
Doña Carmen es tiene 36 años de edad la cual es madre de un cuatro hijos, casada, agricultora y ama de casa. Ella tiene un grado de escolaridad de primaria incompleta la cual no pudo terminar por la falta de apoyo económico por parte de sus padres ya que eran de escasos recursos. Ella y su esposo se dedican a la agricultura siendo su especialidad la siembra, cultivo y venta de café pero también cultivan en temporadas frías maíz y frijoles actividad que aprendió gracias a su esposo hace ya 10 años. El terreno que en familia trabajan y cultiva es propio gracias al esfuerzo y sacrificio puesto en los años anteriores para sembrar una excelente cosecha para su venta y de esa forma pudieron adquirirlo el cual está a una distancia de 5 minutos de camino de su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan a pie diariamente. Uno de sus grandes desafíos es el aumento de su producción y mejorar la calidad del terreno para poder cultivar una mejor variedad de café como la caturra que es mejor y mayor mente pagada en el mercado.

Sus Planes son los de obtener una excelente cosecha ya que esto mejorara sus ingresos, reinvertirá en sus cultivos de café, maíz y frijoles pero especialmente en el café que es el mayor medio de ingreso para su familia y hogar.   

Es por esa razón que actualmente ella ha solicitado un financiamiento para la preparación de un pedazo de tierra para cultivar, 10 QQ de 12-24-12, 11 QQ de 18-46-0, 5 QQ de nutrí café 7 kilos de manzate, 4 litros de forticafe para dar una mejor asistencia y mantenimiento a sus cultivos de esta forma aprovechara al máximo la cosecha próxima.
texts.en:
Carmen, 36, is married mother of four children.  She’s a housewife and works in agriculture.  She did not complete primary school because her parents had scarce economic resources and were unable to provide more for her.

She and her husband work in agriculture; their specialty is planting, growing and selling coffee but they also grow corn and beans in the cold season.  She learned this activity thanks to her husband ten years ago.

The land her family works and grows on is their own thanks to the efforts and sacrifice they made in years past to produce excellent crops to sell.  In this way they were able to acquire it.  It’s five minutes away from home so they get to it daily on foot.  One of her greatest challenges is increasing production and improving the quality of the soil to grow better varieties of coffee like Caturra which is the best and has the highest market price.

Her plans are to obtain an excellent crop yield because that will improve her income.  She will reinvest in the coffee, corn and bean crops but especially in the coffee which is her greatest source of family and household income.

This is why she’s currently requesting financing to prepare a piece of land for planting.  She will buy 10 quintals of 12-24-12, 11 quintals of 18-46-0, 5 quintals of Nuri-Café, 7 kilos of Manzate, 4 liters of Forticafé to better care for and maintain her crops thus obtaining the maximum possible in the upcoming harvest.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Araceli

texts.es:
Araceli es una mujer de 33 años de edad agricultora y ama de casa, madre de 3 hijos con un grado de educación secundaria completa. Ella es agricultora y ama de casa que en compañía de su compañero de hogar se dedica al cultivo de café realizando actividades como limpieza, abono, corte, recolecta entre otras ya que en tiempos de frio también cultivan maíz y frijol. Ella aprendió esta actividad desde niña con sus padres ya que ellos son agricultores por tradición familiar y la tierra que juntos trabajan es propia gracias a una herencia familiar la cual está ubicada cerca de su casa de habitación aproximada mente a 5 minutos de camino. Los clientes que ella tiene son bodegas que exclusivamente se dedican a la compra-venta de café en otras localidades cercanas de donde ella vive.

Ella ha solicitado un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL que permitirá adquirir suministros agrícolas, como: 5 QQ de abono 12-24-12, 4 QQ de 18-46-00, 2 QQ de Ferty café, 2 Kilos de manzate y 5 litros de foliar insumos que darán protección y cuidado a sus cultivos de café para la próxima cosecha.

Su mayor anhelo y más grande sueño es poder graduar a sus hijos de la universidad para que en el futuro puedan valerse por sí mismos ya que con lo que ellos ganan no les alcanza para dejarles un patrimonio digno y puedan enfrentar de manera favorable los problemas económicos y a corto plazo poder arreglar su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Araceli is a 33-year old woman.  She is a farmer, homemaker, and mother of 3 children, with a completed secondary-level education.

She is a farmer and homemaker, who, with her live-in partner, makes her living growing coffee, doing tasks such as cleaning, composting, picking and harvesting, among others.  When it gets cold, they also grow corn and beans.  She learned these tasks as a young girl with her parents, since they are farmers by family tradition, and the land that they work together is their own, thanks to a family inheritance.  It is situated near their house, approximately 5 minutes away.

The customers that she has are small grocery stores that focus exclusively on the purchase and sale of coffee in other nearby localities.

She has applied to the cooperative COMIXMUL for a loan that will allow her to acquire agricultural provisions, such as:  5 quintals of 12-24-12 organic fertilizer, 4 quintals of 18-46-00 chemical fertilizer, 2 quintals of Ferty coffee, 2 kilos of manzate fungicide and 5 liters of foliar fertilizer.  These inputs will provide protection and care for her coffee crops for the next harvest.

Her greatest desire and dream is to be able to graduate her children from university, so that in the future they can support themselves, since with what they earn, they won't be able to leave them much of an inheritance, and they will be better able to face economic problems.  Also, in the short term, she would like to be able to fix up her home.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Albina

texts.en:
Albina is a 40-year-old married mother of two school-aged children, who needs your help! She lives in a little town in the northern Albania.

She has been told by the medical team that she must have a surgery soon, yet she is short of money. Her husband works, but according to her, it is difficult to save for the rainy day since his income is limited. "It works best for us to pay loan monthly installments, rather than save. This will be our fourth loan, and we have paid off the previous loans. The only difference is that we request this loan now, from Kiva lenders and I hope they will help me,” she said. Albina is being photographed at the branch office.

loans.use: to pay for her surgery

loans.name: Steven Tamba J. Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you this group of school teachers located in Koidu, in eastern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org to apply for a loan of SLL 4,900,000 for the entire team. With the help of this loan, they can meet their most immediate and most pressing financial needs and at the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf.

Steven is the featured leader of this group. A native of Kono, Steven is married to a housewife.  They have 2 children who are attending primary school. Stevens has been a school teacher for 17 years. He is pursuing further studies at college. He has requested this loan in order to pay his college fees.

loans.use: to pay his college fees

loans.name: Sy-Sikasso-02087 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe   SABOUGNOUMA III sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des familles polygames à KOROBARRAGE, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs avec Mme BINTOU assise en deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter le labour, la semence et les engrais  pour entretenir 0,5. La production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 50.000  francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: The members of the SABOUGNOUMA III group are married women aged 40 and with six children on average, and all living in traditional polygamous families in  Korobarrage, one of the villages in Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to run their agricultural businesses during the rainy season. They are on their third loan with the institution, and their past loans have been repaid in full. Madame Bintou, seated second from the right in the photo, cultivates corn. With her loan, she will pay for labor and agricultural inputs and seeds. Her produce is sold in the village, in Sikasso, after the harvest, to men and women. She aims to make a profit of 50,000 francs CFA per year. This profit will allow her to repay her low and also to help her husband with everyday expenses.

loans.use: to pay for labor and agricultural inputs and seeds

loans.name: Sinignessigui I Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe SINIGNESSIGUI  I sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des familles polygames à KOROBARRAGE, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs avec Mme AFOU debout en deuxième  position de la    droite vers la   gauche sur la photo.  
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter le labour, la semence et les engrais  pour entretenir 0,5. La production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 150.000  francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: The members of the SINIGNESSIGUI I group are married women aged 40 and with six children on average, and all living in traditional polygamous families in Korobarrage, one of the villages in Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to run their agricultural businesses during the rainy season. They are on their third loan with the institution, and their past loans have been repaid in full. Madame Afou, standing up second from the right in the photo, cultivates corn. With her loan, she will pay for labor and agricultural inputs and seeds. Her produce is sold in the village, in Sikasso, after the harvest, to men and women. She aims to make a profit of 150,000 francs CFA per year. This profit will allow her to repay her low and also to help her husband with everyday expenses.

loans.use: pay for labor and agricultural inputs and seeds

loans.name: Johannes

texts.fr: Marié à une revendeuse, Johannes est meunier de profession il a 07 enfants en charge. Il sollicite ce quatrième prêt pour acheter des bandes de meunier, de l’entonnoir, de la dynamo afin de répondre à la demande de la population. Il a 51ans. Il espère agrandir son secteur d'activité et bien scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en: Married to a retailer, Johannes is a miller by trade. He has seven children in his care. He is asking for his fourth loan to buy a generator, a funnel, and belt drives in order to respond to his customers' needs. He is 51 years old. He hopes to grow his business and educate his children well.

loans.use: to buy a generator, a funnel, and belt drives

loans.name: Filadelfo

texts.es: Don Filadelfo, tiene 55 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa, con quien tiene 3 hijos, vive en el municipio de Yoro. El Sr. Filadelfo toda su vida se dedico a la agricultura y albañilería. ya tiene 8 meses de haber iniciado un negocio de pulpería para vender todo tipo de alimentos como lácteos, carnes, embutidos, refrescos, churros, azúcar, harina, manteca, pan etc. este negocio lo ha establecido con el fin de obtener ingresos para su familia. con el préstamo que solicita que es por 10,000 lempiras, va comprar mas producto de abarrotería como granos básicos, manteca, embutidos, carnes, lácteos y refrescos, con el fin de mantener surtido y hacer crecer el negocio para poder darles un mejor nivel de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Filadelfo, age 55, is in a common-law marriage.  He and his wife have three children, and he lives in the Yoro municipality.  Filadelfo has been doing agricultural work and bricklaying all of his life.  Eight months ago he started his store, a business where he sells all types of food like dairy products, meat, sausages, soft drinks, churros, sugar, flour, shortening, and bread, etc.  He established this business in order to get income for his family.

He will use the requested loan for 10,000 lempiras to buy more grocery products like basic grains, shortening, sausages, meat, dairy products, and soft drinks.  He will do this in order to stay stocked and to make his business grow.  He will do this in order to be able to improve his family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products like basic grains, shortening, sausages, meat, dairy products, and soft drink to stock his business.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Akossiwa a 43 ans, elle est mère de deux enfants qui vont tous les deux à l'école. Le mari d'Akossiwa exerce la profession de revendeur. Akossiwa est depuis 11 ans revendeuse de produits d'alimentation générale. Elle vend ses produits à domicile. Elle sollicite un second prêt chez WAGES afin d'augmenter son stock en produit d'alimentation. Elle compte réinvestir ses futurs profits dans son entreprise. Elle aimerait à l'avenir pouvoir acheter elle même à  l'étranger ses produits en gros et assurer l'éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Akossiwa is 43 years old. She is the mother of two children who both go to school. Akossiwa's husband is a retailer. Akossiwa has worked selling general food products for eleven years. She sells her products from home. She is asking for a second loan from WAGES in order to increase her stock of food products. She plans to reinvest her future profits in her business. In the future, she would like to be able to buy her products in bulk from other countries and provide for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy general food products.

loans.name: Afoua

texts.fr: Afin d'acheter des céréales et des charbons de bois au marché pour revendre à ses clients, Afoua sollicite un second crédit à WAGES. Le profit lui permettra d'agrandir son stock et contribuer aux besoins de la famille. Elle est mariée à un retraité et mère de 02 enfants âgés de 30 et 27ans.
texts.en: In order to buy grains and charcoal at the market to resell to her customers, Afoua is asking for a second loan from WAGES. The profit will allow her to grow her stock and contribute to her family's needs. She is married to a retiree and is the mother of two children, aged 30 and 27.

loans.use: to buy charcoal and grains

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell lobster business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase more stock of lobster to sell for her buy and sell lobster business.

Teresa has been in this business for 5 years. Teresa earns more income from a general store.

Teresa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of lobster to sell

loans.name: Evelita

texts.en:
Evelita is 49 years old and is married with six children, two of whom in school. Evelita works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell including canned goods, noodles, soap, and soft drinks.

Evelita has been in this business for 4 years.

In the future Evelita would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell including canned goods, noodles, soap, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 46 years old and married with two children.

Zenaida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, etc.

Zenaida has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 11 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Zenaida aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Eleonor

texts.en:
Eleonor is 60 years old and widowed with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Eleonor runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as bar soaps, shampoos, canned goods, etc.

Eleonor has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Eleonor would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as bar soaps, shampoos, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell including soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, and spices.

Imelda has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Imelda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell including soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, and spices.

loans.name: Juana Haydee

texts.es: Juana Haydee mayor de edad madre soltera con dios hijos menores de edad aun bajo su responsabilidad, originaria del municipio de Chinandega zona donde predomina el comercio, ella es propietaria un cafetín ubicado en uno de los hospitales de este municipio ofreciendo al público en general comidas como: pollo frito, maduro con queso, refrescos naturales, gaseosas, jugos, papel sanico, toallas sanitarias, panpers, leche, golosinas y otros, las compras las realiza en distribuidoras, este negocio lo atiende desde muy temprano 5:pm hasta la 3:am, todos los días de la semana, ella es una mujer emprendedora que con esfuerzo propios y siendo madre soltera ha logrado sacar adelante a sus pequeños hijos, uno de sus sueños es poder mejorar y culminar su vivienda para así ofrecerles un techo digno donde vivir a sus hijos, el objetivo de este crédito es para invertir más en su negocio ya que este tiene mayor demanda y asi poder ofrecerle un mejor servicios a todos sus clientes.
texts.en:
Juana Haydee is a single mother of two minor children who are still in her care.  She is from the town of Chinandega where commerce is the predominant business.  She runs a canteen in one of the local hospitals and serves meals such as fried chicken, ripe plantain and cheese empanadas, natural drinks, sodas and juices.  She also sells toilet tissue, sanitary napkins, disposable diapers, milk, sweets and others.  She purchases her supplies from distributors and works from 5:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m., every day of the week.

She is an entrepreneur who, through her own efforts, has been able to provide for her small children.  One of her goals is to renovate and finish her home so her children can have a decent roof over their heads.  She will use the loan to invest in her business since there is now more demand and she wants to be able to offer better customer service.

loans.use: To buy more food ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 32 years old and single. She helps her parents generate additional income of her family.

Jocelyn is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Jocelyn has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a 10 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Ceniza

texts.en:
Ceniza works hard to support her family. Ceniza is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Ceniza requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like spices, meat, sugar, vegetables, etc.

Ceniza has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Ceniza would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like spices, meat, sugar, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Maria Leonora

texts.en:
Maria Leonora is 42 years old with 3 children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Maria Leonora has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Maria Leonora requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stock of tailoring materials like linen, thread, tailoring chalk, etc.

Maria Leonora has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Maria Leonora would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials like linen, thread, tailoring chalk, etc

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 34 years old and single. She works very hard.

Marilou runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase soft drinks, canned goods, rice, snack foods, etc.

Marilou has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Marilou would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, canned goods, rice, snack foods, etc.

loans.name: Edgar Omar

texts.es:
Omar de 25 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, esta acompañado y su pareja trabaja con una tía haciendo pupusas, tienen un niño de 2 años.
Él trabaja en la agricultura desde hace nueve años, lo aprendió con su abuelito, ya que desde niño se quedo con ellos, antes solo estudiaba; pero al salir de bachiller, toco puertas y no encontró trabajo y fue por eso que se dedico a la agricultura. Su día comienza a las 5:AM mientras su compañera de vida, prepara el desayuno él alista su equipo de trabajo, y luego inicia su viaje, donde camina una media hora a pie. Su horario de trabajo son 6 horas y retorna a casa para cuidar de su hijo.
El préstamo, será utilizado en la compra de una docena de lamina, y madera para hacerle un corredor a la casa y un televisor, ya que  hace poco tiempo bajo la energía eléctrica  y no tiene en que entretenerse. 
Su sueño, es comprar un terreno para construir su propia casa, ya que hoy donde vive es de su suegra, que su hijo logre estudiar hasta graduarse, poder pagarle puntual el crédito y ahorrar para cumplir su sueño en un futuro.
texts.en:
Omar 25, has a high school diploma and he and his common-law wife have a two-year-old son.  His wife works with an aunt in her pupusa (stuffed tortilla) business.
