Sus planes para el futuro es agrandar más sus cultivos, fortalecer el patrimonio para sus hijos los cuales desde pequeños están comprendiendo el valor que tiene para sus padres trabajar con honestidad y transparencia, por lo que hoy en día Doña Santos ha solicitado un financiamiento con el cual comprara 10 QQ de abono 18-46-00, 10 QQ de abono 12-24-12, 8 kilos de manzate, 8 kilos de conter, 6 botes de curion, 6 botes de muralla, 9 kilos de macoceb y 8 QQ de gallinaza para dar protección a sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Santos is a strong, hard-working, entrepreneurial woman with ambitions to get ahead. She completed primary school thanks to the financial support of her parents (despite their economic difficulties) and because there were a few schools in the area in which she grew up.  

She is now 32 years old, she is the mother of 5 children, and she is married.  Santos and her family engage in the different agricultural activities that people commonly do in the region.  She also owns a small store that enables her to earn an income for her family and with which she helps her husband pay the daily household expenses.  

She grows chili, tomato, and granadilla which her husband taught her to do, and her customers are her neighbors and friends.  They come looking for her products because of their quality and the care she puts into harvesting and processing them.

Her future plans are to increase her crops and strengthen the example that she gives her children who have understood since they were small the value in hard, honest and transparent work.

Santos is seeking a loan which she will use to buy fertilizers, fungicide, herbicides, and other chemicals to protect her crops.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her chili, tomato, and granadilla crops.

loans.name: Rita Guadalupe

texts.es: Rita, tiene 32 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja y tiene 3 hijos, reside en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Rita trabajo por varios años en una maquiladora. Hace 3 años inicio su propio negocio de venta de ropa usada para damas, caballeros y niños como ser camisas, pantalones, camisetas, blusas, vestidos etc. Ella vende en su casa, en el mercado y de manera ambulante. Actualmente ha solicitado este préstamo por 15,000 Lempiras para comprar dos fardos de ropa de segunda mano para vender. El plan que tiene es trabajar duro para mejorar la capacidad económica.
texts.en:
Rita is 32 years old. lives with her common-law husband and three children in the Municipality of Choloma, Cortes. Rita worked for a number of years in a factory. She started her own business three years ago selling used clothing for women, men and children. Clothing such as shirts, pants, blouses, T-shirts, dresses, etc. She sells from her home, at markets and in the street.

Rita has requested  a loan of 15,000 HNL  to buy two bundles of used clothing to re-sell. Her plan is to work hard in order to improve her economic situation.

loans.use: to buy two bundles of used clothing for woman, men and children for resale.

loans.name: Abdulo

texts.ru: Абдуло живет в деревни. Его деревня находится далеко от города, где природа подарила людям возможность для развития сельского хозяйства. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Его жена домохозяйка и поэтому Абдуло является единственным кормильцем семьи. Абдуло более 10 лет занимается купле продажей сельхоз культур. Он имеет довольно большой опыт в бизнесе и сам справляется с бизнесом. Абдуло несколько лет назад начал строить жилой дом для своей семьи, но не закончил еще, так как есть некоторые объекты, которых надо завершить. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 4000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, древесина и т.п. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Abdulo lives in the countryside.  His village is located in a remote area, where nature makes it possible for people to work in agriculture.  Abdulo is married and raising three children.  His wife is a homemaker, so he is the only breadwinner in his family.

Abdulo has been buying and selling agricultural crops for more than ten years.  He has a good experience in his field of work and manages his business alone.

A few years ago, he started to build a house for his family.  However, the house is not finished yet: there are a few things that need to be completed.  Abdulo is requesting a loan of 4,000 somoni to buy building materials such as cement and wood.  He is awaiting your kindness and relying on your charity.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement and wood in order to build a new house.

loans.name: Farukh

texts.ru: Любому человеку вдали от Родины всегда тяжело, вот и Фаруху из района Яван тоже далось нелегко. Он два года и четыре месяца работал в Российской Федерации в одном из магазинов, простым продавцом. Ему надо было кормить свою семью. Сейчас Фарух живет с матерью, братьями и сестрами. Его отец уехал в заграницу на заработки. Фарух развелся со своей женой. Развод  дался ему нелегко, но не сломал его. Он решил открыть свою точку и продавать мужскую одежду. Фарух приобрел торговую точку на рынке района. Для закупа товара ему не хватает еще немного денег и он обратился за кредитом. На сумму кредита Фарух хочет приобрести ассортимент сезонной мужской одежды. Он все делает для улучшения жизни своей семьи. Он больше не хочет покидать родину, а наоборот планирует в будущем продвинуть и расшить свой новый бизнес.
texts.en: Just as it is difficult for any person to be far from their homeland, it was difficult for Farukh from Yavan. He worked for two years and four months as a simple clerk in a store in Russia. He needed to feed his family. Now Farukh is living with his mother, brothers, and sisters. His father went abroad to work. Farukh is divorced. The divorce wasn't easy, but it didn't break him. He decided to open his own shop and sell men's clothing. Farukh has a stall at the area market. He needs a bit more money to buy goods, so he is asking for a loan. He would like to use the funds to buy a variety of seasonal men's clothing. Everything he does is to improve his family's life. He doesn't want to leave his country again, and instead plans to advance and grow his new business.

loans.use: To obtain a variety of seasonal men's clothing to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to open another poultry business in another place.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with four children, all of whom are in school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Saumu has operated a retail shop business for the past year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuations. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Mukony

texts.en:
Mukony is 35 years old, married to Normeshuki and the father of four children. For the last 6 years, he has farmed his own piece of land. He earns a good income through potato farming, which has proven to do well in his area due to good climatic conditions. 

Mukony learned about KADET through posters. This will be his fourth loan of KES 60,000 after successfully paying his previous loans. He plans to buy farm inputs including sprays, pesticides and manure. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to re-invest in the farm and plant more acres of potatoes.

His future dreams are that he will be able to buy a bigger piece of land, plant more potatoes for commercial farming, buy his own farm machinery, and educate his children. He is a hardworking man who is focused on his set goals.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Natia

texts.en:
Natia is 19 years old and lives in the town of Kutaisi with her mother and brother. Several times, Natia has requested loans from local financial institutions for her trading business start-up, but without any success. Her loan requests were rejected each time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions.Natia’s father lives and works abroad to send his family money for food. His small, unstable money transfers are the only source of income for the family. 

Natia requested a loan from Credo to start a clothing sales business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with reasonable conditions for the country's vulnerable poor, which do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

Natia will purchase clothes in Turkey at wholesale prices and resell them in her community for a profit. It will be hard work for Natia, but according to estimations, her business will be profitable and will increase the income of the family. The increased profit will be reinvested in her clothing trading business to increase her stock and sales volume. The family members will be able to increase their spending to satisfy their daily needs and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
Mr. Abdul is a 45-year-old man who lives with his family in Lahore, Pakistan. Since 2005, Abdul has been running his own general store near his house. He sells daily usage products in the store. 

He is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. He is currently in need of purchasing some products for his store including powdered milk, flour, rice, chips, oil, soap, candies, etc., but due to financial constraints, he finds it difficult. Therefore, he has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. This will help him offer a good and hygienic variety to his customers. He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase milk, flour, rice, chips, oil, soap, candies, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia, aged 37, she is a responsible mother and lives happily in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. This is her 1st loan with BRAC, She is a new member and has agreed to the terms and condition of BRAC.

She belongs to a poor family and it is very difficult for her to fulfill all the household expenses with a low income. Her husband owns a scrap shop and deals with the scrap iron, aluminum, plastic bottles etc. He purchases scrap from the residents in his town, and sells it to companies for recycling. He has been running his business for many years, his shop is located near his home.

Recently, he got a huge contract to buy scrap and useless iron, from a firm. However, he does not have sufficient savings to show his consent to the dealer. Therefore, Shazia has requested a loan, so he can buy scrap iron, establish his enterprise and make some savings to meet emergencies. Shazia is very impressed with this honorable support and she hopes to borrow a larger loan after this one. She thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy recycled material such scrap iron, plastic and aluminum etc for resale.

loans.name: Miski Ñawi Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MISKI ÑAWI”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lizet es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: pensión de comida, tejido de mantas, venta de golosinas, venta de condimentos, venta de chompas y dulces, venta de frutas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lizet es integrante, ella indica que hace seis meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación su madre que es socia de la institución y le comento de la forma de trabajo que se realiza. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de pensión familiar (comida); este negocio lo inicio por el concejo de su madre y con el apoyo de ella hace doce años atrás.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el mejoramiento de su negocio (compra de refrigerador) que adquirirá de las tiendas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo instalará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para su familia ya que ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The MISKI ÑAWI communal bank is beginning its second cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Panamericana center.  It's made up of eight members and directed by a board of directors, where Lizet serves as the Treasurer. The members have different businesses, such as food, blanket making, snack sales, condiment sales, sweater and candy, and fruit sales.

This loan will help their small businesses, including Lizet's.  She says that she has been with Pro Mujer for six months and joined on her mother's invitation, who is also a member.  She currently has a food business and started it with her mother and her support twelve years ago.

This loan will help her improve her business (buy a refrigerator).  She will buy it in one of the El Alto stores and then install it in her store.  This work will allow her to generate income, since she has a son and is a single mother.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the health training and the loans.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Roern

texts.en:
Roen, 58, lives with her husband and seven children in a village of Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Cambodia. To make a living, she has been farming rice and planting corn. Having been in this business for twenty years, she is able to earn about 28,000KHR per day to meet the family’s need. Roen has been with VisionFund for two cycles and has completely repaid the previous loans to improve her livelihood.

Now she is requesting a new loan of 1,000,000KHR to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her family’s income so as to make a living better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Mzia

texts.en:
Mzia is a 59 year old married woman. She lives with her husband, son, daughter-in-law and 3 grandchildren in Zugdidi district. Mzia works in the local nut factory, where they recycle and package nuts for sale. She has a small monthly salary. Her husband is a worker in the beer company and gets a small monthly salary. Being a refuge, their son gets pension from the government institutions.

As the income is not enough to feed such a large family and cover everyday costs, Mzia decided to start her own business and seek credit among local financial institutions. However, her attempts were unsuccessful because of their poor living conditions. The startup program, that is joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan, for starting or re-starting businesses. Her application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of $300. With the loan, she will purchase stock of clothing from the wholesalers and then resell it at higher price. This will increase their amily's income. With support of the Startup program Mzia will get an opportunity to be involved in her own business and address her financial difficulties.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of clothing for resale

loans.name: Farkhanda

texts.en:
Farkhanda is 37 years old and the mother of four children. She lives with her children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Farkhanda is taking loan for her husband, who has been manufacturing plastic spare parts through compression molding machines. He has three molding machines. He has appointed two workers on daily wages for manufacturing spare parts. A few days ago one of these molding machines went out of order due to overheating. In fact, the molding machine contains a heater inside which sparked due to fluctuation in electricity. This machine sustained extraordinary damage which is unable to be repaired. 

Her husband wants to buy new compression molding machine to continue his business. He has to complete his tasks on specific given time schedule, but he would be unable to complete it in the absence of a machine. Therefore, Farkhanda contacted Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan and presented her humble request for a loan. A field officer has checked out his previous behavior, which is admirable, and then gave approval for the loan. 

Farkhanda seems very happy after taking this loan. She says thanks to Kiva and hopes that lenders will take an active part in supporting her.

loans.use: To buy compression molding machine for manufacturing spare parts.

loans.name: Farhod

texts.ru: Фарход трудолюбивый и целеустремленный молодой человек. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Фарход более 5 лет занимается скотоводством. Он в основном занимается откармливанием крупно - рогатого скота. Он имеет коровник у себя дома и все условия для развития своего бизнеса. Фарход живет в сельской местности и поэтому ему легко развевать свой бизнес. Фарход очень добрый человек. Он всегда помогает всем людям. Его близкий друг не имеет место работы и поэтому планирует уехать в Российскую Федерацию. Он имеет большую семью и живет очень бедно. Фарход решил помочь другу по покупки авиабилета, так как его друг не имеет денег для покупки авиабилета. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 4000 сомони для покупки авиабилета. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Farhod is a hardworking and ambitious young man.  He is married and has two children.  He has been involved in animal husbandry for more than five years, and essentially fattens cattle.  He has a barn at home and everything he needs to develop his farming business.  He lives in a rural area which makes it easy to develop such a business.  

Farhod is a very kind man who is always eager to help.  His closest friend is currently unemployed and planning to leave for Russia.  This friend is very poor, with a large family.  Since his friend doesn't have enough money to buy his own ticket, Farhod has decided to help him by buying him a plane ticket.

Farhod is therefore taking a loan of 4,000 somoni to buy a plane ticket.  He is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a plane ticket for his friend who is planning to go to Russia.

loans.name: Ana Yanci

texts.es:
Ana, requiere optar por un nuevo préstamo porque necesita más capital de trabajo para continuar en su tienda; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar productos de la canasta básica, tales como: frijoles, arroz, azúcar, papas, golosinas, bebidas, detergentes, entre otros.
La Sra. Ana comenta que el crédito anterior le ayudo a mejorar su negocio y asimismo su clientela junto con las ventas. Las condiciones económicas han mejorado y desea adquirir una mayor estabilidad económica  en su familia.
texts.en: Ana needs a new loan because she needs capital to buy food products such as beans, rice, sugar, potatoes, snacks, drinks, detergents, and other things.  Ana says that the previous loan helped her improve her business and sales.  Her financial conditions have improved and she wants more financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Vanice

texts.en:
Vanice is an old client of the institution. She is a widow and has three children. Together they reside in Ntungamo district. She is facing a challenge of low working capital in her bar, and she goes on to say that due to the financial problems she is unable to take good care of her family. 

Her prime target is to give her children a better education and to help her extended family. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 UGX to buy more drinks for her bar. With this loan, she hopes she can improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for her pub

loans.name: José Germán

texts.es:
José, se a dedicado desde muy pequeño a la agricultura teniendo una familia bastante numerosa tenia que desempeñar esa labor, la condición económica de su familia, era bastante mala tenían que dedicase a trabajar y ayudar a sus padres y no logro  ningún grado académico y no pudo lograr aprender a leer ni escribir.
A sus 20 años se caso y empezó a trabajar ya por su cuenta,  en compañía de su esposa, de esta unión procrearon 4 hijos ya  han formado su propia familia.

También se dedica al cultivo de hortalizas, las cuales las cultiva en épocas de verano en una zona de riego, para esta ultima actividad tiene que levantarse bastante temprano; ya que se encuentra a 10 kilómetros de su casa y tiene que estar muy pendiente de ella,  quedándose todo el día si es posible en la noche para cuidarlos de las plagas y animales que llegan por las noches, para el cultivo del maíz lo hace mas cerca a un kilómetro de su casa; ya que a podido conseguir tierras rentando, para terminar temprano tiene que madrugar y en ocasiones hace el día completo, con el se involucran 2 de sus hijos quienes le ayudan a trabajar parte de las tierras

Los fondos del crédito serán utilizados para la compra de insumos agrícolas; abonos, fertilizantes, pago de mosos y para preparar la tierra para el cultivo de 14, 000 metros cuadrados de maíz, se espera favorecer mejor el cultivo de maíz y lograr al final de la cosecha una mayor producción.

 Manifestó, que para un futuro espera terminar de construir su casa y seguir trabajando y ayudar en lo que pueda a sus hijos sacando créditos siempre para el trabajo y utilizando las ganancias para terminar la casa.
texts.en:
José has worked in agriculture since he was quite young, coming from a large family who did the same. His family's economic situation was poor so he had to work to help his parents. He did not go to school and did not learn to read nor write. He married when he was 20 years old and along with his wife began to work for himself. This union produced four children and they formed their own family. 

He grows vegetables on irrigated land in the summer. He has to get up quite early to do this as this plot is 10 kilometers from his house.  He has to keep close watch on it, staying there all day and if possible in the night too, in order to protect it from infestations and animals that come at night. He grows his corn closer to his home, one kilometer away. As he has also managed to rent land, he has to start very early and sometimes work all day. He also has two of his sons who help him work part of the land.

José will use the loan to buy agricultural supplies to buy fertilizer and manure, to pay for labor and to prepare the land to cultivate 14,000 square meters of corn. He plans to care for corn more in order to produce a more plentiful harvest. He says that in the future he wants to finish building his house, continue working and help his sons get more loans to work the land and use the revenues to complete the house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and manure, to pay for labor and to prepare the land to cultivate 14,000 square meters of corn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cylinder - equipment that is very important in making French bread.

loans.name: Fazeelat

texts.en:
Fazeelat is a 20 years old married lady. She is newly married but her husband does not have a suitable occupation to afford the expense of a single family. Her husband newly started a business. He provides services to wash dirty and dusty carpets. He uses various very costly chemicals to wash the carpets.

Her husband is a poor person and does not have sufficient amount to buy these chemicals. One member of BRAC who lives in her neighborhood suggested and referred them to take a loan from BRAC.

Fazeelat wants to financially help her husband in the form of a loan. Therefore, Fazeelat reached the nearest branch of BRAC and requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

The condition of her house is not good, she wants to maintain her house through the profit amount.
  
She hopes that her husband will utilize this loan in a positive way and can establish his business soon. 
Fazeelat says thanks to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy chemicals for washing carpets.

loans.name: Abdurahim

texts.ru: Абдурахим храбрый и целеустремленный человек. Ему 38 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Он участвовал на гражданской войне в Таджикистане и потерял свою одну ногу. Данное время у него протез и он должен работать с такой ногой. Его жена домохозяйка и занимается воспитанием детей. Абдурахим более 15 лет занимается предоставлением услуги такси. Сегодня он имеет автомашину марки Опель. Он всегда старается улучшить условию проживания для своей семьи. Он хочет сделать стены вокруг дома. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 6000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов, как цемент, песок и т.п. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Abdurahim is a courageous and goal oriented man. He is 38 years old, married, and has three children. He lost a leg while fighting in Tajikistan's civil war. At this time he has a prosthetic leg, and should be able to work with it. His wife is a homemaker and raises the children. Abdurahim has been providing taxi services for over 15 years. He currently has an Opel brand car. He is always trying to improve his family's living conditions. He would like to build a fence around their home. He is asking for a 6000 somoni loan to buy building materials such as cement, sand, etc. He awaits and hopes for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement and sand for building a fence around his house

loans.name: Sirojiddin

texts.ru: Сироджиддин человек с жизненным опытом. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Он очень трудолюбивый человек и имеет более чем 8 лет опыта в бизнесе. Он занимается куплей продажей сухофруктов на местном рынке. В последнее время у него мало клиентов, так как конкуренция большая, и он не может придерживать своих клиентов. Сироджиддин должен срочно расширить свой ассортимент для того, чтобы вернуть своих клиентов. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 7500 сомони для того, чтобы купить сухофруктов для пополнения оборотного капитала. Он надеется на вас и на вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Sirojiddin is a man with a large experience of life.  He is married and the father of three children.  He is also very hardworking and has more than eight years of experience in his business.  

Sirojiddin buys and sells dried fruits at the local market.  However, the competition has been fierce lately,  and he has had a difficult time retaining his customers, ending up with only a small number of customers.  

Sirojiddin urgently needs to expand his inventory in order to regain his customer base.  He is taking a loan of 7,500 somoni to buy dried fruits to increase his working capital.  He is relying on you and on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy dried fruits in order to increase his working capital.

loans.name: Mbinga Group

texts.en:
Agatha is in her early thirties. She is married, with three children who are still going to school. She has been running a food vending business since 2005. She works from 5:00 a.m. to 2:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Agatha's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She wants to use the loan to buy more rice, maize flour, baking flour, cooking oil, salt, onions and other goods. She dreams of building her own house.

Agatha will share this loan with her loan group Mbinga, which has 14 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more rice, maize flour, baking flour, cooking oil, salt and onions.

loans.name: Joaquín Jeovanny

texts.es:
Joaquín de 41 años de edad,  es agricultor, realizó sus estudios básicos, casado, tiene una hija de 2 años de edad, actualmente su esposa solo se dedica al cuidado de la casa y realizar los oficios domésticos y él se dedica al cuidado del ganado.

Se ha dedicado a la agricultura desde que era muy pequeño, los conocimientos los adquirió de su padre que también se llamaba Joaquín.  Aprendió el oficio desde que tenia 10 años de edad, lo cual, lo motivo a seguir los mismo pasos de su padre y además actualmente tiene ganado lechero donde le genera ingresos para solventar  los  gastos de la familia.

El préstamo, será para comprar  fertilizantes para darle la primera aplicación a sus 10,000 metros cuadrados de  maíz. Una vez aplicado la fertilización mejora el crecimiento del cultivo y que tengan excelente desarrollo para obtener una mayor producción de maíz y con esto el cliente sastifacera  la necesidad de tener su cultivo sano para que le genere un mayor rendimiento.   

sus sueños es mantener su casa en buen estado para que su familia viva bien y seguir trabajando las tierras con granos básicos y el cuidado del Ganado, que es su fuente de ingresos para solventar los gastos familiares y el cliente quiere que su hija darle los estudios a futuro y el crédito le ayudara a tener el cultivo con un buen desarrollo y tener una mayor producción lo cual le generara ingresos a futuro que  invertirá en la compra de mas ganado.
texts.en:
Joaquín is 41 years old and is a farmer with a basic education.  He's married and has a two year old daughter and his wife is a housewife.  He raises livestock.

He has been in farming since he was very young and learned from his father, also named Joaquín.  He learned when he was 10 years old, which motivated him to to follow in his father's footsteps.  He also has dairy cows that generate income to pay the household expenses.

He will use the money from this loan to buy fertilizer to apply to his 10,000 square meters of corn.  Once applied, it will improve his crops so that they will develop well, increase their corn production, and keep it healthy so it can generate better income.

His dream is to keep his house in good shape and continue working the land with basic grains and livestock, which is his source of income to pay household expenses.  He also wants to provide a good education for his daughter.  The loan will help him have good crops and increased production which will generate income which he will invest into more livestock.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Mirza

texts.en:
Mirza is 34 years old. He lives in the Terjola District with his spouse and mother. Mirza’s mother is running small scale fruit trading business and earns a small monthly income. Mirza is involved in the agricultural business. Specifically, he has a milk cow. He produces cheese from the milk and sells it locally. In addition, the family owns a pig and sells piglets seasonally. Mirza also grows maize on a plot of land and takes care the vineyard. The harvested products are also for selling.

He is very hardworking and the type of person who puts family first. With this loan, Mirza will purchase all the building materials for a greenhouse. After the greenhouse is built properly, Mirza will grow greens and various vegetables. The harvested products will be sold for a good price. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase the family income and all members will have their living conditions improved.

loans.use: to construct a greenhouse

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en:
Matilda is a married with four children, all of whom attend school and are under her care. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For over three years, she has operated a vegetable sales business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase a sack of green vegetables, tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a sack of green vegetables, tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Darajani Group

texts.en:
Mfanyeje, who is a member of Darajani group, has been running a genge (grocery store) selling fruits and vegetables for seven years. Mfanyeje, who is in her late forties, is married with eight children, only one of whom is in school. The remaining children have grown up; some of them are married and others depend on themselves. Mfanyeje works from 10 a.m. to 11 p.m. daily and is able to make a very good return per month. 

This will be Mfanyeje's twentieth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used her previous loans to serve her business by purchasing more fruits and vegetables. She has paid back all of her previous loans successfully. She managed to use her profit to buy a plot of land where she built a house, and she also covered part of home and school expenses. Mfanyeje will use this loan to restock more genge fruits and vegetables. She dreams of improving her business by selling more food items.

She will share this loan with her loan group Darajani, which consists of 10 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock more genge fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Faromurz

texts.ru: Фаромурз умный и начитанный молодой человек. Ему 23 года. Он не женат. Фаромурз с детства мечтал стать врачом. Фаромурз отлично учился в средней школе. Он после окончания средней школы поступил в Алтайский Государственный Университет. В университете он учится отлично и активно участвует в общественной жизни университета. Фаромурз планирует после окончания университета, вернутся на родину и открыть частную клинику в отдаленном регионе, так как профессиональных врачей в его регионе нет. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 4200 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Faromurz is a smart and well-read young man. He is 23 years old, and not married. Faromurz has dreamed of becoming a doctor since childhood. He was an A-student in high school, and after graduating, enrolled at the Altai State University. He is still an A- student in the university, and takes an active part in the university's social life. Faromurz plans to return to his native country after finishing university and opening a private clinic in a rural region, since there are no professional doctors in his region. He is asking for a 4200 USD loan to pay university tuition. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for his education

loans.name: Leopoldo

texts.es:
Leopoldo con 70 años de edad, solo estudio hasta 3º grado, esta acompañado; su compañera de vida se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, de sus cinco hijos solo solo una hija vive con ellos, los demás hijos están casados.

Él es agricultor, pero sabe el oficio de la albañilería, también posee un molino. Estos oficios los aprendió de su padre, quien también, era agricultor y sabia de albañilería. Así, que decidió dedicarse también a estas actividades productivas. El molino, esta 500 metros de su casa, y lo trabaja de 7 a.m. a 5 p.m.

El préstamo será utilizado, para comprar cemento y el ladrillo de piso, puesto que él mismo, es quien construye su casa, aun le falta repellar y afinar las paredes, además,  le falta poner el piso. 

Lo que más desea, es seguir trabajando en la agricultura y seguir en el negocio del molino, un sueño que siempre ha tenido es de trabajar en la compra y venta de ganado. Sabe que esto podrá lograrlo, solo trabajando fuertemente, como hasta hoy lo ha hecho y que gracias al apoyo que se le brinda con los créditos, podrá lograrlos más fácilmente.
texts.en:
Leopoldo is 70 years old, and married. His wife is a housewife and they have five children. Only one of them, a daughter, lives with them as the others are married. He studied until Grade Three. He is a farmer but knows the bricklaying trade and also has a mill. He learned these trades from his dad who also knew how to farm and brick-lay. He decided to follow in his father's foot-steps. He works in the mill which is 500 meters from his house, from 7 am until 5 pm. 

Leopoldo will use the loan to buy cement and floor tiles, given that he has built the house himself and he still has to finish the walls and put in the flooring.

What he wants most is to continue farming and continue the mill business. He has always dreamed of buying and selling livestock. he knows that he can only achieve this by working hard as he has done up to this time. Thanks to the help given to him through the loans it is easier for him to achieve this.

loans.use: to buy cement and floor tiles, given that he has built the house himself and he still has to finish the walls and put in the flooring.

loans.name: Laveeza's Group

texts.en:
Laveeza is 46-year-old married woman who lives with her husband and 6 children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband drives a van which does not belong to him. He has to pay the daily fare to the van owner. A few days ago he was in a road accident during driving and the van was seriously damaged. The van owner is imposing a penalty upon him which is beyond his earning capacity. He would like to buy his own van to drive so that he would not have to pay the fare on a daily basis. 

Because of this issue, Laveeza requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, which is a field partner of Kiva. Laveeza hopes that through this amount her husband will be able to repair the van so that her husband can drive it again. 

Laveeza belongs to a poor family. Her husband is the only earning person and does not have any other source of income. 

Laveeza seems very glad and says thanks to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for repair of the van.

loans.name: Shakeela's Group

texts.en:
Shakeela is a 37-year-old married woman living with her spouse and three children in Lahore, Pakistan. 
She belongs to a poor family. Her family is passing their lives by hand to mouth. Her husband owns a small clothing shop in which he sells ladies' and gentlemen's clothes. He has been running this business since 2002. It is his misfortune that he could not built up a good relationship with his customers; this is the reason he could not establish his enterprise. 

Now with the increase in their needs, they consider it necessary to grow the business. However, the lack of capital is the major problem for her husband.  
Therefore, Shakeela took a loan for her husband’s business. With the help of this loan, her husband will purchase more clothes to sell. 
Shakeela says thanks to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Fidel Ángel

texts.es:
Don Fidel de 46 años de edad, solo estudio hasta 1º grado, esta casado; su esposa se dedica a realizar las labores del hogar, tiene 3 hijos de 12, 10 y 8 años, todos asisten a la escuela.  Actualmente esta viviendo la suegra con ellos, pero no depende directamente de él.

Desde hace 36 años trabaja como agricultor, oficio que aprendió de sus padres, quienes toda su vida fueron agricultores, el lugar donde siembra esta a 500 metros de su casa, y se transporta en su bicicleta. En esta actividad tiene el apoyo de sus hijos y su esposa,  laboran normalmente de 6 a.m. a 11 a.m.  También, se dedica a distribuir pollos de engorde, desde hace 3 años. Debido a que no eran suficientes los ingresos generados de la producción de maíz, para lograr mantener a su familia.

Con el otorgamiento del crédito,  comprara la semilla, los fertilizantes, herbicidas e insecticidas y pagar la maquinaria agrícola para que le prepare la tierra. 

Don Fidel, espera ver realizados profesionalmente a sus hijos, y así darles la oportunidad de que se superen en la vida, ya que el no tubo ese privilegio de estudiar. También, desea comprar un terreno para cultivarlo, y tener la posibilidad de obtener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Fidel is 46 years old and has a first grade education.  He's married, his wife is a housewife, and they have three children, ages 12, 10, and 8.  All attend school.  His mother in law currently lives with them, but she is not dependent on him.  He has been working as a farmer for 36 years and learned this from his parents who were also farmers.  His crops are 500m from his home and he rides his bicycle.  His children and wife help him and they usually work from 6:00 am to 11:00 am.  They have also raised chickens for the past three years because the income from raising corn was not enough to support the family.

He will use the money from this loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, herbicides, insecticides, and pay for farm labor to prepare the land.

Fidel hopes to see his children become professionals and give them the opportunity to succeed in life, since he didn't have the opportunity to attend school.  He also wants to buy some farmland and have the chance for increased income.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Shalet

texts.en:
Shalet appreciates the previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards and enabled her to open a cosmetic business that sells items such as hair oil and lotion. She also sells khangas(women wrap cloth) in her shop. 

Beside the charcoal selling business, Shalet opened a cosmetic shop due to high demand of her customers.

She is requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to purchase hair oil, body lotion, and powder for her business. She joined Yehu for financial support.

loans.use: to purchase hair oil, body lotion, and powder for her business.

loans.name: Malkhaz

texts.en:
Malkhaz is 57 years old, married, and lives in the village of Kvaliti. His wife is jobless and stays home. Malkhaz’s son is 26 years old and is unemployed at the moment as well. He is actively seeking a job but without any success.  Malkhaz is a driver and serves the local manufacturing company. He earns a small monthly salary for covering feeding and everyday costs. In addition to his main job, Malkhaz is involved in a small-scale agricultural business and owns two cows and a vineyard.
As the existing revenues are very small, the family decided to start a car import business to supplement his income, but his loan requests have been rejected several times by local financial institutions. He lacks experience with new business start-ups and does not qualify for a traditional loan under income requirements. Malkhaz is requesting a loan under the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This loan program provides start-up and restart-up loans with reduced requirements for the rural poor who do not have access to many credit products because they are regarded as “high-risk borrowers." With the received loan, Malkhaz’s son will purchase cars abroad and resell them in Georgia for a price mark-up. The family will reinvest the profit in the same business and develop it. They hope that the business will be profitable and the new business initiative will significantly improve their living conditions.

loans.use: and his son to start a car import business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Dama

texts.en:
Dama is married and has nine children.  Four go to school and the rest are adults. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a food selling business.  She prepares food such as flat bread, dumplings, beans, rice and she sells to her neighbors and passersby. She cites seasonality as her major challenge. She dreams of expanding and establishing a restaurant in the future.

With the 25,000 Kenyan Shillings, she wants to purchase cooking oil, rice, beans and wheat flour. She decided to join Kiva's lending partner Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, rice, beans, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Sibra

texts.en:
Sibra’s husband owns a vehicle spare parts shop in which he sales motorbike’s spare parts such as break shoes, break levers, hubs, rims, mud guards, filters, chains, head lights, batteries, etc. He has been doing this business for many years and earning a sufficient enough amount to afford household expenses. Her husband has to support his family and aging parents also. The spare parts shop is his single source of income. He estimated his future expenses and concluded that he needs to grow his business so that he can easily cope with the future’s expenses. 
Therefore, Sibra requested a loan for her husband so that her husband could succeed in his ambitions. 
She is the mother of a daughter who is young and is fully dependent upon her parents. She spends her whole day at home and looks after her daughter and elderly parents as well. 
She hopes that her husband will be successful in his future planning and that this loan will prove beneficial for his business.
Sibra says thanks to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy spare motorbike parts to sell.

loans.name: Izolda

texts.en:
Izolda is 67-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband, daughter-in-law, and two grandchildren in the Sagarejo district. Izolda and her husband are provided with retirement pension. The family is out of source of income. 

Izolda decided to start her own business and seek credit among local financial institutions, but her attempts were unsuccessful because of her poor living conditions. The Start-Up program, a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. 

Her application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of $700. With the received credit, she will open a bakery. She already owns a commercial party where she is going to open a bakery. She plans to purchase raw and building materials for the bakery. When the bakery opens, she will bake Georgian bread and sell it at a good price. 

Izolda is a very enthusiastic and hard working person with a great desire to ensure that her grandchildren have good education to progress in life. This credit will be great support for the family. Izolda is thankful to Kiva Lenders for giving her a chance to generate income.

loans.use: to open a bakery.

loans.name: Santos Martín

texts.es:
Santos es un hombre soltero de 21 años de edad. Vive junto a sus padres y hermanos en Caserío Cipresales, Cantón Xajaxac,  Sololá, Sololá. Sus padres se dedican a la agricultura y sus hermanos aun se encuentran estudiando.
El se dedica a la comercialización de productos naturales que contribuyen a  la salud de las personas. Eligio esta actividad porque tiene la oportunidad de ofrecer su producto en diferentes partes y así ayudar a las personas a que mejoren su condición física.
Tiene 6 meses de desenvolverse en este trabajo que gracias a Dios le ha ido bien en sus ingresos y ganancias es como de esta manera el puede ayudar en los gastos de su familia.
El está solicitando un préstamo de Q 7,000.00 para comprar más productos naturales para ofrecerles a sus clientes una gran variedad y de esta manera mejorar las ganancias para poder seguir apoyando a su familia.
Su sueño es incrementar sus ganancias para poder contratar a jóvenes para que se involucren en este tipo de negocio y así mejorar la calidad de vida de las personas.
texts.en:
Santos is 21 years old and single.  He lives with his father and brothers in Caserío Cipresales, Cantón Xajaxac, Sololá, Sololá.  His parents farm and his brothers attend school.

He sells natural health products and chose this activity because he had the chance to offer his products in different areas and help people with their physical condition.

He has been doing this for six months and thanks to God things have gone well for him with his income so he can provide for his family.  He is asking for a loan of Q 7,000 to buy more natural products so he can offer his customers a large variety, increase his income, and continue supporting his family.

His dream is to increase his income so he can hire young men to get involved in this type of business and improve the quality of life for others.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Kalyamenvu Twekulakulanye Group

texts.en: Evalist is a rural peasant who does farming and animal keeping on a small scale. He concentrates on growing cabbage because there is a larger market and has less competition. Since it is seasonal, he supplements the income with his piggery in order to adequately meet his family's needs. He will use this particular loan to buy pesticides for the cabbage. He is hard working and focused.

loans.use: To buy pesticides

loans.name: Los Gigantes De Santiago De Chacan Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LOS GIGANTES DE SANTIAGO DE CHACAN”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             
La socia es la Sra. Lucia ella es separada tiene 31 años y tiene 03 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes entre otros, la socia cría a estos animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia a la vez se dedica a la agricultura, siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de cuyes para su negocio.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, agricultura, ganaderia, venta de trigos y maiz, panaderia.
La persona que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.
La socia que sale adjunta en la foto pidio permiso para llegar tarde a la reunion por motivos de trabajo.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to Los Gigantes de Santiago de Chacan Communal Bank, located in the Anta district in the province of Anta and the department of Cusco.

The member, Lucía, 31, is separated and has three children.  She alternates her daily activities with her business raising small animals such as guinea pigs.  She raises these little animals to later sell to customers who request them.  Lucía has been in this business for a long time and it's going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into it every day.  She also works in agriculture to get her family ahead.                                                                                                                                                                                    

Lucía's requesting the loan to buy guinea pigs for her business.

The other members work selling animals, farming, ranching, selling wheat and corn, and baking.  The person whose face is covered doesn't belong to the communal bank.  The member who's in the attached photo had permission to arrive late to the meeting because of work. 

Lucía's grateful to those who share her dream through this loan.  She promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs

loans.name: Yulita

texts.en:
Yulita, 36, is married to Maxi and blessed with four children: Ranti, 13; Lany, 9; Angel, 5; and Anyer, 2. 

Yulita runs a kiosk business at home. She has been running the business for one year. She sells daily basic necessities, i.e., sugar, bath soap, cooking ingredients, instant noodles, and some snacks. The income from her business enables her to assist her husband in covering their household needs and school fees of her children.

Recently, Yulita was thinking of improving the business. She intends to increase her kiosk business inventory with bath soap, instant noodles, and some snacks. Yulita is sure the more complete the stock at her kiosk, the more income she can earn. Therefore she requested a loan from TLM amounting to 4,500,000 IDR. She hopes that the business will run well so she will be able to repay the loan to TLM.

loans.use: to purchase bath soap, instant noodles, and some snacks to sell.

loans.name: Alda

texts.en:
Alda is a 51-year-old married woman with two children. She lives in Clarin Misamis Occidental.

To earn a living, she owns and operates an agriculture business. She plants and harvests vegetables for sale in the local community while her husband works as a security guard. 

In 2009, she joined Gata Daku MPC and successfully repaid her previous loans that she used to purchase fertilizer. Recently, she requested a new loan to buy fertilizer, such as manure, to be used for farm expansion.
 
She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer (e.g., manure).

loans.name: Claudio

texts.en: Claudio lives in Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is married with one child. His wife is a teacher while he runs a motorcycle rental business to make a living. He joined Gata Daku MPC and borrowed a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase new tires and accessories for better service. He plans to use the generated income to build his own house for a better life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase new tires and accessories

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is single woman who is blessed with one child who is still underage. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Monica prepares dumplings and sells them to town dwellers, neighbors and passersby. She dreams of establishing a cafe business in the future.

With the 10,000 KES she wants to purchase food ingredients such as wheat flour, sugar and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to expand her business

loans.use: to purchase food ingredients such as wheat flour, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Huda

texts.en: Huda is 20 years old. She lives with her family, which consists of two brothers, two sisters and her parents in a rented house in a sector in Jordan called Mafraq. Huda is currently studying for her Bachelor in Law degree and is in her third year. Her family is currently facing a financial crisis. For this reason, she has applied for this loan to be able to pay for her study fees.

loans.use: To pay for her semester fees

loans.name: Ada Marisol

texts.es:
Ada es una Joven de 22 años,  con un nivel académico de enfermera; pero como no tiene trabajo , para de desempeñar su profesión,  la ha llevado a buscar otro tipo de ocupación, como es la ganadería; ya que sus padres también se dedican al cuido de ganado.

Por el momento posee una vaca,  que es la que cuida, no tiene otro negocio. A pesar que esta joven, sumisión es hacer algo, y tener ocupado el tiempo. Su trabajo lo realiza en su comunidad lo cual pasa ocupada unas cuatro horas al día  

Con el préstamo solicitado a fundación CAMPO, comprara una vaca más, para aprovechar de sacar un recurso más tomando en cuenta que ya tiene ocupado su tiempo, su vida mejorara por que tendrá más recursos económicos por que venderá leche todos los días.
Menciona que uno de sus sueños es desempeñar su profesión, sí es posible tener una familia.
texts.en:
Ada is a young 22 year old woman trained as a nurse, but since she doesn't have any work in her profession, she has had to look for another type of work like raising livestock.  Her parents also raise livestock.

At the moment she has a cow.  She doesn't have any other business.  Despite being young, her mission is to accomplish something and fill her time.  She works in her community, for four hours a day.

She will use the money from this loan through CAMPO to buy one more cow to take advantage of the time she already spends.  Her life will improve and she will have more financial resources from the sale of milk every day.  She says that one of her dreams is to develop her profession and if possible have a family.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Angela Delmira

texts.es:
Angela cuenta con 47 años de edad,  nunca fue a la escuela, ya que sus padres por la misma pobreza no le dieron la oportunidad de enviarla a estudiar. Ella es madre soltera de un hijo de 23 años de edad, ya no estudia, finalizo su bachillerato. También, vive con ella  su nuera y su madre.


Desarrolla actividades agrícolas, desde los ocho años, ya que su padre le enseño ese trabajo; porqué él fue agricultor toda su vida, y a sus 6 hijas incluida ella, las llevaba a trabajar al campo. Asimismo,  trabaja como jornalera en los cañales. El lugar donde cultiva, esta a una distancia de 2 km, y su recorrido lo hacen a pie, por veredas y quebradas. Su hijo le ayuda a realizar las labores agrícolas, en los 7,000 metros cuadrados de tierra que producen, y que laboran desde las 6 a.m. hasta la 11 a.m.

Con el préstamo, sera posible comprar, la semilla, los fertilizantes, herbicidas e insecticidas y pagar la maquinaria para que prepare la tierra para  sembrar.

Su  deseo es adquirir  una refrigeradora, remodelar su vivienda, y desea seguir produciendo maíz, y si se le presenta la oportunidad, desea comprar un terreno. Pero sabe, que tiene que trabajar muy duro para lograrlo, y que con la ayuda de los créditos, podrá cumplir sus metas.
texts.en:
Angela is 47 years old. She never went to school because her parents were also poor and could not give her the opportunity to send her to study. She is a single mother of a 23-year-old son who no longer studies but has finished secondary school. Angela also lives with her daughter-in-law and her daughter-in-law's mother.

Angela has worked in agriculture since she was 8 years old. Her father, who was a farmer all his life, taught this trade to all 6 of his daughters, including Angela, by taking them to work in the fields. The land she works on now is 2 kilometers away and she goes this distance by foot, via paths and gullies. Her son helps her with the agricultural work. They cultivate 7,000 square meters of land and they work from 6 a.m. to 11 a.m. In addition to this, Angela is a day laborer in the sugar cane fields.

She will use the loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, herbicides and insecticides; and to pay for the machinery which is used to prepare the soil for planting. She hopes to one day acquire a refrigerator, remodel her house and continue growing corn. And, should the opportunity present itself, she would like to buy her own piece of land. She knows that she needs to work very hard to obtain this, and that with the help of the loans she will be able to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, herbicides and insecticides; and to pay for the machinery to prepare the land for planting.

loans.name: Isidro

texts.es:
Isidro hombre de 67 años de edad, procreo 9 hijos; todos trabajan y tienen sus hogares aparte, a ellos el nivel de educación fue muy bajo debido a la situación económica que él tenia en ese momento. 

Comenta que le a tocado duro,  porque, la compañera de vida lo abandono hace 20 años, buscando el sueño americano le dejo una niña de 6 meses de nacida, la que tiene 20 años hoy, comenta al final de todo  que se siente feliz, ya que tiene el amor de sus hijos.

Tiene experiencia, desde que tiene ocho años con el papá toda una vida se a dedicado a cultivo de maíz y frijol tiene 59 años de dedicarse a esto. El comenta que es una herencia que dejo el papá. él también tiene pequeños ingresos del ganado porque vende mínimo una vaca por año. 

El crédito, será invertido en la compra de insumos agrícolas como: abono, fungicida, pagara la tierra que le arriendan y   pago de mano de obra para sembrar el maíz. El crédito lo mejorara porque tendría la alimentación bien asegurada. 

Su propósito es,  seguir trabajando mientras Dios todo poderoso le da licencia de vida, para seguir cosechando,  primero el amor de sus hijos y segundo el maíz y frijol. Con el crédito cultivara 7,000 metros cuadrados de terreno mas que el año pasado.
texts.en:
Isidro is a 67-year-old man. He has 9 children who all work and have their separate homes. Their level of education was very low due to the economic situation he was in at that time.

He says that he has had it hard, because the companion of his life abandoned him 20 years ago, to search for the American dream. She left him with a 6-month-old girl, who is 20 years old today. He says that in the end of it all he feels happy, since he has the love of his children.

He has experience - since he was eight years old with his father, he has dedicated his whole life to growing corn and beans. He has spent 59 years dedicated to this. He says that it is a legacy his father left him with. 

He also has some small income from livestock because he sells at least one cow per year.

The loan will be invested in the purchase of agricultural inputs such as: fertilizer, fungicide, payment of the land he leases, and payment for labor for planting corn. The loan will improve things because he will have food well secured,

His intention is to continue working as long as God Almighty gives him license to live, and to continue harvesting, firstly the love of his children and secondly the corn and beans. With the loan, he will cultivate 7,000 more square meters of land than last year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and fungicide, to pay for the land that he leases, and to pay for labor for planting corn.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en: Elsie lives in Gango, Ozamis City with her family. She provides for her three children's needs from the little amount of PHP 6,000 she gains monthly from her transportation service business. Her husband is a driver. In 2012, she joined Gata Daku MPC and successfully repaid her previous loan that she used to improve her business. Recently, she borrowed a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase tires and spare parts. She saves a portion of her generated revenue to achieve her dream of sending her children to school until they finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase tires and spare parts

loans.name: Mimona

texts.en: Mimona is a 32-year-old married woman. She has three children and lives in Haja, Yemen. She didn't complete her studying. She is a housewife who tries to raise her children well. She feels embarrassed when guests come to her house because she doesn't have money to buy furniture. So, she applied for a loan of 60,000 YER (Yemen rials) from AMB to buy furniture to use for her house. She hopes to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy furniture to use for her house.

loans.name: Norway Group

texts.en:
Scolastica, who is in her late 40s, is a married woman with three children, two of whom are in school. For one and a half years now, Scolastica has been supporting her family, together with her husband, by running a retail shop selling different food and non-food items. She is doing great in her business. Scolastica starts working from 6:30 to 9:30 p.m. per working day and is able to win a good profit per month.
 
This is Scolastica's third loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used her previous loans to replenish more shop items, and has paid back all her previous loans successfully. With the return earned, she has paid for school and household expenses. She will use this loan to to buy more retail inventories: 20 kg of baking flour, 20 liters of kerosene, 50 kg of rice, 20 liters of cooking oil, etc. She dreams that one day, she will be able to build a house and own two big wholesale shops. 

She will share this loan with her loan group, Norway, which consists of seven members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more retail inventory: 20 kg of baking flour, 20 liters of kerosene, 50 kg of rice, 20 liters of cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Amin

texts.en:
Amin is a 27-year-old man who is married to Elon, a 26-year-old housewife. From their marriage, they have two children: Carli, a 4-year-old, attends the early childhood education center; and Monik, a 3-year-old.
 
Amin is an entrepreneur. He has been running a business of aquaculture of catfish at his house for the last two years, along with his father. He started the business using his own capital to build the fishpond, buy the fish seeds [fertilized eggs], and the woof. He buys a box of the fish seeds and raises the seeds in four months, then sells them. Usually he gets 20 kg of catfish each harvest and sells the fish to the retailers who come and pick up the fish. They sell the catfish in the amount of 30,000 IDR (Indonesian rupiah) each kilogram.  

Currently, Amin thinks of establishing a local cooperative by himself, but he lacks the money to do so. Therefore, he asks for an individual loan from TLM in amount of 3,000,000 IDR. The loan is used as additional capital for his new business and to buy the fodder for the catfish. He hopes that the new business will run well so it will enable him to repay the loan to TLM.

loans.use: to buy the fodder for the catfish and start a new business.

loans.name: Yosina

texts.en:
Yosina is a 54-year-old woman who is married to Melkias, a 50-year-old civil servant. They have two children: Beatriks, a 27-year-old in college; and  Agustin, a 21-year-old employee at a company. 

In order to generate her family income, she runs a poultry business. She started the business using her own capital in the amount of 2,000,000 IDR (Indonesian rupiah) to buy two boxes of chicks, medicine for the chicks and the fodder. The income is used to fulfill the family needs. 

Currently, there are 1,000 chicks in the stall, and she wants to purchase the fodder and also a better quality of medicine for the chicks, but she lacks the money to do so. Therefore, she asks for an individual loan from TLM in the amount of 3,000,000 IDR. The loan is spent to buy three boxes of the medicine and also the fodder for the chicks. She hopes that the business runs well, so it will help her to repay the loan to TLM.

loans.use: to buy three boxes of medicine and also fodder for the chicks.

loans.name: Karen Azucena

texts.es:
Karen es una joven, visionaria de 20 años de edad, esta soltera con ella vive, la abuela, la mamá y tres hermanos más.

Tiene experiencia desde hace 3 años, la mamá la esta responsabilizando para que, en el futuro se sepa defender en la vida, el negocio es comercio, ella vende en un cafetín frente a la escuela. Se a dedicado a este negocio, porqué parte del estudio lo esta pagando con las ganancias que obtiene del cafetín. 

El cafetín esta a 10 minutos de su casa, los  productos de primera necesidad; los compra en la ciudad, se traslada de su cantón a 5 minutos pasa un bus, de allí viajan una hora hasta llegar a la ciudad.

El préstamo que esta solicitando es,  para comprar arroz, frijoles, verduras, churros, gaseosas, jugos, pan, etc.
Con este negocio la vida le mejorara, porque ella ya estaría independizándose con este negocio; tendrá sus propios ingresos para a futuro  ayudarle a su mamá y a la abuelita que tanto le han ayudado a ella.     

A futuro le gustaría seguir estudiando prepararse, un nivel académico mas superior (universidad) y seguir trabajando muy fuerte para alcanzar los objetivos propuestos y en el negocio administrarlo muy bien para obtener lo esperado, la ganancia ahorrar para ir pagando el crédito y para ampliar popo a poco el negocio.
texts.en:
Karen is a visionary young woman. She is twenty years old, single, and living with her grandmother, mother and three sisters. Her mother is helping her to become responsible so that she knows how to fend for herself in the future.

Karen has 3 years of business experience. Her business is a small cafe, located right in front of the school, which is 10 minutes away from her home. She has taken on this business because she is able to pay a portion of her school costs with her earnings from the cafe.

Karen buys the basic items for her cafe in the city, which she reaches via a 5 minute bus ride across town and then an hour-long trip to the city. This business will improve her life because it is already enabling her to become independent and to make her own money. In the future she will be able to help her mother and grandmother who have helped her so much. 

In the future she would like to continue her studies to the university level and continue working hard to obtain her objectives. As for her business she would like to manage it well and to achieve her goal of saving enough money to repay her loan and expand the business bit-by-bit.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, vegetables, churros, sodas, juices, bread, etc.

loans.name: Rake

texts.en:
This will be Rake’s first loan. Due to the level of poverty that she has been in for a long time, she was not eligible for any loans up to now. “Now I can, thanks to lenders” is what Rake said smiling. 
Rake is someone whose roots are the mountains of the very northern part of the country. In Albanian these people are called “malesore.”   She is a mother of four children and wants to buy a dairy cow. “Where we live, the milk from any animal is delicious because of the wild grass the animals are fed,” said Rake.
Rake wants to buy a dairy cow and the amount she is requesting from Kiva lenders is 150,000 Albanian Lek (ALL).

loans.use: to buy a milk cow

loans.name: Kholdorjon

texts.en: Kholdorjon is hard-working man who lives in a rural area with his family. He is a father of two children. His wife is a smart woman who works as a teacher. Kholdorjon is the main breadwinner of his family. He has been busy with farming more than five years. He grows rice, onions and wheat. He has great experience and manages his business successfully. He makes additional income from animal husbandry. Kholdorjon wants to develop the business and maximize profit. With his profits, he plans to improve his living conditions and provide his children with a good education. He is asking for a loan of 5000 TJS to buy seed and mineral fertilizer. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is 23 years old. He lives with his mother and five siblings in a sector in Jordan called Mafraq, and his father is deceased. Mohammad is currently studying for a Bachelor of Computer Information Systems, 4th year. He is planning to expand his studies after graduation and get a Master's degree to be able to find a good job that will help him support his family financially after his father's death. He currently doesn't have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Fátima Del Rosario

texts.es:
Fátima es una joven muy emprendedora de 28 años y trabajadora a pesar de todas las responsabilidades que tiene, actualmente vive con su esposo en la casa de sus suegros suyos, y tienen un hijo de 7 años de edad que esta estudiando 2do grado en la escuela.
En 2007 Fátima comienza a trabajar, en la unidad de salud, como promotora de salud. Además, se dedica a vender productos de belleza, que comercializa con sus compañeros de trabajo y su esposo suyo trabaja en la PNC.
Con el préstamo se le estará ayudando, para comprar más productos de belleza y así pueda tener más ingresos para la familia.
Su hijo de 7 años de edad tiene problemas de audición y lenguaje, el sueño mas anhelado de Fátima es que su hijo suyo pueda oír y hablar muy bien.
texts.en:
Fátima is a very entrepreneurial young woman. She is 28 years old and works hard despite all the responsibilities she has. She currently lives with her husband and her 7-year-old son in the home of her in-laws.

In 2007 Fátima began working as an outreach worker in a health clinic. She also sells beauty products, which she markets to her coworkers and to her husband's coworkers, who work for the "PNC" [the National Civil Police force].

This loan will help her purchase more beauty products, which in turn will help her earn more money for her family.

Fátima's 7-year-old son is in second grade and has challenges with hearing and language. Her greatest dream is that he will one day hear and speak very well.

loans.use: to purchase more beauty products.

loans.name: Ma. Georgina

texts.en: Ma. Georgina is from Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City. She is 31 years old and is single. She buys and sells office and school supplies for a living. She also offers copying and encoding services to earn more income.  In 2008, Ma. Georgina joined GDMPC and successfully repaid her previous loans that she used to improves her business. Ma. Georgina is requesting a new loan of 15,500 PHP to purchase more office supplies and pay for machine maintenance. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more office supplies and pay for machine maintenance

loans.name: Zahida's Group

texts.en:
Zahida is a 43-year-old married woman. She lives with her spouse and five children in the area of Lahore. Her husband is a wholesaler of rice. He buys the rice from farmers at a low price and sells it in the market of Lahore city. He buys rice of various kinds such as basmati and super kernel. He has been in business for many years and has many reputed retailers who like to buy rice from him in large quantities. He has built a positive relationship with retailers and his customers provide word-of-mouth advertising. 
With new customers and higher demand he wants to buy rice in large quantities to meet the demand. In this way he would be able to increase his monthly income and savings as well. 
Zahida is the mother of four children. She hopes that her children will support her as she grows older. 
Zahida is grateful for your support and says thanks to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy rice in large quantities to sell.

loans.name: Vladimer

texts.en: Vladimer is 50 years old, single and lives with his retired parents in the small town of Borjomi. Vladimer works as a loader at the local flour store and earns a small wage. As the family has many expenses and existing funds are not enough to cover them, Vladimer decided to start a business. He requested credit to set up a cobbler shop. Vladimer used to work as a cobbler and has enough experience in this field. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages providing business start-ups and re-startups with credit on soft conditions to the country's vulnerable poor. They do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the received credit, Vladimer will purchase leather materials and all the needed tools for shoe-making. He will also repair shoes and get a profit. The new business initiative will increase the monthly income for the family. Their living conditions will improve, and in the future they will have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to start a cobbler shop to make and repair shoes.

loans.name: Elyn

texts.en: Elyn is married with two children and resides in Poblaion 3, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Her husband works as a security guard while she manages their own rice field to earn a living. She joined Gata Daku MPC recently and borrowed a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy fertilizer. She hopes to have an abundant harvest to increase their income to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Yusra

texts.en: Yusra was born in 1956. She is married and has six sons and daughters. One of her sons is in the military, and one of her daughters is a student at the university studying in her first year for a Diploma of Accounting. Yusra's husband has retired and is currently working as a school bus driver and she sells different types of pickles. So she has a weak source of income which is not helping her afford her daughter's upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she has applied for this loan to help her daughter get closer to her aim of graduating to work in her field of study and help her family financially.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter's upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Peacock Group

texts.en:
Epimack, who is in his mid 30s, is married with two children who are still going to school.  He has been running a GengeDuka (a retail shop selling fruits and vegetables) and in the same shop, he sells sugar, salt, beans, maize flour, cooking oil, cigarettes, baking flour, etc. He works from 5 am to mid-night daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.  

This will be Epimack's seventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to open the fruits and vegetables shop.  He continued to increase his business stock whenever he got a new loan.  He is doing great.  He has paid back all his loans successfully.  He used the profit to buy a radio and TV set, build a small house, pay household expenses and school fees.  He will use this loan to buy more fruits, vegetable and dry foods like sugar, beans, maize flour, baking flour etc.  He dreams of having a big shop to sell the same items in big qualities.

Epimack will share this loan with his loan group "Peacock", which has seven members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more fruits, vegetables, sugar, beans, maize flour, baking flour  etc.

loans.name: Taivanjargal

texts.en:
Taivanjargal, 37 years old, lives with his wife and daughter in a Mongolian traditional ger (a portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been offering taxi service to the local community for eight years. His wife is unemployed and his daughter goes to high school. 

Taivanjargal and his sister have recently decided to open a hotel. For this business, he is requesting a loan of 1000000 Mongolian Tugriks to purchase necessary items such as a shoe stand, bed covers, and mattresses. Running a hotel will help Taivanjargal generate more income for his family. He is a very hardworking individual who strives for better future.

loans.use: to purchase a shoe stand, bed covers, mattresses, and other items to open a hotel.

loans.name: New Africa Group

texts.en:
Ndika, who is in her mid 20s, is married with two kids, one of whom is in school and one is still a baby. For three years now, Ndika has been managing her family expenses by running a business selling charcoal. Ndika works from 6 am to 7 pm daily and is able to make a good return per month. From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is Ndika's 18th loan, which she will use to buy more sacks of charcoal and to start a shop business selling dry food. She used her previous loans to restock more sacks of charcoal and she has paid back all her previous loans successfully. Ndika used her business profit to buy land where she expects to build a house. She dreams that one day will be able to build a house. 
 
She will share this loan with her loan group" New Africa", which includes eight members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal and to start selling dry food.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert, 33 years of age, is married and blessed with two children. He's been in the transportation business, especially motorcycle transport, for almost four years.
