The members of Sinignessigui III are married women with an average age of 40 years and 6 children each. They all live in polygamous families in Korobarrage, one of the villages of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali.

The women are partnering with the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso in order to further their agricultural businesses during the rainy season. They are on their third loan with the organization, the previous loans having been fully repaid. 

The crop of choice for Kadiatou, pictured standing second from the left in the photo, is corn. With this loan, she plans to purchase labor, seeds, and the supplies to maintain her half hectare.

The harvest is sold at the village in Sikasso after harvesting, to a customer base made up of men and women. Kadiatou hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 105,000 francs CFA per field. This profit will allow her to pay back her loan and also to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: purchase labor, supplies, and seeds

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive en casa propia junto a su hija y  su compañero de vida quien se dedica la albañilería. Ella posee una tienda desde hace varios años, es una persona trabajadora, luchadora, con ganas de salir adelante a su familia, posee muy buenas referencias, la tienda tiene mucha demanda en la zona, ya que no hay mucha competencia y además es una zona muy transitada, gracias a estas ventajas logra obtener muy buenos ingresos, de esta manera y con la ayuda de su esposo ha logrado solventar algunos de sus gastos, la clienta  solicita un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería para su tienda como golosinas, sodas, dulces, granos básicos, aceites, café, etc. Y así poder  obtener mayores ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: The client lives in her own home alongside her daughter and her partner, who works in construction. She has a store which she has had for many years. She is a hardworking and determined person, who wants to move forward with her family. She has good references. The store has a lot of demand in the area, because there is not much competition and it is a well-trafficked zone. Thanks to these advantages, she is able to earn a good income. This way, and with help from her husband, she has been able to pay some of her expenses. The client is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise for her store like candies, sodas, sweets, dry grains, oils, coffee, etc., and this way be able to earn a better income and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy candies, sodas, sweets, dry grains, oils, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Jemimah

texts.en:
Jemimah is 30 years of age, married to Ambrose, and blessed with four children, age 13,11, 9, and 7. 

She runs a tailoring shop, a business she ventured into 10 years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 20,000. 

She wants to purchase an additional sewing machine and has requested a first loan of KES 20,000. The profit from her business will help her pay school fees for her children and repay her loan as well. Her dream is to open up a tailoring school to train young people.

loans.use: To purchase an additional sewing machine.

loans.name: Umar

texts.en:
Umar is a 42-year-old married woman. She is a mother of six children and is motivated to provide for her family.

She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last year. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts a good client list. Her husband is employed in a small factory and earns insufficient income to support his family alone.  

As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of PKR 35,000 to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. 

She is in her third loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to use part of revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Tanveer

texts.en: Tanveer is a 43-year-old married woman and a mother of six children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; currently she has requested a loan of Rs. 35,000 to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales which will ultimately help in generating more income for her. She is in her second loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en:
Samvel is 44 years old. He is married and has one son. Samvel lives with his family in Kapan. His wife doesn't work and takes care of their household, so Samvel is the only breadwinner of the family. He earns his family's living by providing renovation service to locals. He has been involved in this business for  2 years already and it helps him to cover daily costs and have a stable income. 

Samvel is asking for a loan to buy equipment and be able to provide his renovation services. Samvel has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. So this loan will assist Samvel to purchase the equipment which will greatly ease his work and he will be able to gain more customers.

loans.use: to pay for equipment for offering renovation services

loans.name: Vladimer

texts.en:
Vladimer is 42 years old and a married man. He lives with his wife and two children in a small village of Telavi district. His wife is a teacher and works at a local secondary school. Vladimer is actively involved in agricultural activities. In particular he has a vineyard and a plot of agricultural land, where different kinds of vegetables are grown. He works hard and has high quality produce which is sold to local retailers for a good price. But as the income is only seasonal and is not enough for everyday expenses, Vladimer decided to get a loan and start his own business. He sought credit among local financial institutions, but his attempts were unsuccessful because of his poor living conditions. 

The start-up program that is joint initiative between Kiva and Credo enables the rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. Vladimer's application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of $2000. With the received credit he plans to purchase a minibus and start dealing in fruits and vegetables. He will purchase fruits and vegetables from the wholesalers and then resell at a higher price. This will increase the income of his family. With increased income he will improve living conditions for his children.

loans.use: to purchase a minibus and start selling fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Fassodemeton Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  femmes de Fassodèmèton sont toutes mariées dans les familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 35ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Fambougou dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits equipements, de s’approvisionner en intrants agricoles, les membres du groupe ont connu Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème    cycle du prêt de campagne.
Madame  Wassa (1ère femme assise de la droite vers la gauche  dans la photo) compte utiliser son prêt pour labourer son champ, s’acheter des semences et d’engrais puis payer les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre la charge des enfants, et une partie de celle de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten women of Fassodèmèton are all married in traditional families. They have an average age of 35 years and 2 children each. The women all live in the village of Fambougou in the Ségou region (the 4th administrative region of Mali.) They came to know each other through their seasonal farming businesses, as neighbors, by way of marriage and as relatives within the village.

The women of Fassodèmèton farm groundnuts, millet, and rice. With the goal of purchasing small equipment and to stock up on farming supplies, the members of the group partnered with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their third farming loan. 

Wassa (the first woman seated from right to left in the photo) plans to use her loan to work her field, purchase seeds and fertilizer, and to pay young laborers to weed her field. The sale of her crops happens at the end of the rainy season to pay back her loan and ultimately to have funds to care for her children and her family.

loans.use: purchase small equipment, seeds, and agricultural supplies

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en: Alexander is 46 years old, married to Zeddy, and both are blessed with nine children. He has been in the motorcycle business for the last three years with the monthly income of KES 35,000. Alexander managed to get an asset loan from KADET LTD of KES 97,400 which he used to get a motorcycle as a means of expanding his business. He will use the anticipated profit to build his own rental houses. His hopes and dreams are to have a better life.

loans.use: To buy a motocycle

loans.name: Johanna

texts.en: Johanna is 56 years old, married to Damaris, and supports a family of five children aged between twenty-five and six years of age. He has been a maize and potatoes farmer for the last 20 years, earning a monthly income of KES 15,000. He is servicing a second loan of KES 25,000 from KADET which he intends to use to prepare the land for the planting season as well as to purchase seedlings. The anticipated profits will be used to diversify into sheep keeping. His future dream is to improve his financial stability.

loans.use: to prepare land for the planting season

loans.name: Jose Nicolas

texts.es: Don José de 37 años de edad, vive en casa propia  junto a su esposa y sus dos hijas de 11 y 9 años de edad  que estudian actualmente, él posee una tienda desde hace mas de 5 años es su lugar de residencia, es muy reconocido en el sector  ya que se encuentra ubicado en una zona muy transitada, es una persona muy responsable, honesta con sus clientes lo que la ha llevado a ganarse su preferencia. Él solicita un crédito para la compra de más productos para su tienda como refrescos, golosinas, granos básicos etc. Y así obtener mayores ganancias y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Jose is 37 years old. He lives with his wife and their two daughters, aged 11 and 9, in the house that he owns. His daughters currently study.  

For more than 5 years now he has operated a store that is located in his home. The store is well known in the area because it is located in a busy area. Jose is very responsible and honest with his clients, which has earned him their preference. 

He is requesting a loan to purchase more products for his store such as soft drinks, candies, basic dry grains etc. This will increase his earnings and improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, candies, basic dry grains etc.

loans.name: Juana Patricia

texts.es: Doña Juana de 31 años de edad, vive en casa de un familiar  junto a su compañero de vida y con sus dos hijos de 10 y 6 años de edad quienes estudian actualmente, ella se dedica al venta de enchapes y productos de oro, además vende productos por catalogo desde hace mas de 3 años, es una persona con muy buen carácter, honesta y muy dedicada  a sus labores, de esta manera ha logrado solventar muchos de sus gastos familiares. Doña Juana solicita un crédito para la compra de accesorios de oro para poder surtir mas su negocio como: pulseras, aritos y  cadenas  y así poder satisfacer la demanda que posee, y de esta manera obtener mayores ganancias para ofrecerle a su familia un mejor futuro económico.
texts.en:
Juana is 31 years old and lives in the house of one of her relatives with her partner and her two children, aged 10 and 6 years of age, who are currently studying. Juana has sold gold and gold plated products from a catalogue for over three years. She is an honest person of good character and is very dedicated to her work, which is how she has been able to meet some of her household costs. 

Juana is applying for a loan to purchase gold accessories such as bracelets, earrings and necklaces with which to re-stock her business. By doing so she will be able to meet current demand and obtain a greater income to create a better future financially for her family.

loans.use: to buy bracelets, earrings and gold plated chains in bulk

loans.name: Nver

texts.en:
Nver is married and has two children.  He lives in Azatavan village. Nver has been involved in agriculture for five years, but is already very skilled. He runs a farm which includes two pigs and two greenhouses. 

As agriculture provides the main income of the family, the enlargement of the farm is very important for Nver. One of his greenhouses is old and needs to be renovated. Unfortunately, Nver has no financial means to do so. The income he earns barely covers the family's basic needs. Nver is requesting a loan, which he will use to renovate his greenhouse and purchase pigs and forage. The loan will greatly help him to continue his farming business. Nver is sure that his hard work will bring him a profitable farm.

loans.use: to pay for the renovation of a greenhouse and purchase pigs and forage for feeding them

loans.name: Hiba

texts.en:
Hiba is 20 years old. She lives with her parents and three brothers in Zarqa, Jordan. Hiba is currently in her third year of studying for her Bachelor of Finance. Her aim is to work in her field after graduation to be able to support herself and her parents. 

Hiba is requesting a loan, which she will use to pay for her semester fees as her parents do not have enough money to do so.

loans.use: to pay for her semester fees

loans.name: Maria Ofelia

texts.es: Doña María de 53 años de edad vive con su esposo en casa propia,  la cliente posee una tienda en su lugar de residencia desde hace 15 años,  es una mujer muy trabajadora  y responsable tiene mucha clientela por la variedad de productos que tiene en su tienda, doña Maria está solicitando un crédito  para la compra de  granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, azúcar, sopas, etc.  y poder generar una mayor  ganancia y mejores ingresos para tener una mejor vida con su esposo.
texts.en: María is 53 and lives with her husband in their own house, where she has run a shop for the last 15 years. She is a very responsible and hardworking woman and she has a lot of customers thanks to the variety of products she sells in her shop. María is asking for a loan to buy basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, sugar, soap etc., which will allow her to generate a bigger income and have a better life with her husband.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, sugar, soap etc.

loans.name: Corina Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña corina de 55 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus tres nietos de 19, 18 y 14 años de edad ellos estudian actualmente, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, es comerciante de ropa vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, doña corina está solicitando  el crédito  para poder invertirlo en la compra de ropa por mayor y poder generar  mayores ganancias  y tener una mejor calidad  de vida.
texts.en: Corina is 55 and lives with her husband and three grandchildren aged 19, 18 and 14, who are currently in school. Corina is a very hardworking woman who works selling clothing door to door in the different communities around where she lives. She is asking for a loan to invest in buying wholesale clothing which will allow her to increase her earnings and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale clothing such as skirts, blouses, shirts etc.

loans.name: Roin

texts.en:
Roin is 34 years old and married, with a six-year-old son.  The family lives in the littoral city of Batumi, West Georgia. Roin is the only income provider in his household, and he works in a small workshop as a mobile phones mechanic. He works all day long to generate income, but his funds are unstable and hardly enough to feed his family.

That’s why Roin decided to diversify the business and purchase cell phones and accessories for selling from his workshop. All the financial institutions rejected his loan requests because of his unstable financial condition and lack of experience.  

After several unsuccessful attempts, Roin applied for the credit to MFO Credo. His request was approved in the framework of the Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses.  

A loan of US$3,000 will help Roin to purchase cell phones in bulk and sell them for a profit. Roin is very enthusiastic and a hard-working person with a great desire to ensure his child with a good education for progressing in life.  This credit will be a great support for the family. 

Roin is thankful to Kiva Lenders for giving him a chance to generate income.

loans.use: to purchase cell phones and accessories in bulk for resale

loans.name: Maria Lucila

texts.es: Doña Maria de 42 años de edad vive en casa de un familiar  junto con sus dos hijos de 17 y 15 años de edad y sus hermanos, ella se dedica a la elaboración de tortillas desde hace 15 años  su negocio lo desempeña en su domicilio  tiene mucha demanda sobre todo los fines de semana  también se dedica a la elaboración de antojitos por las tardes lo cual le tiene mucha demanda, es una  persona  muy trabajadora y responsable  amable y honesta con sus clientes  gracias a su trabajo a logrado solventar algunos de sus gastos,  ella solicita un crédito  para la compra de maíz por mayor   y gas para continuar  elaborando sus productos y obtener mayores ganancias de esa manera mejor su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maria, 42, lives in the home of a relative, along with her two sons, ages 17 and 15, and her siblings. She has worked making tortillas for 15 years. She carries out her business in her home. She has a lot of demand, especially on weekends. She also makes "antojitos" (street food like tacos, tamales, gorditas, etc) in the afternoons. These are in high demand. She is a very hard-working and responsible person. She is friendly and honest with her customers. Thanks to her work, she has been able to meet some of her expenses. She is asking for a loan to buy wholesale corn as well as gas to continue making her products and earn a better profit. This way, she will improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy gas and wholesale corn

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily is a 34-year-old woman. She has two children aged 3 years and 14 years. She describes herself as talkative. She operates a tailoring shop where she makes clothes to sell. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a commercial area and her primary customers are both men and women. She describes her biggest business challenge as lack of enough funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy threads, cloth sheets and other sewing materials. Her business goal is to have a boutique within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children up to graduate level. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy threads, cloth sheets and other sewing materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy furniture and equipment for her business.

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en: Rahab is a 39-year-old married woman. She has two children aged 6 years and 12 years. She describes herself as honest. She operates a school where she offers education to pupils. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a competitive area and her primary customers are pupils. She describes her biggest business challenge as lack of capital. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy cement, iron sheets, desks and other materials to build her own school. Her business goal is to own her own school within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM

loans.use: to buy cement, iron sheets, desks and other materials to build her own school

loans.name: Jossely Katicza

texts.es:
Jossely es madre de una pequeña de 2 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Ica y cada día trabaja como obrera  en un fundo de la ciudad, y con el fruto de su trabajo puede solventar con mucho esfuerzo, Jossely cree que está saliendo adelante porque es muy responsable  y sobre todo porque quiere salir adelante.

Jossely está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar materiales de construcción, para poder levantar una pared en la parte posterior de su vivienda, con lo cual podrá tener mayor seguridad en casa y también realizar unos acabados en el pequeño cuarto de su hija, de esta manera mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Terminar de construir su casa y poder darle una buena educación a su hija”.
texts.en: Jossley is the mother of a two-year-old daughter. She lives in the city of Ica and every day she works as a laborer on a farm in the city. With the fruits of her labor, she can meet expenses with a lot of effort. Jossely believes that she is moving forward because she is very responsible and above all because she wants to get ahead. Jossely is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to the help that they have provided, she will be able to buy construction materials in order to put up a wall in the back part of her home. This way, she will be able to have greater security at home and also put some finishes in her daughter's small room. This way, she will improve her family's quality of life and keep fighting to make her greatest dream a reality: "Finish building her house and be able to give her daughter a good education."

loans.use: to build a wall and improve her home

loans.name: Haya

texts.en: Haya is 22 years old. She lives with her parents and two brothers. She is studying for  her Bachelor of Children's Education, 4th year. Her aim is to start working in her study field after graduation to support her family financially as they are facing financial problems. They don't have enough money to pay for her semester fees. For that reason, she applied for this loan to help her get one step closer to graduation.

loans.use: To pay for her study fees

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en: Khaled is 21 years old. He lives with his parents and two siblings. His father is an engineer and his mother is a teacher. He is currently studying for his Bachelor of Accounting, 3rd year. Khaled's parents are for some reason facing financial crisis during this period, so they are not able to pay his upcoming semester fees. For that reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay his semester fees

loans.name: Kesia

texts.en: Kesia is a married woman. She has six children. She describes herself as creative. She operates a hotel where she sells bone soup. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a competitive area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge as lack of capital. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy meat, bones and other items. Her business goal is to own a big hotel within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy meat, bones and other items

loans.name: Antony

texts.en: Antony is a 30-year-old married man. He has one child who is two years old. He describes himself as dedicated. He operates a motorcycle transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a densely populated area and his primary customers are commuters. He describes his biggest business challenge as police harassment. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy another motorbike. His business goal is to own several motorbikes within five years. He hopes that, in the future, he will own a taxi. This is his second  loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy another motorbike

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is a 30-year-old married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows that produce milk. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a competitive area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. 

She will use the 45,000 Kenyan Shilling (KES) loan to purchase a piece of land. Her business goal is to own a big plot of land within 5 years. She hopes in the future to own a big piece of land for farming. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase a piece of land

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana is from Yenoqavan village where she lives with her family of 8: her parents, her two brothers, her husband and two children. Liana's family has been involved in agriculture for many years. Liana is a nurse by profession and works at a local military unit. Together with her work she is also engaged in agriculture. They keep livestock (2 cows, 24 sheep, and 20 chickens) and also cultivate corn, potato and grass. 
To tackle the family's financial hardship, Liana's husband and brother went abroad to find a job and support their family financially. But for now, agriculture is the main income source that helps this family to have a stable income and cover their daily costs. Liana is asking for this loan to purchase three calves to increase her livestock. She plans to grow them and use their milk in cheese production. 
Liana hopes that Kiva lenders will assist her financially and she will be able to gather income for her family.

loans.use: to buy three calves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools and raw materials (aluminum, copper, iron, glass) wholesale

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is 20, single, and lives in the Vani district with her parents and two brothers. Her elder brother works as a waiter at the local restaurant and her father is a cook. Both of the family members get small monthly wages. Nino's younger brother goes to secondary school.

The family owns a small plot of land and grows nuts for selling. The family lives under the poverty line and gets modest monthly social assistance from the government.

As their existing revenue is very small and is not enough to cover everyday expenses, Nino decided to start trading. She requested a loan from the local credit providers, but they usually demand some stable income from the borrowers. Nino's credit requests were rejected several times, as she didn't satisfy their requirements. 

She received this credit within the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo, called the Startup Program that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. With this loan of 1500 Georgia Laris (GEL) she will purchase clothing and household items at wholesale prices and resell them in her community door-to-door. 

It is obvious that the work is hard for Nino, but she is ready to deal with the vital difficulties and develop her business gradually. The Start Up credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and household items for resale

loans.name: Nubia Teresa

texts.es: Nubia, a sus 36 años de edad, es una persona afectada por nivel de desempleo que tiene el país actualmente, sin embargo, esto no la detiene y siempre va en busca de opciones que le permitan salir adelante y conseguir sus propios ingresos. Por esta razón desea abrir un negocio donde prestará el servicio de sala de internet, así aprovechará la ventaja que posee de vivir al frente de un colegio del sector donde reside y en el barrio no hay otro lugar que preste este servicio, no tiene competencia, es por ello, que ve en esta idea de negocio una fuente de ingresos favorable. Esto la motiva a solicitar el crédito, con la idea de invertirlo en la compra de activos fijos (computadores, sillas y mesas) para darle inicio a su proyecto, con el cual espera generar los recursos necesarios para apoyar a su familia con la economía del hogar.  Nubia sueña con fortalecer su negocio y hacerlo cada día más rentable y productivo, que le brinde la oportunidad de tener una estabilidad económica y mejorar las condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Nubia, who is 36 years old, is unemployed like so many in her country. However, this has not deterred her and she is always searching for options that will help her get by and earn an income. This is why she would like to open an Internet café. She will be able to take advantage of the fact that she lives in front of a public school and that no other business in her neighborhood offers Internet service, thus she will not have any competition. She feels that this business idea will be a favorable source of income. 

She is applying for a loan with the idea of using it to purchase computers, chairs and tables in order to get her project going. With this business she hopes to be able to generate the resources necessary to support her family's household expenses. Nubia dreams of strengthening her business and making it more and more profitable every day, which would allow her the opportunity to have economic stability and to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy computers, chairs and tables.

loans.name: Maryum

texts.en:
Maryum is a 24-year-old lady. She has been successfully running a business of flower-making for two years. She offers various colorful flowers for decorating homes and for events like birthdays, parties, etc. She sells the flowers to the people of her community and also offers them at the local market.  She has good communication skills and has a good customer list.

She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 25,000. She will use the loan to buy raw materials, such as fabric, glace paper and tissue paper, along with packs of paint in various colors. With these materials, she will be able to meet the increasing customer demand consistently. She wishes to spend part of her revenues to deal with the expenses of her family and another part to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for flower-making, such as fabric, glace paper and tissue paper

loans.name: Mwangangi

texts.en:
Mwangangi is a 23-year-old man. He has one child who is 3 years old. He describes himself to be talkative. He operates a carpentry shop where he makes stools, tables and cupboards. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His primary customers are both men and women. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the lack of enough funds. 

He will use the 20,000 Kenyan Shilling (KES) loan to buy timber. His business goal is to have a bigger workshop within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will educate his children to higher levels. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy timber

loans.name: Delphine

texts.en:
Delphine is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be aggressive. She operates a clothes store where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a potential area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be transportation. 

She will use the 20,000 Kenyan Shilling (KES) loan to add to her stock of clothes for resale. Her business goal is to be an importer within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a stable business.

loans.use: to add to her stock of clothes for resale

loans.name: Marindany

texts.en:
Marindany is a 31-year-old, married man. He has three children, with ages ranging from two years to nine years. He describes himself to be capable. 

Marindany operates a retail store where he sells tea leaves. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are small-scale farmers. He describes his biggest business challenges to be small capital and the dry season, which affects business. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more tea leaves for resale. His business goal is to be a tea farmer, selling his own tea leaves, within five years. 

He hopes that, in the future, he will grow three acres of tea leaves. This is his second loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance (SMEP DTM).

loans.use: to buy more tea leaves for resale.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is a 29-year-old single woman. She has one child. She describes herself as pro-active. She operates a dairy farm where she sells milk. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are small scale buyers. She describes her biggest business challenge as lack of enough money to buy animal feed. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a calf and dairy feed. Her business goal is to have pure hybrid dairy cows within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will have good living standards. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a calf and dairy feed

loans.name: Horonya 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  femmes de Horonya 1 sont toutes mariées dans les familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 49 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Kondia dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits équipements, de s’approvisionner en intrants agricoles, les membres du groupe ont connu Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème    cycle du prêt de campagne.
Madame  Alimata (1ère femme assise à gauche au bout  dans la photo) compte utiliser son prêt pour labourer son champ, s’acheter des semences et d’engrais puis payer les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre la charge des enfants, et une partie de celle de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group Horonya 1 are married women who live in traditional families. They average 49 years of age and 3 children each. They all live in the village of Kondia, region of Ségou (4th administrative region of Mali). They know one another as neighbors, through ties of marriage and kinship, and through the farming activities they practice during the rainy season. They grow groundnuts, millet and rice. 

They joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to buy small farming equipment and to stock up on inputs. This is the group’s 3rd loan cycle with the MFI. 

Mrs. Alimata, sitting at the far left in the photo, plans to use her loan for plowing, to buy seeds and fertilizers, and to pay the young people who will be  helping her with the weeding.  

At the end of the rainy season, she will sell her crop for cash. This will allow her to  repay her loan and to have some income to support her children and to help provide for the family.

loans.use: to buy small farming equipment, seeds and inputs.

loans.name: Oleg

texts.en:
Oleg is a 50-year-old, married man who lives in the Vani district with his wife, 19-year-old son, and school-aged daughter. Oleg is a farmer. He owns a plot of land where nuts are grown. He sells the harvest at the local open market. Besides, Oleg runs an animal husbandry business and has two milk cows, a calf and two pigs. The family makes cheese to sell with the milk. They sell the piglets seasonally as well.

As their existing revenue is very small and is not enough to cover everyday expenses, Oleg and his wife decided to start up a business. He requested a loan from the local credit providers, but they usually demand some stable income from the borrowers. Oleg’s credit requests were rejected several times, as he didn’t satisfy their requirements. 

Oleg received this credit within the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo, the so-called Startup Program that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. With this loan of 1000 GEL (Georgia Lari) he will purchase clothing and household items at wholesale prices and resell them among his community members. It is obvious that the work is hard for Oleg, but he is ready to deal with the difficulties and develop his business gradually. The Start Up credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and household items for resale

loans.name: Romer Wesley

texts.es:
Romer tiene 19 años de edad, el se encuentra estudiando la carrera de Técnica de Farmacia y para poder apoyar a sus padres a solventar sus gastos de estudio trabaja en una pequeña empresa atendiendo al público, el labora por las tardes, ya que por las mañanas va a su centro de estudio, Romer cree que le va bien en su trabajo y estudios porque se esfuerza mucho cada día para poder salir adelante.

Romer está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá comprar enseres para su hogar y mejorar su vivienda, ya que debido a las lluvias se encuentra en mal estado, así podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y seguir luchando para hacer realidad su sueño:” Estudiar la carrera de medicina”.
texts.en:
Romer is 19 years old and studies to become a pharmacy technician. In order to help his parents cover for the expenses of his studies, he works in a small company serving its clients. He works in the afternoon, since he goes to lectures during the morning. Romer believes that the job and the studies are going well because every day he puts a lot of effort into making progress. 

Romer is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because with the help they have offered him he will be able to buy materials for his house and improve his housing, which is in a bad state because of the rains. That way, he will be able to improve his family's quality of life and continue struggling to achieve his dream: "To study medicine".

loans.use: to buy materials for his house

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
Walter tiene 34 años edad, es padre de 2 hijos de 5 y 3 años a quienes ama mucho. Para poder solventar los gastos de su familia Walter trabaja como chofer de taxi y también tiene una pequeña bodega en al cual vende abarrotes, con el frutos de sus pequeños y humildes negocio lucha cada día por salir adelante.

Walter está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio de bodega como arroz, al por mayor, azúcar, entre otros y de esta manera atender a sus clientes mucho mejor, ello le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos y luchar por hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener su casa propia y darle una buena educación a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Walter is 34 years old and is the father of two children, ages 5 and 3, whom he loves very much. In order to be able to settle the expenses of his family, Walter works as a taxi driver and also has a small shop in which he sells groceries. With the fruits of his small and humble business, he fights each day to get ahead.

Walter is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they have given him, he will be able to buy merchandise for his shop, such as rice, bulk items, and sugar, among others. In this way, he can assist his clients much better. It will allow him to improve his income and to fight for the reality of his dream: to have his own house and to give a good education to his children.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Catherine Wanjiru

texts.en:
Catherine is a mother of five and a grandmother of three. She lives with two of her daughters who are still in school and the three grandchildren who belong to her late daughter. While her main source of income is from selling second-hand clothes at the local market, she also practices farming. She has two cows from which she gets milk and dung as a source of fuel for cooking. The dung is used together with the firewood to cut down the quantity of charcoal used.
Income from her business mostly goes to paying school fees for her daughters and grandchildren in addition to the small salary that her husband gets from his employment at a flower farm, as well as taking care of the family needs.
She learnt about biogas from her neighbor who also enjoys using biogas and approached our office for construction.  
Catherine will be able to save money previously spent on charcoal, kerosene and firewood, while using the dung more efficiently by tapping gas. Time spent on firewood collection will also be saved, enabling her to spend more time at her business and to increase sales. The bio-digester will also help promote a clean environment which is one of our MDGs.

loans.use: To construct a bio-digester

loans.name: Pricillah

texts.en:
Pricillah is a 40-year-old married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 3 years to 16 years. She describes herself to be innovative. She operates a cereals store where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in an area with potential. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of enough capital to expand. 

She will use the 20,000 Kenyan Shilling (KES) loan to add to her stock of maize, beans and other cereals for resale. Her business goal is to open a wholesale shop within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add to her stock of maize, beans and other cereals for resale

loans.name: Serengeti Group

texts.en:
Henrishi, who is in his mid 30s, is married with two children, one of whom goes to school and the other one is still small.  He Has been running two types of businesses.  He has a pub and a poultry business where he sells chicken broilers for meat.  He works from 3.00 pm to 11.00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Henrishi's 11th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to restock the missing items in the pub and bought chicken feed as well.  He has repaid all his loans successfully.  He used the profit to finish building his house, bought a car, and paid household expenses and school fees.  He will use this loan to replace the out-of-stock drinks in his pub and to buy more broiler chicks and chicken feed.  He dreams of making his business big.

Henrishi will share this loan with his loan group "Serengeti" with five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to replace the out-of-stock drinks in his pub and to buy more broiler chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Monaliza

texts.en:
Monaliza works hard to support her family. She is married, and she has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years.

Monaliza requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy spare parts and tools for the maintenance of her motorcycle. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and tools for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
As the married parent of two children, Erlinda works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Erlinda is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials for her fishing business.

Erlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for her fishing business

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura is a teacher with many years of experience teaching at local school. She lives in Meghri town with her husband and son. As well as her job in the school, Laura also runs a farm with her husband. They keep a cow and a calf, and Laura uses their milk in cheese production and sells to locals.
Realizing that agricultural income is very important for her family, Laura would like to increase it. She has applied for this loan. As this is Laura's first loan it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance-loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before, because they have no credit history. 
Thus, the loan is very important for Laura to increase her livestock by two more cows and increase the production of cheese. She hopes for your support.

loans.use: to buy two cows

loans.name: Levon

texts.en:
Levon is from Vanadzor town. He lives with his parents, grandparents, and brother. 

Upon returning from the army, Levon has decided to earn his living by selling different home products to locals. He owns a car through which he purchases the products from the city market and he sells them in nearby communities. Despite his young age, Levon has good communication skills and organizes sales very well. 

Now, to purchase a new stock of products, he is asking for this loan. The loan is important for him in order to be able to continue his retail business and gather more income for his beloved family.

loans.use: to purchase a new stock of home products to sell to customers.

loans.name: Bashkim

texts.en:
Bashkim is a 28-year-old single man who chose to be photographed in front of his dream transportation vehicle even though it’s not in his possession yet. 

“This is for good luck. The very first thing I do is that I pray when I need something, and then I start believing that whatever I prayed for is mine. And then, I literally work very hard toward it,” he said. “So, these are the steps I want to take for this one as well. A transportation vehicle will give me the opportunity to do what I love and make a good income out of it,” Bashkim continued.

Bashkim lives in the rural central Albania and is planning to start up his transportation business and get married soon.

loans.use: to buy a transportation vehicle

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco is married with four children. He is 50 years old, and resides in Tagulalo, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

In 2012, he joined Gata Daku  MPC and has successfully repaid his previous loans. Francisco used his last loan to purchase more coloring materials for his decoration-making business and additional capital for his business. 

His business is successful, and he is taking another loan to purchase more lampakanay string (made from a type of plant) because there were lots of orders and demand for this product. 

In the future, he hopes to be able to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more lampakanay string.

loans.name: Rubhee

texts.en:
Rubhee is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a farming rice business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies for her rice farming business.

Rubhee has been in this business for eleven years; she earns more income from selling vegetables.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now requesting a new loan to further build her businesses.

Rubhee has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. 

She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Raul Renan

texts.es:
Raul es un hombre de 48 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con su esposa y sus 4 hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, el es una persona muy amable y trabajador, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, Raul trabaja en su pequeño negocio de alquiler de habitaciones, tanto para estudiantes como para personas foráneas que trabajan en su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y trato amable.
Raul se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada terminara la construcción de 3 habitaciones adicionales, de esta manera continuara alquilando a mas personas, así pues Raul seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener un hotel.
texts.en:
Raul is a 48 year old man. He lives in the city of Pucallpa with his wife and his four children, whom he loves and who are his main reason for living. He is a very kind and hardworking person who dedicates all his efforts to getting his family ahead.  Through his own initiative, Raul works in his own business, renting rooms to students and also to foreigners who work in his city. He works everyday for about 8 hours, and he believes that things are going well for him due to his dedication and friendly manner.

Raul finds himself very grateful to Kiva lenders, because thanks to the help they have given, he will finish the construction of three additional rooms. In this way, he will continue to rent to more people. So Raul will keep on working and putting forth effort to achieve his dream of having a hotel.

loans.use: to build three rooms.

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en:
Ruzanna has been involved in agriculture for 11 years. She is a very hardworking farmer and does her best to sustain her children’s living.

Ruzanna took a loan from a local financial institution before and was unable to repay it, due to her family's weak financial situation and her unemployment. But after years of tireless work, she has been able to find a good job and owns a farm, which is profitable enough to cover monthly payments. Now, Ruzanna has been approved for a loan, within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. This loan is very important, for Ruzanna to enlarge her farm and to be able to improve her children’s living conditions. With the loan funds, Ruzanna will purchase calves and forage for feeding them, and will renovate her greenhouse.

loans.use: to purchase calves and forage for feeding them, and to renovate her greenhouse.

loans.name: Flor Rocío

texts.es: Flor tiene 35 años de edad y es madre soltera de 2 hijos. Vive con sus padres y actualmente se dedica a trabajar como independiente para generar sus ingresos por cuenta propia, para sostener a sus hijos, pues toda la carga económica recayó sobre ella, luego del abandono del padre de sus hijos. Su padre tiene un negocio donde vende chaquetas y cobijas ecuatorianas, pues ellos son del Ecuador, pero llevan 40 años radicados en el país. En un pequeño espacio del local, que su padre le cedió ella comenzó a vender ropa para hombre y en las tardes alterna la actividad en el almacén, con la venta de comidas rápidas, todo esto, con el fin de generar los recursos necesarios para brindar a sus hijos el sustento diario y darles la oportunidad de educarse. Flor es una mujer pujante, perseverante y muy trabajadora, trabaja incansablemente para que a sus hijos nunca les falte nada. Esto la motiva a solicitar el crédito, que será invertido en la compra de mercancía al por mayor (jeans, camisas, pantalones para hombre), así tendrá más variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes y satisfacer los gustos diversos. Esto se verá reflejado en el incremento de sus ventas y los ingresos que recibe por ellas;  además Flor sueña con ver su negocio fortalecido, sostenible y reconocido en el sector, lo que a mediano plazo le cambiará las condiciones de vida de su familia y podrá disfrutar con sus hijos, los frutos de su ardua labor.
texts.en:
Flor is 35 years old and is the single mother of two children. She lives with her parents and works independently to generate income on her own in order to support her children. She assumes all of the economic responsibility for her family since the father of her children abandoned them. Her father has a business in which he sells jackets and Ecuadorian blankets; they are from Ecuador but they have been living in Colombia for 40 years. He gave her a small space within his shop so that she could start selling men's clothing, an activity that she alternates in the afternoon with selling fast food. She does all of this with the goal of generating the resources necessary to give her children daily sustenance and the opportunity to receive an education.

Flor is a vigorous, persistant and very hard-working woman who works non-stop so that her children will want for nothing. This is the reason why she is applying for a loan: she will invest it in the purchase of merchandise in bulk (men's jeans, shirts, pants) and thus have more variety to offer and satisfy diverse tastes in clothing. This will be reflected in the increase of sales and profit. 

Flor dreams of seeing her business grow strong, stable, and well-recognized in the area, which over time will change her family's living conditions and she will be able to enjoy her children, the fruit of her hard work.

loans.use: to buy merchandise in bulk (men's jeans, shirts and pants)

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Erlinda works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell bread business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store.  Erlinda is borrowing PHP 29,500 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional bread to sell for her buy-and sell-bread business.

Erlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 27 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional bread to sell.

loans.name: Hala

texts.en: Hala is 23 years old. She lives with her family and her sister who works as a teacher. She also has a married brother. Hala is currently studying for her Master of Economics and Management Sciences, 1st year. One of the obstacles she is facing is transformation. Hala is planning to continue her studies until she gets her PhD. Her parents are currently facing financial problems that are not allowing them to pay for her upcoming semester fees. For that reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her study fees

loans.name: Gouwend Manegre Group

texts.fr:
Mme CHRISTINE représente le groupe GOUWEND MANEGRE. Mariée, elle est mère de 06enfants. Le plus âgé a 21ans et le moins âgé a 02ans. 01 va à l’école. Elle a 04 personnes en charge. 
Mme fait la transformation (dolo) boisson local  depuis 05ans. Elle s’approvisionne à Yagma. Ses clients sont les hommes, les femmes du quartier.
Elle veut s’acheter 04sacs de mil germé pour la préparation du dolo (boisson local).
Mme veut épargner  ses bénéfices. Elle ambitionne agrandir son activité et  améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Christine represents the Gouwend Manegre group. She is married and the mother of 6 children. Her oldest child is 21 years old; the youngest is 2 years old. One of her children currently attends school, and she has 4 people in her care.

Christine has been making dolo (a local beverage) for the last 5 years. She stocks up on supplies in Yagma. Her clients are the men and women of her neighborhood. She wants to purchase 4 bags of germinated millet for preparing the dolo. She wants to save her profits. Christine hopes to grow her business and improve the living conditions for her family.

loans.use: purchase 4 bags of germinated millet for producing "dolo" (a local beverage)

loans.name: Ma. Liz

texts.en:
Ma. Liz is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a bakery business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she earns additional income from a general store. 

She is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase ingredients for her bread production business, like flour, salt, and sugar. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she is requesting a new loan to further build her bakery business.

Ma. Liz has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college, in the future.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her bread production business, like flour, salt, and sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
For almost a year, Maria has sold hospital scrubs and uniforms for practitioners in the medical industry. Visiting medical sites, which she often does to recruit clientele, Maria informs current and prospective clients about her business, and sometimes sells the items on the spot.

Aside from contacting businesses, Maria works hard to get more clients and more business. Around the city of El Paso, she has relied on friends to spread the word of her business and has also taken matters into her own hands by releasing flyers and bulletins about her business around town. 

As a first-time entrepreneur, Maria, she knew she needed advice, so she approached nonprofit microlender Accion Texas Inc. for a loan.  Once she applied, Maria was swiftly approved for a Promesa loan, which allowed her to purchase inventory. With a new set of designs added to the line of uniforms she makes, Maria retained two jobs and has potential to generate more sales.

loans.use: to purchase inventory.

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur is a devoted father of two daughters (the middle two people in the photo). He is also a careful husband to his wife (the woman at the left of the photo). He has been involved in agriculture for many years. He owns a tractor and earns his living, in part, by cultivating his fellow villagers' arable lands. Artur rented a plot of land, where he cultivates his wheat.

Artur took a loan from a local financial institution before and was unable to repay it, due to his family's weak financial situation and his unemployment. But after years of tireless work, he has been able to find a good job and owns a farm that is profitable enough to cover monthly payments. Artur has now been approved for a loan, within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. This loan is very important for Artur, to enable him to purchase a cultivator and thereby increase his agricultural income.

loans.use: to pay for a cultivator

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
In a warehouse in Memphis, Tenn., Beverly runs a business where she mainly bottles hair care products and distributes them to local salons. Before she decided to become an entrepreneur and have her husband financially invest in the creation of E&R Wholesale, Beverly worked nine years for another wholesale company and realized she could do the same work on her own for a larger profit.

Her short-term plans are to expand her business enough to manufacture and sell to wholesalers, and later, hire employees to manufacture and sell. But currently, Beverly works with two full-time employees and one part-time worker, replacing raw materials needed to distribute her inventory to as many salons as possible. She even began selling body oils to salons, which complements her business. In the photo, she is packing body oils and standing in front of machinery that has manufacturing capabilities.

Once Beverly learned about nonprofit microlender Accion Tennessee, she decided to venture to them for a loan. Quickly approved, Beverly saved herself from dipping into business funds, which helped her keep operational capital for future use.  Beverly says without the loan, she would have to reduce the amount of work she can complete – even decline some orders – which would ultimately decrease her business income.

loans.use: to replace raw materials needed and distribute her inventory to as many salons as possible.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en:
Noemi is 45 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school.

Noemi works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like shampoo, milk, sugar, soap, etc..

Noemi has borrowed and paid back 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for nine years and also earns an income from food vending and pre-paid mobile load.

Noemi aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like shampoo, milk, sugar and soap.

loans.name: Silverio Jr.

texts.en:
Silverio is from Balintawak, Aurora. He is 43 years old, married, and has seven kids. 

Silverio owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting coconuts to sell. He has been engaged in his business for six years and earns PHP 12,000 a month. 

In 2011, Silverio joined GDMPC. He successfully repaid his previous loan, which he used to improve his farm.  Recently, Silverio is requesting a loan of PHP 30,000, which he plans to use to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. 

He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure

loans.name: Nehemias

texts.en:
Nehemias is 49 years old, married, and the father of seven children. His wife is a housekeeper and takes care of their children. Nehemias is in a service-based business, providing appliance repairs to the local community members. 

To earn a living, Nehemias repairs television sets, radios and other appliances. He has been in this business for more than seven years. He successfully repaid his previous loan from Gata Daku MPC, which he used to improve the business. 

Nehemias has applied for a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy more accessories used in repair services. Nehemias plans to expand and improve his shop for a better service.

loans.use: to buy more accessories used in repair services.

location.town: Bobongan, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Charlito

texts.en:
Charlito manages his farm business. He is 56 years old and married to a teacher. They are blessed with three children. 

Through his earnings in farming and the salary of his wife, their children successfully finished their college education. Now, his children are currently working abroad. 

Charlito shared that sometimes he receives remittances from his children to support his needs, but he doesn’t want to only rely on their support because, someday, they will have their own families to support. 

Charlito wanted to borrow a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy farm inputs, like herbicides, fertilizer, and pesticides. He hopes to earn higher income and save some of it to be able to support his agricultural business.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, like herbicides, fertilizer, and pesticides.

loans.name: Armando Jose Carlos

texts.es:
Armando es un hombre de 46 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial, el es una persona muy trabajadora, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; gracias a su esfuerzo Armando pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Educación Física.
Por iniciativa propia, Armando trabaja como profesor de educación física en un centro educativo de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y por el trato amable que brinda a sus alumnos.
Armando se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada mejorará su vivienda, el desea refaccionar y el piso de concreto de su hogar, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para tener una vivienda adecuada.
texts.en:
Armando is 46 years old, single, and lives in the city of Cañete in the Imperial district. He is a very hard-working person who puts all his effort into making progress. Thanks to his hard work, Armando was able to study Physical Education. He works on his own initiative as a Physical Education teacher in a school in his city. He works approximately 10 hours every day and he believes that it is going well because of his dedication and his kind way with the students. 

Armando is very thankful to the Kiva lenders, because their help will allow him to improve his housing. He wishes to repair the concrete floor of his house. He will continue to work and struggle to have a decent life.

loans.use: to improve his housing

loans.name: Jackeline Judith

texts.es:
Jackeline es una mujer de 28 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Pisco, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; gracias a su esfuerzo puedo estudiar la carrera profesional de Pedagogía Infantil.
Por iniciativa propia, Jackeline trabaja en una empresa de transportes de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y buen desempeño.
Jackekine se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada cercará su pequeño terreno, el cual en poco tiempo desea construir y utilizarlo como un local para ventas, así pues ella seguir trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su tienda comercial.
texts.en:
Jackeline is a 28 year old single woman who lives in the city of Pisco. She is hard-working, friendly and puts all her effort into get ahead. Thanks to her efforts she managed to study child pedagogy (the Art and Science of Teaching). Through her own initiative she works in a transportation company in the city. She works 10 hours a day and believes that it is going well due to her dedication and good performance.

Jackeline is very grateful to the lenders at Kiva. Thanks to their help she can fence her small plot of land. She plans to build on it and use it as a commercial location, so she can continue working towards her dream of having her own store.

loans.use: to build a fence around her plot of land.

loans.name: Razelou

texts.en:
Razelou is 30 years old and single. She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years, 

Razelou requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy additional piglets, feed and vitamins for her business. She has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF, to sustain her agricultural venture.

In the future, Razelou would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, feed and vitamins for her business

loans.name: Romanita

texts.en:
Romanita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for two years.  She earns additional income from selling rice. 

Romanita is requesting a loan from NWTF for 23,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods, noodles, eggs, soap, cream, etc. 

Romanita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to save enough money so she can send her children to school in the future.

loans.use: to purchase stock such as canned goods, noodles, eggs, soap, etc.

loans.name: Annalyn

texts.en:
Annalyn is 24 years old and married, with three children.   She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. 

Annalyn is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.  She has been farming rice for five years, and she earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: As the married parent of two children, Joy works hard to support her family. She raises pigs in the Philippines, and also earns additional income by running a general store. Joy has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 from NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her business. She has sustained her business with one prior loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs
